loans.use: to buy more tools, cell phones and accessories for the cell phones he sells.

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla is 37 years old and lives in a sector in Jordan called Baqaa. She is a married woman and mother of four kids.

Her husband Sami, who appears in the photo with Khawla, is working for a low income. She thought about helping her husband with the household expenses and started selling clothes at her home.

Now she wants to expand her business because of the high cost of living. Therefore, Khawla asked for a loan to buy a new collection of clothes to sell. She wants to increase her income to improve the standard of living for her children.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kermy

texts.fr: Kermy est âgé de 35 ans. Marié et père d’un enfant, il travaille dans le commerce de produits divers(CD, DVD, DVD player, etc.) au marché de Fontamara. Grâce à cette activité, il arrive à répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Il a déjà utilisé le microcrédit avec succès pour faire avancer son entreprise et fait une nouvelle demande de prêt dans le but d'augmenter ses stocks de marchandise. Kermy veut agrandir davantage son commerce et s’offrir de meilleures conditions de vie.
texts.en: Kermy is 35 years old. Married and father to one child, he works selling various products (CD, DVD, DVD players, etc.) at a major market. Because of this business, he is able to provide for the needs of his family. He has already used a microloan with success to help grow his business. He is making a new loan request with the aim of increasing his stocks of merchandise. Kermy wants to further grow his business and provide himself with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy some DVD players.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee, chocolate, and sugar.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a 55 years old, married, and has four children to provide for. To earn a living and to be able to help her husband in providing for her family's daily needs, she engages in crop production.

Her husband is a farmer, so they are helping each other in planting vegetables and selling them in the market.

Because of the increasing price of commodities nowadays, she decided to take a loan to purchase fertilizer for her vegetables so that she can be able to produce a good quality of her product that will generate more income.

Elvie’s plan for the future is to earn more profit to sustain the family's needs and to provide for the educational plan of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her vegetable production.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 76, a widow in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, she runs a store that primarily supports their family. Every day she never get tired of tending her store.

Arsenia is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She has religiously paid her obligations without records of default.

Now, she has taken another loan to purchase bags of cements and hollow blocks for her house repair. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May signed up for her membership with PMPC and availed herself of the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (variety) store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small-time borrower like her. May has been able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently, she is taking a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Babylin

texts.en:
Babylin is 34 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has four children now at their school age. Together with her husband, Babylin is engaged in a fishing and fish vending activity. They sell their catch at the market and to their neighborhood. The family earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month in doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing marine ply boards, marine nails, marine epoxy, and paints for their boat repairs. Babylin has been a member of PMPC for seven years already. In the future, Babylin hopes to acquire additional fishing boats.

loans.use: to purchase marine ply boards, marine nails, marine epoxy, and paints.

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en:
Augusta is 54 years old and married with four children. Augusta works very hard to provide for them.

Augusta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, etc.

Augusta has been in this business for five years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar energy system that will allow him to have access to clean energy and will improve his home life.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Her name is Maura. She is aged 52, and comes from the province of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Victor, her business partner, and has seven children of whom six are working and the youngest is in still in the elementary Level. They may not have the luxuries enjoyed by families living in first world countries but, like most Filipinos, Maura's family is happy and content living a simple life.

Maura has been running a small general store for more than twenty years already. She values her store for this has been their main source of income. It has greatly helped raise all her seven children. Although at time she has difficulty collecting receivables from some customers, she maintains her positive outlook and faith that God will provide for their needs.

To help sustain and expand her store she is seeking your help for a PHP 50,000 loan to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, canned goods, coffee, eggs, instant noodles, beverages, etc. She wants to make sure that her store has most of the essential food and household items to offer. She will be grateful and is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Maura's simple dream is to build her store into a big grocery store. She prays for a victorious and united family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for rice, noodles, cookies, beverages, and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 30 years old, married and lives in Brgy. 3, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She owns a parcel of land which she uses as a banana plantation. Her husband is unable to support the needs for their growing family, so she ventured into banana farming. 

To support her farming needs, she signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC. Recently, she is taking another loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase bags of fertilizers for her banana plantation.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers for her banana plantation

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio has mastered his hog raising business in Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. This is how he makes a living and is able to support his family.

He was at his lowest point when he didn't have enough capital for his business. When he joined PMPC, he was truly grateful to avail credit to fully support his business.

Just as he takes care of his hog raising business, so he takes care of his membership with PMPC. He wants to maintain his membership in good standing so he can always turn to them for any financing needs.

Now, the loan of PHP 6,000 will help him build a concrete pig pen that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: build a concrete pig pen.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a young married man. He is 27 years old and lives in a sector in Jordan called Marka. He is the only supporter of his family and he is responsible for one more new member after getting married. Besides his job and his crafts-making at home, Mahmoud started to make pickles at home to sell.

He is running the business by himself and it is working well. Now he is applying for a loan to help him expand his work and buy more tools and items he needs like cucumbers, lemons and more to make new kinds of pickles to increase his income and provide a living for his family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to make a larger variety of pickles.

loans.name: Nadeth

texts.en:
Nadeth is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nadeth is 39 years old and has two children who are in school.

Nadeth has a swimming pool rental business in the Philippines. Nadeth requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy supplies to make over her business.

Nadeth has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Nadeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make over her swimming pool rental business

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Melinda has been in this business for 10 years now and earns additional income from selling firewood.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a conservative woman. She asked her daughter Tahani to take her place in the photo. Nadia is a 45-year-old divorced and single mother of four children, one of whom is Tahani who appears in the photo instead of Nadia because she is a conservative woman.

Nadia is applying for the loan to help Tahani pay for her semester fees. Tahani is studying to get her Master's degree in Tourism. She was lucky to be able to study because she is the only family member that did. Tahani`s ambition is to find work in her field so her Mom can rest and help her siblings with their education.

loans.use: to pay her daughter Tahani's semester fees.

loans.name: Maria Auxilio

texts.es:
A sus 55 años, Maria tiene mucha energía y empuje para trabajar en su negocio de hotel.
Vive en una casa con sus hijos, esta casa es la que opera como negocio.

Actualmente enfrenta problemas en su negocio como la competencia.

Esto intenta contrarrestarlo con un mejor servicio y atención, es por eso que solicita un préstamo para la compra de muebles y enseres para, mejorar sus habitaciones.
texts.en:
At 55 years old, Maria has a lot of energy and spirit for working in her hotel business. She lives in a house with her children and it is in this house that she operates her business. 

Currently, she is facing problems with her business like having competition. She intends to counteract it with better service and attention. It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan to buy furniture and furnishings to improve her rooms.

loans.use: to buy furniture and furnishings to improve her rooms.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Susana works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and she earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Susana is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, and milk

loans.name: Liliana Patricia

texts.es:
Liliana es muy querida en su comunidad. 

Hace 10 años, Liliana buscó la independencia financiera y abrió su propio taller de confección. 

Su red de amigos, familiares y vecinos le apoyó con gran afecto y lealtad a lo largo de todo el proceso de iniciar un negocio. 

Ella está buscando un préstamo para comprar tela, hilos, botones, apliques, y una maquina de confección que incrementarán la capacidad de su taller. 

Está cumpliendo su sueño, el de levantarse cada día con la energía y la satisfacción de servir a sus clientes. 

Ayuda Liliana seguir viviendo el sueño!
texts.en:
Liliana is very loved in her community. 10 years ago, Liliana went in search of financial independence and opened her own tailoring business. Her network of friends, family, and neighbors supported her with great warmth and loyalty throughout the process of starting a business. 

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, overlays, and a sewing machine for tailoring that would increase the output of her business. She is achieving her dream of getting up each day with the energy and the satisfaction of serving her customers.

Help Liliana to keep living the dream!

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, overlays, and a sewing machine for tailoring that would increase the output of her business.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring and harvesting to earning income as well. Anastacia has supported her husband doing this type of work.  Like a farmer, Anastacia has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds so she will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.  Someday, Anastacia hopes to purchase more rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds so she will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Gerardo Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es un hombre con 45 años de edad, que junto a su esposa se dedican a la cría, cuidado y venta de ganado, un medio por el cual han logrado salir adelante y brindarle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de vacas y terneros, con esto espera aumentar sus clientes y de tal manera sus ganancias.

Su meta es seguir trabajando, pagarle el estudio a su hija y comprarse una vivienda, la cual le brinde una mejor estabilidad económica.
Sabe que de la mano de Interactuar y de los colaboradores del portal Kiva sus sueños se cumplirán.
texts.en:
Antonio is a 45 year old man who, along with his wife, makes a living in the breeding, care, and sale of cattle. This is a means in which they have achieved success and provided their daughter with a better quality of life.

He is requesting a loan which he will invest in the purchase of cows and calves. With this he hopes to increase his clientele and his income.

His goal is to continue working, pay for his daughter's studies, and buy a home that will provide better economic stability. He knows that in the hands of Interactuar and the Kiva contributors, his dreams will come true.

loans.use: to buy cows and calves.

loans.name: Sharapat

texts.ru: Шарапат, 64 года, не замужем, мать 4 детей. Она в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, начав свой бизнес 25 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Шарапат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 8 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья. Вырученные доходы от бизнеса Шарапат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Sharapat is 64, single, and the mother of four children.  As a way to provide an income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry for the past 25 years.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has two cows and eight sheep on her farm.  Eager to develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a few cows and increase her cattle headcount.  She is planning to use the earnings from her business to further increase her activity and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase cows in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Gift

texts.en:
Gift lives in Kampala, Uganda. She takes care of one additional family member. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include utilities and food.

Gift sells used s at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for one year. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT–SACCO to buy a bale of used shoes. Her major challenge includes seasonality of used shoes in the market.
Her goal and aspiration is to build permanent business premises.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used shoes.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg-E Group

texts.en:
Rina, a 33-year-old lady from Koraput district, is the featured borrower of Maa Laxmi SHG-E (Self-Help Group E). Rina is the one standing on the right in the photo. She lives with her husband who is a fisherman and two sons who are presently studying in primary school. 

Rina, being a strong and ambitious lady, started her candle-making business three years ago. She initiated this business because the area where she lives does not have access to a reliable source of electricity and people face a lot of problems undertaking their daily work due to lack of electricity.

Rina, along with her group member Sabita, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Rina will use her portion of the loan amount in order to purchase raw materials for her candle-making business such as wax, thread, a stove, and to renovate her old machine so as to increase her work efficiency, so that she will be able to get a higher amount of output and serve a larger section of society who are deprived of electricity.

Rina aspires to build a big factory and engage women in her nearby village to help her in making candles in her factory, which will result in the rise of her income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her candle-making business like wax, thread, a stove, and to renovate her old machine

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg-C Group

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Manjula from Koraput district. She is the featured borrower of Laxmi SHG-C (Self-Help Group C). She is the one standing on the right-hand side in the photograph. She is married and has three children aged 19, 23, and 25 years. She has two additional dependents who live with her; she assists them in their education and takes care of their well-being.

 In 2012, Manjula established her grocery store, selling items such as sugar, milk, jam, pickles, soaps, detergents, flour, corn flakes, etc. She began her business because she wanted to take care of her family and improve their living standard.

Manjula, along with her group member Gouri, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Manjula will use her portion of the loan amount in order to renovate her shop, so that she will be able to stock a larger quantity of items for sale and meet the demand of the customers with her products and gain customer loyalty by providing them with a high quality of service.

Manjula aspires to have her elder daughter married in a joyous manner with pomp and ceremony, and installed in a well-settled house in the future.

loans.use: to renovate her shop, so that she will be able to stock a larger quantity of items for sale

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg-F Group

texts.en:
Sunita is 36 years old, married, and has three school-going children. She is the featured borrower of Maa Laxmi SHG- F (Self-Help Group F) and is the one standing on the left. Sunita comes from  Koraput district, and is characterized by her sense of responsibility, her hard-working attitude and her dreams of self-improvement. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, this young mother wasn't able to finish her education and now she fights day by day to provide her children with the life opportunities which she couldn't have. She fights to get ahead with her business, improve it, get more customers and satisfy their demand.

Thanks to her drive to get ahead, she owns a business which is a small tea stall near her village locality. Her business consists of selling breakfast, tea, bread, eggs, chocolates, soft drinks, biscuits and sandwiches. She is motivated by her need to have an income which allows her to support her young children and acquire her economic independence.

Sunita, along with her group member Tapaswani, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR from Kiva’s partner, Peoples Forum. Sunita will use her portion of the loan amount to invest in working capital and to stock her small stall so that she can maintain her customer base, and perhaps in the not so distant future, she will be able to obtain a better income and provide better education to her children.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock her small shop so that she can maintain her customer base

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati is a resident of a remote region in Falakata. She is 39 years old and studied up to grade 5. Now she is married and a mother of a small daughter.

Saraswati is a housewife and her husband is a farmer by occupation. He grows varieties of seasonal vegetables in their farmland.  Saraswati helps him in farming activities especially at the time of harvesting and selling. His family's primary income comes from growing different vegetables.  They need to earn more to meet all the costs of the family. Now they plan to cultivate teasel gourd, which is a profitable vegetable in the summer season. They need financial help. 

Saraswati applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs to cultivate teasel gourds. Saraswati strongly believes that the loan’s profit will enable her to upgrade the family financial status. 

She will be ever grateful to BJS and Kiva for the financial help.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs to cultivate teasel gourds.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Laxmi, who is a 42-year-old widowed woman, lives in Koraput district. The lady standing to the right side in the photo is Laxmi. She has three sons who are temporarily unemployed. Laxmi is the only breadwinner in the family who has a stable job and gets a fixed salary. She works as a peon in a nearby primary school. 

Her family, and especially the sons, requires additional income for progressing in life. Laxmi has a great desire somehow to increase the income of the family and has requested a loan for starting an additional business. 

Laxmi, along with her group member Tuni, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Laxmi will use her portion of the loan amount to start her new tailoring business. The loan amount will be used for purchasing a second hand automated sewing machine, colourful threads, cloth materials, oil for the smooth running of her machine, and other materials required for this business. 

She hopes that this business will fetch her higher income as there is no other tailoring shop in the 5km radius from her house and enable her in attaining financial stability.

Laxmi aspires to build a new house from her additional income that she will get from her tailoring business, so that she will live a safe and secure life with her sons and she won’t have to bear the daily tantrums of her landlord.

loans.use: to buy a second hand automated sewing machine, colourful threads, cloth materials, and oil for the smooth running of her machine

loans.name: Mother Teresha Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Ranjita, standing right in the photo, hails from the village of Christianpeta in Koraput district, Odisha. She is currently working at a local factory near her home and brings home an average income of 4,000 INR per month. She has found that her current income, from which she also saves diligently, is not enough to provide a quality life for her family and children, let alone cover costs for her daily needs. 

Determined to provide for a better life for her children, Ranjita and her group member Christi decided to seek a loan to start their own micro-enterprise where she will start making candles and start supplying to the nearby areas. Ranjita, together with Christi, seeks a loan of 36,000 INR for the group, from which Ranjita's loan will assist her to buy raw materials and get training. 

Ranjita will start her business while continuing her work at the factory allowing her to repay the loan smoothly. Your loan will enable Ranjita to start a candle making business. Your loan will empower these two women to provide a better life for themselves and their families. Your loan will support not only these women, but also their families, to continue to stay determined and fight for a better tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her micro enterprise and get training for the same.

loans.name: Pramila

texts.en:
A mother of three children Pramila lives with her family members in Parangerpar village in Alipurduar, West Bengal. In her childhood she was deprived of education due to family issues. Pramila, 39 years old, is a homemaker and devotes her time to look after the household. She is blessed with a daughter and two sons. Her husband works in a hair cutting salon. 

Her only daughter, 18-year-old Pinki, is studying in grade 11 at Falakata Girls High School. She is a very ambitious girl and wants to build her career in the teaching profession. She is very eager to enroll her name in a B.Ed. (Bachelor of Education) coaching center in future. With an average income per month her parents cannot effectively support the needs of her daughter's grade 11 education but Pramila also wants to give her daughter higher education to see her in a good position in society. Due to poor resources, Pramila has asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). 

Accessing the education loan, Pramila will pay her daughter’s educational fees and purchase study materials for her present academic year and a bicycle , which will save her daughter's conveyance costs. Now Pinki will be able to continue her education further. 

Pramila and Pinki (seen in the picture) thank their lenders.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's continuous education fees, study materials and a bicycle.

loans.name: Soma

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Soma is a homemaker and mother of one son. She is married to Biswajit, and they live at Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district of West Bengal. Her husband is engaged in a shoe selling business, and his income is barely enough to cover the education cost of his son after managing all the household expenses.

Soma's only son Subhajit, 11 years old, is studying in grade seven at Dhupguri High School. He is a student of average intelligence and passed his last exam with average marks. He has a long-cherished dream to be a teacher as his profession. So, he wants to continue his study further and needs all the educational expenses, which his parents are unable to afford.

So, his mother Soma is requesting an education loan from BJS, a Kiva partner, to bear the education expenses of her son. She will pay the tuition fees and purchase other necessary study materials, a school uniform, and a bicycle for her son to save on his conveyance charges.

Soma and Subhajit (in photo) express their gratitude towards BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase necessary study materials and pay all schooling fees for her only son.

loans.name: Fulan

texts.en:
Fulan is a 42-year-old married woman from Kandi. She is illiterate but can sign her name only. She is married to Rejaul, who is a driver by profession. His income is inconsistent. This couple is blessed with four grown up children (two sons and two daughters). Their one son is a mason, another is working in a small company, one daughter is married and another is unemployed. 

To give financial support to her family, Fulan runs her own dairy business. She sells cow milk to her neighbors. She has one cow. Now she wants to expand her business. The additional cow will grow her asset base and increase her income through milk production. The cow will also help in getting cow dung, which she sells as fertilizer to the farmers.

With the aim to satisfy her customers’ demands, Fulan seeks to take a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to buy a new cow. With the expansion of her business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Fulan wants to strengthen the family economy and dreams to build a concrete house for her family’s well-being.

She is thankful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 61 years old, married and lives at Lopez Jaena-Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from her neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in the profit upon their sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending on their agreement.

With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through Pauglam PC, she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy additional bags of animal feed.

She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Gloria Ines

texts.es:
Gloria, a sus 59 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y pujante; pues siempre va en busca de alternativas que le permitan progresar. 

Desde hace 20 años se dedica a trabajar en el campo de la confección, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y poco a poco fue perfeccionando su técnica y ampliando sus conocimientos por medio de la práctica, esto la impulsó para iniciar su propio taller, para lo cual adecuó un espacio en su casa y con unos ahorros que tenía compró sus primeras máquinas. 

Trabaja dos empleados todos los días durante 12 horas, dependiendo de la cantidad de trabajo que tenga; así ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar. 

El crédito que solicita en apoyo con la Corporación Interactuar es para el fortalecimiento de su labor, pues con el dinero comprará insumos como hilos, con los que mejorar su inventario y tendrá más materia prima para trabajar.
 
Gloria manifiesta que su mayor desafío es el alto costo de los insumos para trabajar, sin embargo esto la sigue motivando para seguir prestando un mejor servicio y luchar para que el sueño de la acreditación de su negocio se haga realidad y le permita generar oportunidades de empleo, así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de las personas que influyan en la labor.
texts.en:
At 59 years old, Gloria is a hard working and vibrant woman. She always searches for alternatives that will allow her to progress. 

For 20 years she has made a living in the garment making field. She learned this trade by observation and little by little she improved her technique and expanded her knowledge through practice. This motivated her to open her own workshop for which she adapted a space in her home and with some savings that she had, she bought her first machines. 

Two employees work 12 hours daily, depending on the amount of work there is. This is how she has been able to generate enough resources to settle the household expenses. 

The loan she is requesting with the support of Interactuar is for the strengthening of her business. With the money, she will buy supplies like thread which will improve her inventory and she will have more material to work. 
 
Gloria states that her biggest challenge is the high cost of supplies to work. However, this continues to motivate her to keep giving better service and fight for her dream of the certification of her business to become reality and allow her to generate employment opportunities. This way she will improve her quality of life and also of those who affect the work.

loans.use: to buy supplies like thread, with which she will improve her inventory and have more material to work.

loans.name: Diana Yasmid

texts.es:
Diana es una señora con 30 años de edad, casada y madre de dos menores, que junto a su esposo se dedican a la cría, cuidado y posteriormente venta de ganado, un medio por el cual han logrado salir adelante como familia y empresarios.
Esta señora trabaja todos los días durante 5 horas diarias.

Solicita un crédito el cual lo invertirá en la compra de unas vacas que la hacen falta y hará unos arreglos que sus establos ameritan, con esto espera aumentar sus clientes y de tal forma mejorar sus ganancias.

El sueño de esta pareja es seguir trabajando para pagarle la educación a us hijos y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, pue ellos son el motor para seguir luchando día a día
texts.en:
Diana is 30 years old, is married and has two young children. Along with her husband, she earns a living rearing livestock and then selling it. It is a way through which they have managed to get ahead as a family and as businesspeople. 

She is asking for a loan to buy some cows that they are lacking and she will also make some repairs to her barns, which they deserve. With this she hopes to increase her number of customer and thus improve her earnings.

The dream of this couple is to continue working to pay for the education of their children and give them a better quality of life as they are what keeps them fighting day after day.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Zulma Maribel

texts.es:
Zulma, de 50 años de edad, no fue a la escuela, tuvo 6 hijos, de los cuales solo los dos menores están con ella, porque los demás están acompañados.

Zulma, se dedica a la crianza de gallinas de engorde, también siembra maíz para consumo; tiene 6 años criando pollitos pequeños para luego venderlos a un mejor precio.- Zulma, llega a sus cultivos a pie porque están a 20 minutos de su casa y lleva a sus dos hijos menores a trabajar, desde las 6:00 a.m. y regresa a las 2:00 p.m. a cuidar de sus gallinas.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar 100 pollitos de engorde y un quintal de concentrado para ellos.

Sus sueño son, ampliar su negocio y algún día podrá tener una granja grande.
texts.en:
Zulma is 50 years old and did not go to school. She has 6 children; the youngest two live with her, the others are married. 
She makes a living selling broiler chickens, she also grows maize for food. For six years she has been rearing chicks which she then sells for a profit. 

From 6:00 am she walks about 20 minutes to her crops to work, accompanied by her two young children . At 2:00 pm she returns home to attend to the chickens.The loan will be used to buy 100 broiler chickens and 46 kilos of chicken feed. Her dreams are to grow her business and to be able own a large farm one day.

loans.use: to buy 100 broiler chickens and 46 kilos of chicken feed.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Scovia works seven days a week. She would like to buy a plot of land in the future. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Angella

texts.en: Angella is widowed with three children, all attending school. She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for 10 years.  She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy crates of beer, a jerrycan of local brew, and spirits. She sells on a retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include defaulters and thieves. She aspires to buying a fridge and also stocking more drinks in her bar. She resides in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer, a jerrycan of local brew, and spirits.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all attending school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has been selling charcoal from home, both wholesale and retail, for 11 years, working seven days a week. She also earns additional income from her rental houses. She has requested a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to build more rental houses. Sarah lives in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is married with six children and all go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members. She operates a beauty salon at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy weaves, braids, shampoo, and hair relaxers.  She works seven days a week.  She would like to set up a bridal shop and also buy a plot of land. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy weaves, braids, shampoo, and hair relaxers.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en: Zaina is married with five children, all attending school. She has additional family members. She operates a shop on a retail basis, and she has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy cooking oil, beans, flour, boxes of soap, sugar, rice, and crates of soda. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality. She would like to buy a plot of land and build rental houses. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, beans, flour, boxes of soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ayisa

texts.en: Ayisa is married with one child who attends school. She has been operating a beauty salon business for eight years. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy boxes of cream relaxers, shampoo, weaves, braids, and hair treatments. She gets additional income from selling used clothes. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenge is 'on and off' electricity. She would like to buy a plot of land in the future. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy boxes of cream relaxers, shampoo, weaves, braids, and hair treatments.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty is a widow with five children. She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis, seven days a week. She has been in this business for 20 years. Her major challenges include seasonality and thieves, which affect the profitability of the her business. She generates additional income from rental houses.  She has requested a loan in the amount of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She lives her own house with no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is married with seven children, four of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells crafts at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for many years. Eva has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy materials for making crafts. She works six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She would like to buy a machine for making bark cloth and other crafts. She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy materials for making crafts.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista is married with seven children, four of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells fruit and vegetables at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for many years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy tomatoes, onions, cabbages, pineapples, and mangoes. She sells on a retail basis six days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses, and aspires to build more houses. She resides in her own house and family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions, cabbages, pineapples, and mangoes.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca lives in Kampala, Uganda. She takes care of additional family members. She has been operating a beauty salon at the market for four years. Rebecca has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy weaves, hair relaxers, and braids. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She would like to buy a plot of land in the future. She resides in the family home and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, food, and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy weaves, hair relaxers, and braids.

loans.name: Peruth

texts.en: Peruth is a single mother of six children, three of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal, and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, mangoes, onions, and tomatoes. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality of food. She aspires to buy a plot of land in the future. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, mangoes, onions, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a single mother of three children, all attending school. She also takes care of additional family members. She operates a grocery shop at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for the last year. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bag of flour, sugar, beans, cooking oil and boxes of soap. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler. She resides in the family home and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy a bag of flour, sugar, beans, cooking oil and boxes of soap

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty is a single mother of four children, all attending school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells firewood from home and has been in this business for two years. Resty has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more firewood for resale. She generates additional income from selling maize. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to own a delivery van to make transportation easier. She resides in the family home, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for resale.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en: Aidah is married with three children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells fruit and vegetables and has been in this business for one year. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy tomatoes, onions, and bunches of green bananas. Aidah generates additional income from poultry farming.  She works from home and sells to all categories of people, on a retail basis, seven days a week.  She is aspiring to build rental houses. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital for her business. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family, and utilities.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions, and bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is single with one child. She has additional family members. She sells chips at the market and has been in this business for one year. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bag of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and spices.  She gets additional income from working at the factory in the evenings. She works seven days a week. She aspires to set up a restaurant serving different kinds of dishes. Sarah resides in a rented house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy a bag of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, and spices.

loans.name: Bibikhonum

texts.ru: Бибихонум молодая и активная девушка. Ей 26 лет. Бибихонум развелась с мужем и у неё есть один сын. Бибихонум живёт с родителями и сестрой. Она с сестрой помогает родителям. К сожалению они не получили высшего образования, однако у них есть собственный бизнес. Её сестра зарабатывает шитьем, а сама Бибихонум занимается куплей и продажей различных видов тканей. У Бибихонум есть положительная черта. Она обращается со своими клиентками очень вежливо. Поэтому все её любят и всегда обращаются только к ней. Сейчас Бибихонум особо нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить новые ткани для расширения своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Bibikhonum is a young and active woman. She is 26 years old, divorced from her husband and has one son. Bibikhonum lives with her parents and sister. She and her sister help their parents. Unfortunately they did not receive a higher education, however they have their own business. Her sister does the sewing, and Bibikhonum herself works buying and selling different varieties of fabric. Bibikhonum has many positive traits, and is very polite to her clients, therefore everyone loves her and will only ever go to her. Now, Bibikhonum needs a loan in order to buy new fabrics for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Shikha

texts.en:
Shikha is a 33-year-old housewife who lives at Dhupguri with her husband, Pradip, and three children (two sons and one daughter). Her sons are preschoolers but her daughter is now attending school. Shikha is a homemaker and her husband is associated with a small job in a photo shop.

Shikha and her husband both have higher secondary level education. As they could not continue further education because their parents could not afford it, she is very much interested to educate her children and help them become established.

Her daughter, Dipanwita, 15 years old, reading in grade 10 in Bairatiguri Uccha Bidyalay (XII), is a very intelligent student and her good performances in school examinations inspire Shikha to provide her all the educational support she needs to continue her study. She plans to provide better education to Dipanwita to establish her as a teacher in future. But their household income is not sufficient to meet her all educational expenses. For that Shikha applied a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner).

She will use the loan amount on school fees, coaching fees and to purchase dress and necessary books for her daughter. She strongly believes that her daughter can continue her education without any obstacle and reach her goal with this financial support.

Shikha and her daughter, Dipanwita (as in the picture), are very much grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to bear the cost of her daughter’s education.

loans.name: Tarini Group

texts.en:
In the year 2015, 14 self-dependent women of Malpada village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India, formed a group named Tarini. All the group members are from poor families. Their main objective is to expand their existing businesses and develop their social livelihood by taking loans from Mahashakti Foundation.

Rukmani is the most active lady of the village and has taken the leadership to form a self-help group. The lady is about 37 years old, standing in the second row fourth person from the right with raised hand in the photo.

She is a cheerful lady with high ambition. Her family consists of her husband and three children.

For the last 10 years, Rukmani’s family has been engaged in a milk business with the help and support of her husband. She also has a small grocery shop, with a very small investment, running from her home. It shows that Rukmani is very active and wants the overall improvement of her family.

The monthly income of her family is about INR 6,800. But the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family. So she decided to raise her income by purchasing two more cows through the loan. She will also repair the cattle shed.

Through this investment, Rukmani hopes to generate a handsome extra income. She has a dream to save enough for the better education of her children and construction of a good house.

The other 13 members of the group are engaged in various small businesses like grocery shop, animal trading, vegetable vending, seasonal items and stone cutting.

loans.use: to purchase two more cows and also repair the cattle shed.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is married with two children and all go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members.

She operates mobile money services, and she also sells phone accessories in her home area and has been in this business for 4 years.

Prossy has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy SIM packs, Airtime, and phone accessories.  She works seven days a week.  She would like to be the leading mobile service provider in her home area.

She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy SIM packs, Airtime, and phone accessories

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is married with five children and all go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members.

Sauda sells fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for 2 years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy boxes of tomatoes, onions, cabbages, sweet potatoes and mangoes.  Sauda works seven days a week. She would like her business to expand and to become a wholesaler.

She resides in a rented house with access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of tomatoes, onions, cabbages, sweet potatoes and mangoes

loans.name: Rasanara

texts.en:
Rasanara is a rural housewife, hailing from Dupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri, West Bengal. She is 41 years old and blessed with four daughters and a son. Among them, three daughters are married; a daughter and the only son are still students.

Rasanara is illiterate and knows how to sign her name, but she is willing to provide her youngest daughter a good education and desires that she does not face any obstacle in receiving education.

Rasanara's husband has been engaged in a goat-selling business to earn their livelihood. He buys and resells goats and cows, which brings home a limited income per month.

Rasanara's daughter, 11-year-old Sheli, reads in grade 5 in Purba Magurmari Junior High School. She is a confident and intelligent girl and would like to score well in her examinations. So she tries to prepare from the very beginning and needs to enroll for coaching classes to pursue good education. But her parents can't afford her educational expenses for their poverty.

To make her daughter's dream possible, Rasanara is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. This loan will help her towards paying her daughter’s school fees and will ensure Sheli gets access good coaching, which will build a strong academic foundation and ensure her a bright future.

Rasanara and Sheli (as per photo) are very much grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the school fees and buy necessary articles for her daughter's education in grade 5.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is a rural housewife of 46 years, living in a small village in Dhupguri with her family of five. Her husband is engaged in agriculture and his sole income is hardly enough to meet the household expenses and educational expenses as well.

She is blessed with three children (two daughters and a son). Minati studied only up to grade 5 due to her family's financial insufficiency. So she is determined to impart the best education to her children. Her elder daughter is married and the other two children are studying in different grades.

Her daughter, 18-year-old Pratima, is pursuing her Bachelor of Arts education from Sukanta Mahabidyalay. Being meritorious, she is studying in first year with arts subjects. But now she wants to enroll herself in coaching classes to do better in her final exams. All the expenses of her daughter’s course fees and the cost of books have come up to such a high amount that it becomes impossible for Minati to afford the cost with her poor financial background.

So Minati has taken out a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner. She wants to use the loan to pay her daughter’s college fees and private tuition fees and to purchase all the necessary educational materials so that her daughter can go ahead with her studies without any interruption. Minati wants to fulfill her daughter’s dream of being a good nurse in future.

Minati and her daughter, Pratima (in the picture), are very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for their loan.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's educational expenses.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married with one child.  She has no additional family members. 

Rebecca sells used clothes. She has been in this business for many years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. 

She moves door-to-door selling used clothes and sells on a retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. Rebecca aspires to own a permanent business premise. 

Rebecca resides in a rented house. Her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, food, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Martin tiene 46 años y vive en una comunidad de Olanchito, Honduras con su esposa y sus siete hijos  y juntos luchan cada día para dar un mejor porvenir a su familia. Caminar una hora para tener acceso a cargar un teléfono celular y tener que gastar mucho en velas y lámparas de mano, es algo que Martin ya no quiere hacer, porque toda su vida ha carecido del servicio de energía eléctrica, es por esto que solicita financiamiento a Soluz Honduras para adquirir un sistema solar, ya que con este podrán tener acceso a cargar sus celulares en su propia vivienda y tendrán energía limpia, habrá ahorro en su economía, ya que no compraran más velas y  con este ahorro Martin podrá invertir más en su actividad para poder crecer y  cumplir uno de sus deseos que es convertirse en un caficultor de calidad, ya que recientemente ha comenzado con esta tarea y le ha producido buenos resultados, esto sin dejar de lado lo que más le apasiona hacer; cultivar granos básicos y hortalizas el cual realiza desde muy joven.
texts.en: Martin is 46 years old and lives in a community of Olanchito, Honduras, with his wife and seven children and together they struggle each day to give a better future to their family. He walks an hour to have access to a cell phone charger and has to spend a lot on candles and flashlights. It is something that Martin doesn't want to do any more since all his life he has lacked electrical service and for this he is asking Soluz Honduras for a loan to get a solar electricity system. With this, they will have access to charging their cell phones in their own house and will have clean energy, and there will be economic savings, since they won't purchase any more candles. With this savings, Martin will be able to invest more in his business to be able to grow and meet one of his wishes which is to become a quality coffee producer, since he has recently begun this work and it has produced good results. He does this without abandoning what he is more passionate about doing: growing basic grains and vegetables, which he has done since he was very young.

loans.use: to purchase a solar electricity system which will contribute to improving his family's standard of living.

loans.name: Bulu

texts.en:
Bulu is a very courageous woman. She is 44 years old and striving to provide an education to her children. She is a housewife who stays with her husband and children. They have three children (one son and two daughters). All are students. They are 21 years, 20 years and 17 years of age respectively. They live in the small village named Khalaigram in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own house.

Bulu's son, 21-year-old Tapas, is a student of B.A. (Bachelor of Arts) second year in Sukanta Mahavidyalaya (College), Dhupguri. Tapas is a good student, so he wants to join in the coaching classes during this month because he and his family know how important a three-year degree course is to build a career.

His father is a modest carpenter. What he earns mostly is spent on the household expenses. The income is insufficient to provide all the required educational materials.

Tapas is bright and focuses on his academic performance and achievement. So Bulu wants to provide all necessary education articles and enroll him in a coaching center. This is why she is approaching BJS for an education loan.

With the help of the Kiva education loan, she will pay for her son's college fees and tutorial fees and buy textbooks and stationery and other annual expenses for the year. She hopes that this will bring a sense of confidence to her son.

Bulu and her son, Tapas (in the photo), thank Kiva and BJS for the education loan support.

loans.use: to pay for her son's educational expenses.

loans.name: Lodah

texts.en:
Lodah is married with three children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members . 

Lodah sells charcoal and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She works from home on a retail basis seven days a week. 

Lodah aspires to build rental houses. She resides in a family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es una joven emprendedora y dinámica de 24 años de edad, estudiante universitaria y comerciante independiente; ya que desde hace 2 años comenzó a vender mercancía a sus familiares, amigos y compañeros de la universidad, con el fin de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar y para pagar sus estudios.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, pues invertirá el dinero en la compra de surtido al por mayor de bisutería para dama, brindando mayor variedad y un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que hará más rentable su negocio.
Trabaja sola todos los días durante 6 horas.

Catalina tiene el firme propósito de sacar adelante su proyecto productivo, pues quiere convertirse en una empresaria exitosa y garantizar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar para su grupo familiar y sabe que con los prestamistas de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar puede lograr todo eso y más.
texts.en:
Catalina is an enterprising and dynamic young woman, 24 years old, who is a university student and an independent saleswoman since two years ago she began to sell merchandise to her family members, friends, and university classmates, with the end of generating income to contribute to her household economy and to pay for her education. 

The loan that she is requesting is a support to strengthen her business since she will invest the money in the purchase of an assortment of women's costume jewelry in bulk, offering a better variety and better customer service, which will make her business more profitable. 

She works alone every day for 6 hours.

Catalina has the firm goal of getting her business ahead, since she wants to become a successful businesswoman and guarantee a better quality of life and well-being for her family and she knows that with the Kiva lenders and Corporación Interactuar she will be able to do this and more.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of women's costume jewelry in bulk.

loans.name: Iris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Iris es una mujer de experiencia, sabiduría y mucha paciencia.
Es madre de 1 hija y ha trabajado prácticamente toda su vida para sacarla adelante.
Ella tiene una pequeña chaza en la que vende jugos de fruta que ella misma prepara. 

Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas para tener su producto listo y fresco para sus clientes que en su mayoría son los vecinos del sector donde vive.

Ella desea capitalizar su negocio y tener un gran avance de insumos e inventario de productos, por eso acude a un préstamo para comprar surtido de frutas, además desea comprar utensilios de cocina.

Una de sus principales dificultades es la falta de dinero para invertir en su negocio pero confía en la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y el buen corazón de los prestamistas de Kiva para sacar su actividad adelante.
texts.en:
Iris is a woman with experience, wisdom, and a lot of patience.

She is the mother of one daughter and has worked practically her whole life to get her ahead.

She has a small stand where she sells fruit juices that she makes herself.

She works every day for 8 hours to have her product ready and fresh for her customers who are largely the neighbors from the area where she lives.

She wants to capitalize her business and have a big increase of income and product inventory, so she is getting a loan to purchase an assortment of fruit, and in addition she wants to purchase kitchen utensils. 

One of her primary difficulties is the lack of money to invest in her business but she trusts in the help from Corporación Interactuar and in the good hearts of the Kiva lenders to get her business ahead.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of fruits, in addition she wants to purchase kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah is married with seven children, with three attending school. She operates a beauty salon at the market and has been in this business for 11 years. 

Hadjah has applied for a loan of 1,600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids, and cosmetics. She gets additional income from operating a hardware shop also at the market on a retail basis. Hadjah works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include electricity outages and thieves. She aspires to build rental houses to earn extra income.

Hadjah resides in her own house with access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids, and cosmetics

loans.name: Nuru Group

texts.en:
Berta who is in her late 30s is married with two children who are still at school.  She has been running a pub business for four years now.  She works from 04pm to midnight daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy drinks for her pub business.  She dreams of making her pub popular. 

She will share this loan with her loan group Nuru which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks for her pub business.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia is married with four children.  She also takes care of additional family members.

Sylivia sells fruits and vegetables and has been in this business for 2 years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy tomatoes, oranges, onions, cabbages, and sweet bananas.  She works from home and sells to all categories of people, but on retail, seven days a week.

Sylivia is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to buy iron sheets to roof her rental houses.  She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and  piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent, medication, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, oranges, onions, cabbages, and sweet bananas

loans.name: Ceyhun

texts.en:
Ceyhun is 27 years old and married and father of two children. His wife doesn’t work. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with family in the Bilasuvar region. He is young and dynamic energetic. Ceyhun is a dairy farmer. He started keeping dairy cows 5 years ago and he has started this business with an amount of capital. 

He is also very socially oriented person and knows that his customers are rural area people and consume healthy food. So Ceyhun is concerned with raising healthy animals. His next plan is to produce and to sell more milk and dairy products. He requires to buy more animals for milk purposes. Please help Ceyhun to reach his aim.

loans.use: to buy more cows for milk purposes

loans.name: Roziyakhon

texts.en:
Roziyakhon was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1955. She is living in a small town with her family, is divorced and has a daughter. About 15 years she started business serving women with clothing. She is a tailor. She sews beautiful Tajik women dresses. She sews at home and her daughter helps her to do business. She likes her activity and has regular clients every day. She is responsible, goal-oriented person that does order on time. 

She appealed to IMON asking financial support to buy textile to sew dresses. She awaits Kiva lenders compassion and support.

loans.use: to buy textiles to sew dresses

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a single mother. She operates a kiosk from her home area on a retail basis and has been in this business for many years.

She has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy boxes of sweets, rice, sugar, bread, biscuits, cooking oil, and boxes of water.  She works seven days a week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.

Annet aspires to buying a plot of land and building a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy boxes of sweets, rice, sugar, bread, biscuits, cooking oil, and boxes of water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest for family use and the surplus for sale in the market.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is aged 22 years and he supports 1 child. 

He has been a farmer for the last 7 years and the business earns him KES 25,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest for family use and sell the surplus in the market. 

He plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and expand his business. 

His hope is to expand his agricultural sector and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest for family use and sell the surplus in the market.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 54 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jovita has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Jovita requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of plastic-wares, clothing and other home products.

Jovita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Jovita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of plastic-wares, clothing and other home products.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juvy is 47 years old and has one child who is in school.

Juvy has a general store business in the Philippines. Juvy requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Juvy has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Juvy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Wesley, a smallholder mixed-farmer based in the Siongiroi area of Kenya. Wesley relies on livestock and crop farming to produce food and generate income. His future plans are dependent on the success of his dairy farm and that is why he joined a solidarity group called ‘Riptany’ in order to secure financial services. 

Wesley is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. The newly acquired cow will increase the number of livestock on his farm and the quantity of milk that he supplies. However, the impact of your loan goes beyond direct food production to include multipurpose uses, such as skins, fiber, fertilizer and fuel, as well as capital accumulation. 

Increased income generated from this loan investment will help Wesley pay for his family’s basic needs and help him buy agricultural supplies, such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, animal feed, and implements to ensure the sustainability of his business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more rice, maize and beans for selling

loans.name: Doris Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doris es una señora de 57 años de edad, trabajadora y llena de vida, dedicada a la venta de pollo y huevos, un negocio que logro consolidar desde hace poco y un medio por el que ha logrado salir adelante con su actual pareja.
Trabaja todos los dias entre 5 y 7 horas.

Se encuentra solicitandora un prestamo el cual lo invertira en la compra de gallina y pollos al por mayor, ademas mejorara las condiciones de sus galpones.

Para Doris no hay nada imposible, a pesar de las circunstancias por las que ha pasado  su sueño es seguir trabajando para  cumplir el sueño de ver su casa bonita, pues ya que esta con el tiempo se ha ido deteriorando y su estado no es el  mejor.
texts.en:
Doris is a 57-year-old woman, hard-working and full of life, who works selling chickens and eggs, a business that she managed to establish a little while ago and it is a means through which she has managed to get ahead with her current partner.

She works every day between 5 and 7 hours.

She is asking for a loan which she will invest in the purchase of hens and chicks in bulk, in addition she will improve the condition of her chicken coops. 

For Doris, there is nothing that is impossible, despite the circumstances she has lived. Her dream is to continue working to fulfill her dream of having a pretty house, since this one has been deteriorating over time and it isn't in the best condition.

loans.use: to purchase hens and chicks in bulk and, in addition, to improve the condition of her chicken coops.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married 29 year old married woman with one child not attending school. She owns a retail shop of general merchandise and sells cosmetics,soap among other items to earn a living.She earns additional income from crop farming. She works for six days  a week. She started her business to cater for her family needs. She has hopes of constructing a residential house in the near future although the business is faced with a challenge of defaulters and market competition. 

She wants a loan to buy sugar,salt, rice, soft drinks and others.

loans.use: to buy sugar,salt, rice, soft drinks and others.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 35 years old with 2 children ages 11 and 4 years old.
Her husband is a caretaker with minimum salary that barely support their needs. To help make ends meet she opens a store in front of her house and sell groceries with the money she saves for her children schooling. With PhP 2,000 she bought basic groceries like candies, noodles, snack foods, laundry soap and other items. Her business helps support with the family expenses but Riza not being able to finish education due to not having enough money wanted to improve and expand her store to save for the education of her children. 

Riza has been with SEED for a year and seen improvements with her store. She now has more stocks and other items like, coffee, sugar, electronic loads which increases her income more. Riza now has regular customers and most of them are students because her store is near a college dormitory. Riza store has an opportunity to earn more income to support her children education but the lack of capital prevents her from growing.

Riza now is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 25,000 to buy 1 sack of rice, 15 cases of soft drinks and 25 gallons of mineral water as additional items to sell to her store.

The loan will enable her to continuously grow her business and earn more to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy 1 sack of rice, 15 cases of soft drinks and 25 gallons of mineral water as additional items to sell to her store.

loans.name: Mtaji Wa Masikini Group

texts.en:
Yusuph, who is in his early 40s is  married with two kids, one of them is still in school and the other is still small.  He has been selling second hand curtains for ten years now.  He works from 08am to 06pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 8th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase on the curtains stock and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully.  He is doing great and appreciates Kiva for their support.  He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, reinvest in business and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy second hand curtains to resell.  He dreams of owning big business.

Yusuph will share this loan with his loan group Mtaji wa Masikini, which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.  (one of the clients, Paschal's face can be seen just a portion).

loans.use: to buy second hand curtains to resell

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and three go to school. She takes care of additional family members.

Harriet is a tailor. She operates her business on a retail basis and works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last 13 years. She has requested a loan of 2,200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT–SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing material. Her major challenges include seasonality and defaulters. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a brand new electric machine to ease her work.

Harriet resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of clothing material

loans.name: Goretti

texts.en:
Goretti is married with six children, three of whom go to school. She also has additional family members.

Goretti is a tailor. She operates her business from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 1,700,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy rolls of materials to make clothes. Goretti also generates income from selling piped water from home. She sells on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation.

Goretti would like to build rental houses to supplement her income.  She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, utilities, and food.

loans.use: to buy rolls of materials to make clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 34 years old. He is married with 3 children. He has had a tailoring business for 12 years. He will be using the loan to purchase another sewing machine and fabric materials so as to serve more customers and hopes this will enable him to make more income to pay school fees. His hopes and dreams for the future are open more tailoring shops, make more income and educate his children and have a stable business.

loans.use: To purchase another sewing machine and fabric materials so as to serve more customers and hopes this will enable him to make more income to pay school fees.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven campesino, dedicado a realizar labores de campo desde muy niño, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre.
Con esto han tenido un gran progreso, pues cuentan con una gran variedad de cultivos, los cuales generan los ingresos necesarios para este hombre cubrir sus necesidades.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de semilla de papa criolla, insecticidas y fertilizantes.
Para este hombre trabajador y humilde no existe nada imposible, quiere seguir trabajando para cumplir el sueño de ver su casa bonita, ya que esta con el tiempo se ha ido deteriorando y su estado actual no es el mejor.

Como Carlos, miles de empresarios esperan de su ayuda, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Carlos is a young man of the countryside who has done rural work since he was very young, thanks to his father's instruction.

With this, he has made great progress, since he has a large variety of crops, which generate the necessary income for this man to cover all his needs.
