He is asking for a loan which he will invest in the purchase of creole potato seeds, insecticides and fertilizers.

For this hard-working and humble man, there is nothing that is impossible. He wants to continue working to achieve his dream of making his house nice, since this one has deteriorated over time and it's current situation is not the best.

Like Carlos, thousands of business people wait for your help, come on, lend.

loans.use: to purchase creole potato seeds, insecticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Doris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Con su gran empuje y perseverancia, Doris ha salido adelante y ha podido educar y sostener a su numerosa familia conformada por 5 hijos y su esposo.

Siempre ha buscado la manera de obtener ingresos para su familia, tanto así que ha pasado por numerosos trabajos en el municipio de San Andres de Sotavento.

Hoy en día, después de haber decidido por su independencia, trabaja en la fabricación de artículos y objetos artesanales en el material llamado cañaflecha.

Por esta y muchas más razones solicita un préstamo para compra materia prima como cañaflecha y mercancía artesanal.

Con este préstamo podrá asegurar la sostenibilidad de su negocio y por ende de su familia.

Si prestas a este crédito estarás aportando al progreso y empuje Colombiano!
texts.en:
With great drive and perseverance, Doris has gotten ahead and has been able to raise and support her large family made up of 5 children and her husband. 

She has always sought out the means to get income for her family, so much so that she has done a number of jobs in the municipality of San Andres de Sotaviento.

These days, after having decided to be independent, she works making items and crafts with the material called cañaflecha.

For this and many other reasons, she asks for a loan to purchase raw material such as cañaflecha and craft merchandise. 

With this loan, she will be able to assure the sustainability of her business, and in the end, that of her family.

If you lend to this loan, you will be supporting progress and the Colombian drive!

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as cañaflecha and craft merchandise.

loans.name: Chrispus

texts.en:
Chrispus and his family live in a rural home in Central Kenya. He, his wife and child enjoy dairy and poultry farming for their livelihood and the income it provides.
 
Chrispus started farming 20 years ago and now he has 3 dairy cows, 10 heads of poultry, 240 trees, vegetables and a retail shop for selling his produce and other items.

Chrispus is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed for his cows. The structure he is currently using lacks roofing and other basic components. The borrowed money will be used to buy construction tools and materials to get the project done.

He projects the animals' health and welfare will be improved as a result of the loan investment. This will further lead to improved milk production and income.

Your loan investment will help Chrispus and his family elevate their livelihoods and lead a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Twegaite Group

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man with 2 children and lives in Teso, Lira district. He rides boda boda (motor cycle) a business that puts food on his table and pays school fees for his children. He has applied for a loan of ugx500,000 to top up his savings and buy another motor cycle to increase his daily income. The group is excited about the Kiva partnership and looks towards more relationships.

The UGAFODE credit officer is standing at the extreme right which the lady next to her is a member of the group buy is just saving and will acquire the loan the next cycle, she signed the waiver form though.

loans.use: To buy a second motorcycle and top up his savings

loans.name: Nelson Esau

texts.es:
Nelsón, de 20 años de edad, está estudiando lic. en Administración de empresas, está soltero y vive con sus padres.

Nelsón, trabaja vendiendo zapatos, este trabajo lo aprendió en una empresa donde trabajo vendiendo zapatos, su negocio lo tiene en su casa y su horario es desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m.

Nelsón, necesita el préstamo para comprar zapatos para la venta, con está ayuda tendrá más mercadería para su negocio.

Sus sueños son, terminar sus estudios y graduarse como licenciado en administración de empresas, para poder tener más oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en: Nelson is 20 years old. He is studying a bachelors in Business Administration. He is single and lives with his parents. Nelson works selling shoes. He learned this job at a company where he worked selling shoes. He has his business in his house, and his schedule is from 7:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. Nelson needs this loan to buy shoes to sell. With this help he will have more merchandise for his business. His dreams are: to finish his studies and to graduate with a bachelors in Business Administration in order to have more job opportunities.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a widow with six children, four of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

Margret sells used clothes. She has been in this business for many years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. Margret also sells African attire to acquire additional income. She works on a retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Margret aspires to build rental houses. She resides in her own house and her family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Мухаё милая  женщина из района Бохтар. Она замужем и мать пятерых детей. Мухаё занимается животноводством много лет. Животноводство является одной из самых важных отраслей сельского хозяйства. Не каждый человек может хорошо справится с этой работой, однако Мухаё любит животных и хорошо умеет присматривать за ними. Она получает хороший доход от этого дела. В данный момент Мухаё хочет отремонтировать свой дом, но у нее не хватает некоторой суммы на покупку стройматериалов. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом и надеется закончить ремонт осенью до наступления холодов.
texts.en: Muhayo is a kind woman from the region of Bohtar. She is married, and a mother of five children. Muhayo has worked in animal husbandry for many years; it is one of the most important areas of agriculture. Not everyone can cope well with this type of work, however Muhayo loves animals and is very able to look after them. She receives a good income from this work. At the moment Muhayo wants to repair her home, but she doesn't have enough funds to purchase building materials. She has therefore applied for a loan and hopes to finish the repairs in the fall, before the onset of the cold weather.

loans.use: To purchase building materials.

loans.name: Marta Gladis

texts.es:
Marta, de 56 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado y está soltera, se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres, para realizar sus actividades diarias se levanta  a las 5:00 a.m.

Marta, trabaja durante la mañana en sus parcelas y sus hijos le ayudan en la siembra y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas para vender la leche. 

Marta, necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca lechera, para incrementar la producción de leche para la venta y así incrementar sus ingresos.

Martha, sueña con comprar un molino, ya que actualmente no hay uno en la comunidad donde vive.
texts.en:
Marta, 56 years old, went to school up to the ninth grade and is single. She works in agriculture and raising animals. She learned this profession from her parents. To do her daily work, she gets up at 5:00 am.

Marta works during the mornings on her land and her children help with the crops and in the afternoons they work milking the cows to sell the milk.

Marta needs the loan to purchase a dairy cow to increase her milk production for sale and, so, to increase her income.

Marta dreams of purchasing a mill since currently in the community where she lives there isn't any.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Denis Diana

texts.es:
Denis ha tenido que soportar muchísimas adversidades en el proceso de desarrollo de su negocio.

Hoy en día vive en una humilde casa y se gana la vida vendiendo desodorantes, lociones, cremas, entre otros, una actividad que aprendió de manera empírica con el afán de conseguir el sustento para su hija de 15 años.
Le dedica 6 horas diarias a su negocio.

Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de perfumería, cosméticos, entre otros al por mayor para tener mejor inventario.

Con este préstamo para ofrecer sus productos y mejorar sus ventas de una manera considerable.

Es una mujer fuerte y con gran espíritu emprendedor.
texts.en: Denis had to face many adversities in the process of developing her business. Nowadays, she lives in a humble house and makes a living selling deodorants, lotions, creams, among other things. She learned this job by experience, with the purpose of supporting her 15 year old daughter. She works six hours a day in her business. She is requesting a loan to buy perfumes, cosmetics, among other things, at wholesale prices, in order to have a better inventory. With this loan, she will be able to offer her products and improve her sales in a considerable way. She is a strong woman with a great enterprising spirit.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, cosmetics, among others, at wholesale prices, in order to have a better inventory.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with seven children, four of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. 

Susan sells fruits and vegetables at the market. She has been in this business for many years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a box of tomatoes, oranges, onions, cabbages, and mangoes. She sells on a retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the perishability of fruits.  

Susan aspires to buy a plot of land. She resides in her own house but her family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a box of tomatoes, oranges, onions, cabbages, and mangoes.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is married with one child. She has no additional family members. 

Mildred sells used clothes. She has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She moves door-to-door selling used clothes and sells on a retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include the seasonality of clothes.  

Mildred aspires to own a permanent business premise and to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house. Her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a beauty salon in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last four years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested for a loan of UGX 1,200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy hair relaxers, treatments, braids, weaves, and a hand dryer. Her major challenges include seasonality and power shortages, which affect her work. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the business, and food.

loans.use: to buy hair relaxers, treatments, braids, weaves, and a hand dryer.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a single mother of one child and her child goes to school.  She also takes care of additional family members .  She  sells fruits and vegetables at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for 7 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy a box of tomatoes,egg plants,onions,cabbages and mangoes.  She works seven days a week.   Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation.  She decided to join MCDT-SACCO so as to get additional capital. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy box of tomatoes,egg plants,onions,cabbages and mangoes

loans.name: Isidro Antonio

texts.es:
Un hombre trabajador, humilde y lleno de vida, asi es el señor Antonio, a sus 63 años, su labor es la cria, cuidado y venta de ganado, un medio por el que ha tenido un gran progreso como padre, esposo y empresario.

Con el proposito de aumentar sus ingresos, y mejorar un poco su estabilidad economica, solicita un credito el cual lo invertira en la compra de cerdos, cuido y los materiales necesarios para construir nuevos terrenos para su ganado.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando para mejorar las condiciones de su casa, pues esta con el tiempo se ha ido deteriorando y su estado no es el mejor.

Sabe que de la mano de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva sus sueños se cumpliran.
texts.en:
A hardworking man who is humble and full of life, describes Antonio. He is 63 years old and his work is raising, caring for and selling livestock. Through that work he has made great progress as a father, husband and businessman.

In order to increase his income and improve his financial stability a little, he is asking for a loan to invest in buying pigs and caring for them, as well as materials to build new spaces for his livestock.

His dream is to keep working to improve the conditions of his home, because over time it has deteriorated and it is not in the best condition.

He knows that hand in hand with Interactuar and those who cooperate through Kiva, his dreams will come true.

loans.use: to buy pig, care for them, and buy materials necessary to build new spaces for his livestock.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and two go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells  charcoal from home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last six years. She works seven days a week. Imelda has requested for a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and family utilities.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
Todo cambio para el señor Aristides en el año 2012, gracias a que tomó la decisión de volverse independiente y luchar por un mejor futuro para su familia, este humilde hombre quien se encontraba sin empleo, encontró en la venta de madera un medio sostenible de ingresos para llevar diariamente el alimento a su hogar que lo conforman su pareja sentimental, junto con sus 4 hijos todos ellos menores de edad, que dependen totalmente de Aristides y que andan en proceso de enseñanza del negocio que espera que se convierta en familiar. 

Ya una vez consolidado su negocio, haberse hecho conocer en el barrio, Aristides piensa que es el mejor momento para invertir capital, es por esta razón, que solicita un apoyo económico para la compra de madera en grandes cantidades, aprovechando que la zona se usa mucho este producto ya sea para la construcción de casas o para la construcción de invernaderos.
texts.en:
Everything changed for Aristides in 2012, because he decided to become independent and fight for a better future for his family. This humble man, who found himself unemployed, discovered a sustainable means of income in selling wood, so he could feed his family every day. His family is his spouse and their 4 children, all of them minors. They are totally dependent on Aristides, and are in the process of learning the business, which he hopes will become a family business.  

With his business consolidated and being known in the neighborhood, Aristides thinks that this is he best time to invest in buying wood in large quantities, to take advantage of the fact that this product is being used a lot in the area to build houses or to build greenhouses.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of wood to increase his sales.

loans.name: Soraida Luz

texts.es:
Soraida es una madre de un pequeño hijo de ya 10 años de edad y por el cual ha luchado incansablemente para sostenerlo y brindarle todo lo que necesita.

Encontró en la venta de mercancía como ropa, la manera para generar buenos ingresos estando cerca  de su hijo.

Hoy en día está iniciando con un capital muy pequeño y está en etapa de recolección de clientes, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de calzado, bolsos, productos de uso personal al por mayor y así poder abastecer su pequeño negocio con productos de calidad.

Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá impulsar su negocio y tendrá una mejor variedad de productos para ofertar, logrando así la consolidación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Soraida is a mother with a young son who is 10 years old. 

Soraida has fought tirelessly to support her son and give him everything he needs. She makes a living selling merchandise such as clothing, this is a way for her to make money and take care of her son. 

Right now Soraida is starting with a very small amount of capital and is focusing on attracting more customers, so she is seeking a loan to buy wholesale: footwear, bags, and personal use products. This will allow her to stock her small business with quality products. 

With the help of this loan, Soraida can boost her business and offer a wider variety of products, thus consolidating her business in the long term.

loans.use: to buy wholesale: footwear, bags, and personal use products.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and three go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells fresh fish at the market on retail basis. She has been in this business for the last three years. She works seven days a week. 

Imelda has requested for a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy fresh fish. Her major challenges include seasonality of fish and perishability. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a residential house. She lives in a rented house, and the family has no access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria proviene  de una familia humilde y trabajadora, sus padres son comprometidos con el trabajo, y buscan siempre seguir adelante, María trabaja en una casa familiar como niñera, y a la vez que trabaja también lucha para poder ser una buena enfermera.
Ella es una persona muy sacrificada que se esfuerza mucho para poder salir adelante. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar su matrícula y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria comes from a humble and hardworking family. Her parents are committed to their work and always seeking a way to get ahead. María works in a family home as a babysitter. While working, she is also fighting to be able to become a good nurse.

She is a very hardworking person who strives to get ahead. She is asking for this loan to pay for college registration so that she can continue with her education.

loans.use: to register in college.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married with two children and only one child goes to school. She makes crafts from home. She has been in this business for three years. 

Christine has applied for a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy beads, hooks, and others materials for making crafts. She generates additional income from selling piped water. She sells on a retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

Christine aspires to buy a plot of land. She resides in the family house. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying for electricity, food, and medication.

loans.use: to buy beads, hooks, and others materials for making crafts.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and one child goes to school. 

Irene operates a retail shop at the market. She has been in this business for the last three years. She works seven days a week. She requested a loan from MCDT - SACCO to buy boxes of soap, cooking oil, crates of soda, flour, beans, and rice. Her major challenges include transportation and defaulters. 

Irene would like to buy a bigger fridge to stock more drinks. She lives in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap, cooking oil, crates of soda, flour, beans, and rice.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a single mother of four children, one of whom attends school. She also takes care of additional family members . 

Ruth makes craft handbags. She has been in this business for 15 years. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy raw materials for making handbags. She works in her shop seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and the ever-increasing price of raw materials. 

Ruth aspires to build her own house and also train other people in craft making. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy materials for making craft handbags.

loans.name: Berceliza

texts.en:
Berceliza is 56 years old and married.

Berceliza runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, etc.

Berceliza has been in this business for 20 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Misael

texts.es: Cultivar granos básicos y hortalizas es algo  a lo que se ha dedicado  Misael desde hace 10 años, esta actividad le gusta mucho, ya que lo que produce le genera buenos ingresos. Él tiene 31 años y  vive en una comunidad de Olanchito, Honduras.  Gracias a su trabajo ha podido ayudarle a su esposa y sus tres hijos a tener una mejor vida, sin embargo hay algo con lo cual Misael no está conforme y es que no cuenta  con el servicio  de energía eléctrica, ya que esto ocasiona que tengan poca iluminación y que no puedan realizar las tareas del hogar tal como quisieran. Es por esto que Misael ha decidido solicitar un financiamiento a Soluz Honduras el cual le podrá ayudar a adquirir un Sistema solar para que su familia ya no tenga esos inconvenientes, podrán tener una buena iluminación que aparte será con energía  limpia  que no dañara su salud y también  evitara caminar grandes distancias para poder mantener cargado su teléfono celular
texts.en: Growing basic grains and vegetables is something that Misael has done for 10 years. He likes this activity very much, since with it he earns good income.  He is 31 years old and lives in the community of Olanchito, Honduras. Thanks to his work, he has been able to help his wife and their three children have a better life. Nonetheless, there is something Misael doesn't accept and that is that he doesn't have electricity. They have little lighting and they can't do their homework the way they would like to. That is why Misael has decided to ask Soluz Honduras for a loan. This will help him acquire a solar power system so that his family won't have these inconveniences. They will be able to have good lighting and it will be with clean energy that won't damage their health. It will also avoid having to travel long distances to be able to keep his cell phone charged.

loans.use: to improve his standard of living by buying a solar power system for his home.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 71-year-old widow living in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur (Philippines). She is a full-fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative  and has maintained her good record without delayed payments of her previous loans. 

Recently, Anita requested another loan of PHP 40,000.00 to pay for a medical check-up and to purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to pay for a medical check-up and to purchase maintenance medicines.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Malati

texts.en:
Malati is 46 years old and lives in the small village of Dhupguri with her four family members. She is the proud mother of two sons. Though she attended school up to grade 5, she was determined to provide a good education for her sons. She is successful in her mission. Both of her sons are now receiving education at the graduate level. Her husband is a farmer by profession.

Malati's younger son, 18-year-old Subrata, is a bright young boy. Now he is pursuing a B.A. (Bachelor of Arts) in education in Sukanta Mahabidyalay aiming to be a good teacher. His father is the only earning member of the family; through his tireless efforts he earns an amount which hardly covers the family expenses. But Malati is keen to provide her son with a good education so that he can lead a life far better than theirs. For this, she approached Kiva’s partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity to fund her son's education. She wants to use the loan to purchase her son's necessary study materials and a bicycle and to pay all the educational fees. She hopes that the loan will enable Subrata to go ahead with his education smoothly so that he can establish himself to get a good job in future.

Malati and Subrata (in the photo) are thankful to their lenders.

loans.use: To bear the expenses for her son's degree in education.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 50 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, bread, noodles, detergent soap, candies, coffee, etc. to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items.

Josephine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, bread, noodles, detergent soap, candies, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Gisella

texts.es:
Maria a la vez que estudia también trabaja y se esfuerza por poder ser alguien en la vida y poder ayudar a su familia por medio de sus conocimientos.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, y por medio de su trabajo solventa parte de sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria goes to school and also works. She puts forth great effort in order to be able to be someone in life and to be able to help her family with her knowledge. She is studying for a degree in business administration. With her work she pays for part of her education.

She is requesting this loan to be able to make her educational payments so that she is able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to make university payments.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy has signed up as a member of PMPC (Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative). She has requested the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. 

She is thankful for the capital this loan extends to a small-time borrower like her. Ivy has been able to turn the tide in her favor and make good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of this good fortune. 

Recently, she availed a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Pedro Antorio

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 55 años, está casado con Norma, tiene 3 hijos y tiene una nieta a su cargo. Terminó la escuela primaria. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, produce café certificado bajo los sellos Rain Forest y Comercio Justo que vende en COCAFCAL  de la cual es socio, Pedro sueña con tener una buena calidad de vida y que sus hijos tengan mejores oportunidades para el futuro.
Pedro quiere llevar a cabo algunas tareas necesarias en la conversión a orgánico de su cafetal, tal como plantación de barreras vivas para la conservación del suelo, Pedro quiere plantar zacate de limón como barreras de conservación de suelos lo que también le proporcionara un ingreso extra ya que el zacate de limón se puede vender por medio de COCAFCAL, además las labores de conversión a orgánico le permitirá vender su café en mejores mercados.
Pedro ya ha preparado la tierra y ahora necesita un préstamo para comprar la semilla del zacate de limón, pagar mano de obra, comprar abonos orgánicos para su cafetal, plantas de café de origen orgánico y otros materiales necesarios para la conversión a orgánico de su cafetal.
Un préstamo ayudara a Pedro a tener mejores ingresos por su café y además le ayudara a tener ingresos extras por la diversificación de su finca, con las ganancias obtenidas por el café orgánico vendido y los ingresos extras por la diversificación de la finca Pedro espera tener una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades para su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 55 years old, and he is married to Norma. He has 3 children, and he also takes care of a granddaughter. He finished primary school. Pedro's main occupation is in agriculture. He produces coffee which is certified by Rain Forest and Comercio Justo [Fair Trade], and he sells his coffee through COCAFCAL, which he is a member of. Pedro's dream is to have a good quality of life and that his children have better opportunities in the future.

Pedro wants to carry out some work that is necessary to convert his coffee plantation to organic such as planting live barriers to conserve the ground. Pedro wants to plant lemongrass as conservation barriers for his ground, which will also give him extra income since he can sell the lemongrass through COCAFCAL. In addition, converting to organic will enable him to sell his coffee in better markets.

Pedro has already prepared the land, and now he needs a loan to buy lemongrass seeds, pay for the labor costs, buy organic fertilizer for his coffee plantation, buy organic coffee plants, and buy other materials that are necessary for the conversion to organic.

A loan will help Pedro to earn more income from his coffee, and also it will help him to earn extra income by diversifying his farm. With the profits earned from selling his organic coffee and diversifying his farm, Pedro hopes for a better quality of life and better opportunities for his family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and to plant live barriers that are necessary to convert his coffee plantation to organic.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita's greatest motivation in life is to provide her children with proper education. She is 32 years old, married and a mother of two children; one is a 14-year-old daughter, and one is a 4-year-old son. She lives in Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district of West Bengal. Her husband runs a small roadside tea stall, which is the only income-generating source for the family. Anita is a housewife and responsible mother and handles both responsibilities carefully. 

Anita's daughter, 14-year-old Poli, is a student of grade 9 at Dhupguri Girl's High School. She was promoted to class 9, securing average marks in all subjects. Possibly the reason behind this is a lack of guidance as well as adequate study materials. Anita cannot help her daughter in her studies with her limited education. Moreover, striving for basic needs does not allow Anita to provide all the necessary materials for her daughter' education. 

The annual session usually starts just after the festival season ends, and that leaves a financial issue for a family whose income is irregular and meager. Borrowing from moneylenders was the only option available to let her daughter pursue her studies. Then she came to know about Kiva education loans from a friend of hers. Her anxiety to provide an education to her daughter has been helped by Kiva and BJS providing an education loan. 

With the Kiva loan, she is going to provide school fees, a set of school uniforms, textbooks, stationery supplies, and tuition fees for the whole year for her daughter.  She is so happy that her daughter can attend the school and not worry about the examination fees and others. Now her daughter can continue her studies uninterrupted.

Anita and Poli thank their lenders.

loans.use: to bear the educational cost for her daughter’s continuous schooling.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es:
Alexis está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería  agrónoma, está en el sexto semestre, es una persona muy sacrificada, cuya aspiración es graduarse para poder trabajar en el ámbito de su carrera.
Está superando todas las dificultades especialmente económicas gracias a la ayuda de sus familiares y también con su trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Alexis is studying for a degree in agricultural engineering. He is in the sixth semester. He is a very self-sacrificing person. His aspiration is to graduate in order to be able to work in his degree field. He is overcoming all of the difficulties, especially financial ones, thanks to the help from his relatives and also with his work.

He is requesting this loan in order to make his university payments so that he is able to continue studying as he is doing.

loans.use: to make university payments.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is 49 years old. She is known in the Ozamis City area for her pedi-cab operation. 

Andresa is actively participating in the various programs and services that the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative offers. She has applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks as she hopes to live comfortably in a decent house. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a micro-finance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She is thankful for PMPC, which supports the financial needs of her transportation business.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Lalita

texts.en:
Thirty-six-year-old Lalita lives in a small village named Purba Alta Gram in Dhupguri in West Bengal. She is a courageous mother of three children (two sons and one daughter). Her husband is a farmer, engaged with farming activities. He is the breadwinner of the family, and his income is inconsistent. His income is so small that he cannot even afford the educational expenses of his children after bearing the household costs. All their children go to school. 

Lalita's 16-year-old son Karna is a student of grade 11 in Mallick para Vidya Niketan. He is an average student. But with his hard work and determination he tries to excel himself. Karna is confident that he will score good marks in his upcoming examination if he gets the help of good tutors. But Lalita is unable to provide sufficient study materials and private tutors to her son. The only way out is to borrow some financial help from any micro-finance company like BJS that helps poor students to fulfill their dreams. 

Thus, Lalita is seeking an educational loan from BJS (a Kiva field partner). This loan will help her to engage good tutors and purchase study materials for her son, which will ensure that Karna will achieve good marks on his examination with his hard labor and dedication. 

Lalita and Karna (as in the photo) are obliged to their lenders.

loans.use: to pay education-related costs of her son’s uninterrupted education.

loans.name: Gloria Matilde

texts.es:
A sus 51 años de edad Gloria logró consolidar un negocio de confección a terceros y línea propia de ropa gracias a la experiencia que obtuvo trabajando en varios talleres, trabaja de todos los días durante 8 horas dependiendo de la cantidad de trabajo y sabe que gracias a sus clientes tiene un buen negocio. 

Quiere ampliar sus horizontes y lograr ofrecer trabajo a las personas más necesitadas por lo que solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos e hilos con los que podrá mejorar su producción, expandirse a nuevas empresas, y aumentar  su volumen de trabajo.

Su sueño es seguir creciendo y conformar un gran taller, así, contar la historia de que gracias a los colaboradores y prestadores del portal Kiva y a la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar pudo montar un gran negocio.
texts.en:
At 51 years old Gloria managed to establish a third party manufacturing business and her own line of clothing thanks to the experience that she had gained in various workshops.  She works 8 hours every day, depending on the quantity of work, and knows via her clients that she runs a good business. 

She wants to widen her horizons and would like to offer work to those people who are most in need of it.  She is applying for a loan in order to buy supplies and thread with which she will be able to improve her production, work with more businesses and increase her volume of work. 

Her dream is to continue growing and to develop a large workshop.  She therefore would like to say thanks to the team members and lenders at Kiva as well as Corporación Interactuar as they enabled her to start a great business.

loans.use: to buy supplies and thread with which she will be able to improve her production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the medical treatment of his ex-partner in an oncology center.

loans.name: Bulan

texts.en:
Bulan is a 39-year-old married lady and a mother of two daughters and one son. She studied up to grade 9. Due to her family’s poor economy, she had to drop school, but she is very much eager to give her children the best education that they deserve. Her daughter is pursuing her bachelor degree, her son is in grade 8, and one of her daughters got married. 

Bulan's daughter Punam is 18 years old. She is pursuing her bachelor degree from Bardhaman college in business management; she is in first year. She needs proper guidance and reference books to score good marks in her examination. Bulan's husband is engaged with house painting work. His income is mostly spent on household expenses, and they cannot afford the whole education cost of their children. Sometimes they cannot even provide necessary books for their children. As such, providing her (Punam) with private coaching is too difficult for them to bear. 

So to solve this problem Bulan applied for an educational loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). The loan amount will be utilized for purchasing her daughter's necessary books, pay all college fees and for enrolling her in private coaching class. Bulan is hopeful that the loan will help her daughter to go one step closer to her goals.

Bulan and Punam (as in the photo) express their gratitude toward their generous lenders.

loans.use: to cover all the education-related costs of her daughter.

loans.name: Las Cinco Estrellas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Micaela tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos que todavía dependen de ella. Es la presidenta en este nuevo ciclo de la renovada alcancía comunal “LAS CINCO ESTRELLAS” conformada ahora por 5 mujeres emprendedoras que quieren continuar creciendo mediante el apoyo mutuo. Micaela tiene como negocio la confección de prendas de vestir como pantalones para damas y caballeros que ella misma confecciona en su propio taller que implemento en casa y que está mejorando gracias al apoyo que viene recibiendo por los inversionistas de KIVA. El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar los materiales como diferentes tipos de telas que necesita para confeccionar sus prendas de vestir. Como plan a futuro tiene pensado seguir trabajando arduamente para comprar su puesto donde pueda vender sus pantalones. En la foto grupal Micaela se encuentra sentada en medio de las demás señoras paradas.
texts.en:
Micaela, age 37, is in a relationship and has three children, who are still dependent upon her. She is the president in this new cycle of the updated "Las Cinco Estrellas" communal bank. The bank is now comprised of five enterprising women, who want to continue growing through their mutual support.

Micaela has a business of making clothing like women's and men's pants. She makes them herself in her own workshop that she set up in her house. It is improving thanks to the support she has received from the Kiva lenders.

She will use the loan to buy materials like different types of fabrics that she needs to make clothes. Her plan for the future is to continue working arduously in order to buy a stand where she is able to sell her pants.

In the group photo Micaela is seated in the middle of the women who are standing.

loans.use: to buy different types of fabric.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl de 46 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos de 19, 13, 10 y 5 años de edad. Él es un hombre reconocido en su cantón como responsable y trabajador, ya que desde hace dieciséis años se gana la vida como agricultor, además posee una pequeña tienda de productos básicos como: golosinas, sopas, huevos, bebidas, detergentes, etc., en su vivienda, con lo que logra mantener la economía familiar. Raúl con el propósito de mejorar su inventario y poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos ha  tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: golosinas, lácteo, verduras, pan, bebidas entre otro muchos productos mas.
texts.en: Raúl is 46 years old, and he lives in his own home with his wife and their 4 children ages 19,13,10 and 5. He is a man who is recognized in his community as responsible and hardworking, because for the last 16 years, he has made a living in agriculture. In addition, he has a small store that he operates out of his home that sells basic products such as sweets, soup, eggs, drinks, detergent, etc.Through this, he has managed to support his family. In order to improve his inventory and be able to offer his customers a larger variety of products, Raúl has decided to request a loan with FUSAI to buy sweets, dairy products, vegetables, bread, and drinks among many other items.

loans.use: to buy sweets, dairy products, vegetables, bread, and drinks among many other items for his store.

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra is a 31-year-old lady from Dhupguri. She is a married woman who lives with her family: her husband, Gobind, two sons and one daughter. Sumitra has a formal education up to grade 5. Her husband runs a small business of plywood boards. To supplement her husband's meager income, Sumitra runs a small, home-based business. All her children are students in different grades.

Sumitra's son, 13-year-old Surojit, is a student of grade 8 in Dhupguri High School. He is a hard-working student, but is unable to get good marks in his exams for the lack of proper guidance. Moreover, his parents often fail to provide him the necessary books and study materials, which he needs badly. His half yearly exam is knocking at the door; thus, Surojit wants to attend coaching classes. Surojit's mother, Sumitra, runs their household on a meager monthly income. 

This low income does not leave her much room to save and as a result, she is unable to afford the high fees of Surojit’s coaching classes. Sumitra is willing to do whatever it takes to help Surojit be successful in his formal education, and to this end, she is seeking a loan from Kiva via BJS. This loan will help her pay the coaching fees, and she plans to purchase other study materials for her son so that he can continue his studies uninterrupted and get good marks in his upcoming exams. 

Sumitra and Surojit are very much grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education for grade 8.

loans.name: Terisita

texts.en:
Terisita is a 58-year-old, married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Terisita has a buy-and-sell "ready to wear" business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shirts, pants, shorts, etc.

Terisita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Terisita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shirts, pants, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Deberly

texts.en:
Deberly is a 47-year-old single woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Deberly has a weaving business in the Philippines. Deberly requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her business.

Deberly has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Renuka

texts.en:
Fifty-four-year-old Renuka lives in a small village of Dhupguri. She has three children (one son and two daughters). Her husband is a cycle van puller. His income is low to bear the educational costs as well as household costs of his family. Renuka’s one daughter is studying in grade 8 and the other got married.

Her only son, 17-year-old Sanju, is studying in grade 12 in Kalirhat D.C. High School. Next year, he will appear for his higher secondary board examination. Thus, he needs guidance and study materials. Sanju is trying his level best to score good marks on his board examination.

Renuka faces difficulties to bear all educational expenses of her children with this low family income. Renuka thought she should help her son so that he can pass his grade 12 exam smoothly. 

Hence, Renuka is requesting a loan from BJS (a Kiva partner) to bear the educational expenses of her son. She plans use the loan money to pay all the educational fees and buy necessary study materials for her son, Sanju. The loan will help a bright boy to continue his education without any obstacles.

Renuka and Sanju (in the photo) are happy and grateful to BJS and Kiva for their kind support.

loans.use: to pay for her son's educational expenses for grade 12.

loans.name: Rose Dite Benette

texts.fr: Rose, 42 ans, vit en union libre et a un enfant. Elle vend des biscuits et des bonbons. Elle trouve ainsi de quoi payer la scolarité son enfant et procurer à manger à la maison. Elle cherche un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock
texts.en: Rose, 42 years old, lives in a common-law union and has one child. She sells cookies and candy. In that way, she manages to earn enough to pay school fees for her child and pay for food for the household. She is asking for a small loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to buy a stock of candy and cookies.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco, de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado porque la situación económica en ese entonces era difícil, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a hacer los oficios de su hogar, tienen una hija de tres años de edad que aún no estudia, pero vive con ellos.

Francisco, es albañil desde hace 10 años y este oficio lo aprendió de su padre y así comenzó a hacer trabajos por su propio esfuerzo; aparte de eso también es agricultor, siembra maíz, frijol y otros, su trabajo está a 10 minutos de su casa y se va en bicicleta, su horario es desde las 6:30 a.m. hasta 3:30 p.m.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar abono, pesticidas y semilla para sembrar, el préstamo le ayudara a sembrar a tiempo.

Sus sueños son, tener una gran cosecha de sus cultivos y que  su hija crezca sana y fuerte.
texts.en:
Francisco, 41 years old, studied until 2nd grade because his family was in a very difficult financial situation. He is married. His wife takes care of the household responsibilities and his 3-year-old daughter, who is still too young to go to school. 

Francisco has worked in construction for the last 10 years. He learned this trade from his father and began to start taking his own construction jobs. Francisco also works as a farmer, growing corn, beans, and other items. Francisco works 10 minutes away from his home. He rides his bike there to work from 6:30 a.m. - 3:30 p.m.

Francisco needs this loan in order to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds to sow. The loan will help him to sow his crops on time. His dream is to have a large harvest and that his daughter grows up healthy and strong.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds to sow.

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.es: Dagoberto de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos desde hace 15 años e inicio con capital propia, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: Dagoberto is 35 years old and lives in his own home with his partner and his three children. He works in cultivating basic grains for the past 15 years. He began with his own capital. He sells his products in the different markets that are found around his house. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph so that he can continue his work.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and improve the land.

loans.name: Laura Victoria

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Artesanal se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable.
En este lugar vive la señora Laura, tiene 75 años de edad, es madre soltera de  un hijo mayor de edad que vive con ella junto a su familia.
Doña Laura es una mujer muy luchadora, ella se dedica al comercio, vende de ropa de todo tipo y  productos de Avon y Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos días por las mañanas ya que es más fresco y también vende en su casa, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene muchos años dedicada a esta actividad la cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le han brindado en todo este tiempo. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The “Artesanal” communal bank meets every two weeks in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as “La Sultana del Café” because of the large fields of incomparably flavored coffee.

Laura lives here.  She is 75 years old and is a single mother of an adult son who lives with her together with his family.  Laura is a very determined woman who makes a living selling clothes of all types and Avon and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for women).  She works every day in the morning as it is cooler then and she also sells in her house.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every week.  She has many years dedicated to this activity which allows her to get ahead. 

This loan is for the purchase of perfumes, creams, cosmetics and all types of clothing.  She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it for the help she has received all this time.  

Her dreams are to get ahead and be in good health.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Las Amigas Solidarias Group

texts.es: La Sra. Dora tiene 51 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en el distrito de El Tambo Huancayo. Ella forma parte del grupo "Las amigas solidarias", formado por 6 socias, vecinas de la zona donde vive. Hace dos años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes de diferentes marcas. Gracias a esta actividad del comercio ha logrado adquirir mayor economía  para su hogar, mantener a sus hijos, darles lo necesario para sus estudios y sobretodo tener tranquilidad de su hogar. En un futuro le gustaría tener un minimarket. El préstamo recibido lo invirtió en la compra de mercadería de abarrotes al por mayor para aumentar su stock.
texts.en: Sra. Dora is 51 years old, and she has three children. She lives in the district of El Tambo Huancayo. She is part of the group "Las amigas solidarias", comprised of 6 members who are neighbors in the area where she lives. She has made a living selling different brands of groceries for two years. Thanks to this work, Dora has managed to earn more income for her household, take care of her children, give them everything they need for their studies, and above all have serenity in her home. In the future, she would like to have a mini-market. She will use the loan she receives to buy groceries at wholesale in order to expand her inventory.

loans.use: to buy groceries at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cases of smoked herrings and of oil.

loans.name: Fanny María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Artesanal se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable.
En este lugar vive la señora Fanny, tiene  57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene seis hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Fanny  se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa interior de todo género, ella compra y vende al por mayor, sus hijos también venden estos productos pero en otros lugares, ella ciertos días sale a vender puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa lugar en el cual tiene unas vitrinas donde exhibe sus prendas al público, deja a crédito y cobra casa 8 días,  lleva más de 20 años dedicada a este negocio el cual le permite ganarse algo para ayudar a su familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa interior en muchas variedades y géneros. Lleva más de 5  años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son seguir adelante mejorando su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The loan group Artesanal meets every other week in the canton of Jipijapa, which is named after the coffee sultan because of its extensive coffee fields that produce coffee with an incomparable taste. 

In this place, lives Fanny. She is 57 years old and married with six children who are now independent adults. Her husband is a merchant. Fanny also makes a living as a merchant, selling underwear of all kinds. Fanny buys and sells her products in bulk. Her children also sell these products in other locations. Some days, Fanny goes out to sell her products door to door. She also sells them from her home, where she has display cases to show her products to the public. Fanny allows her customers to buy items on credit and she collects payments every week. She has been working in this business for 20 years. It allows her to earn money to help her family.

This loan will be used to buy a wide variety of underwear. Fanny has been a part of the Artesanal group for five years. She likes it because the loans help her to get ahead. Her dreams are to keep improving things for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy underwear.

loans.name: María Andrea

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Artesanal se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable.
En este lugar vive la señora Maria, tiene  49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 22 y 20 años que estudian en universidad. Su esposo es mecánico. Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad.
Doña María hace más de 18 años instaló un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, allí ella confecciona todo tipo de prendas pero de preferencia de damas y niños, en ocasiones elabora uniformes de escuelas, colegios y empresas de la ciudad, trabaja todos los días unas seis horas dependiendo de lo que tenga que confeccionar. Gracias a sus ganancias han logrado estudiar sus hijos. 
Este crédito lo va  emplear en comprar telas, cierres, hilos, materiales para la costura. Lleva más 18  años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son  ver que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Grupo De Crédito Artesanal meets every 15 days in the Jipijapa canton, a canton known for having the name of the sultan of coffee due it the regions extensive coffee cultivation which has an incomparable taste. 

Mrs. Maria lives in this region. She is 49 years old, is married and from this marriage has two children of 22 and 20 years of age who study in the university. Her husband is a mechanic. Several years ago she learned tailoring and dressmaking in an academy in the town.

Eighteen years ago, Mrs. Maria installed a small dressmaking workshop in her home. There she makes all types of garments but that are preferred by women and children. In some occasions, she makes uniforms for schools, colleges and businesses in the city. She works every day for about six hours depending on what she needs to make. Thanks to her earnings, her children were able to study.

She will use the loan to buy fabrics, zippers, threads and materials for sewing. She has been with the Grupo De Crédito for more than 18 years and she likes it because with the loans, she is able to get ahead. Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, zippers, threads and other materials for sewing.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: Roger vive en Olanchito, Honduras tiene 34 años y se dedica a la agricultura de café y granos básicos desde hace 4 años, asimismo su esposa Rosa tiene una pequeña tienda en su vivienda donde familiares, amigos y vecinos compran granos básicos y productos de higiene personal, lo que le proporciona lo necesario para el sustento de su familia. Sin embargo la falta del servicio de energía eléctrica en la comunidad dificulta el negocio y la vida familiar, por lo que el  pequeño negocio se cierra temprano y se abre tarde por las mañanas, también los niños no pueden estudiar por las noches cuando lo necesitan, sin mencionar el costo por el uso de las velas y carga de celulares. Todas estas situaciones  han provocado que Roger solicite un financiamiento para la compra  un sistema solar a Soluz Honduras, y de esa manera  que los problemas por la falta de iluminación se acaben y su familia tenga la calidad de vida que se merecen y que Roger desea para ellos además de brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Roger lives in Olanchito, Honduras. He is 34 years old, and he has made a living farming coffee and basic grains for 4 years. Also, his wife Rosa has a small store in their home where relatives, friends and neighbors come to buy basic grains and personal hygiene products, which provide Roger and his wife with what they need to support their family. However, the lack of electricity in the community makes business and family life difficult, causing them to close their small store early and open late in the mornings. In addition, the children can't study at night when they need to, without even mentioning the cost of using candles and charging cellular phones. 

All of these circumstances have motivated Roger to request financing to buy a solar system from Soluz Honduras. Through this, the problems from the lack of lighting and electricity will be resolved, his family will have the quality of life that they deserve, and they will be able to offer their customers better service which Roger desires to do.

loans.use: to buy a Solar System which will greatly improve the living conditions in his home and at his business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 59 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

Francisco se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su vehículo (mototaxi), actividad que realiza desde hace más de 8 años, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Francisco espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco is 59 years old in a common law marriage. He lives with his spouse and his son in the district of Pucará which is located in the province of Jaé, region of Cajamarca, in the Northern sierra of Peru. Life in the community is calm. The community members work primarily in commerce and raising small livestock.

Francisco works in providing transportation services for passengers in his vehicle (a mototaxi), work that he has done for more than 8 years. He relies on the experience he has in the sector and on the very good personal and work references in the region. The loan will be used to carry out repairs and maintenance on his vehicle since currently it is in bad shape. With this, Francisco looks forward to offer better services to his customers which will generate more income and therefore, will improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to carry out repairs and maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es estudiosa, esta poniendo todo de si para poder ser una buena administradora y por medio de su profesión poder abrirse camino al mundo laboral y también poder ayudar a su familia. Ella comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar sus cuotas, y eso le ayudo mucho.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder pagar de vuelta sus cuotas, y continuar así estudiando.
texts.en: Gladys is very studios, putting all of herself into becoming a good administrator. Through her profession, she hopes to be able to open up a path into the professional work world and help her family. Gladys used her previous loan to pay for university fees, which has helped her a lot. She is requesting another loan in order to pay these fees again and continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson es una persona capaz, trabajadora estudiosa y que quiere salir adelante, tiene una familia muy unida que le respalda en todo. Estudia para poder ser abogado, y por medio de sus estudios poder abrirse camino al mundo laboral y poder ayudar así a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Wilson is a very capable, hardworking, and studious person who wants to get ahead. He has a very close-knit family that supports him in everything. Wilson is studying to become a lawyer. Through his studies, he hopes to open a path to the professional work world and be able to help his family. Wilson is requesting this loan in order to pay university fees. This will help him to continue his studies and keep up his efforts.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos es un agricultor de granos básicos y hortalizas  que vive en la comunidad de Olanchito Honduras, tiene 32 años y  para generar un ingreso extra también trabaja como jornalero. Junto a su esposa Maria tienen el sueño  de llegar a tener un pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ya  son personas muy trabajadoras y con ganas de superación y desean ver a sus tres hijos convertidos en profesionales. Por eso trabajan duro para lograrlo pero, uno de los obstáculos con los que ellos se encuentran a diario es que en la comunidad donde viven no hay servicio de energía eléctrica por lo que Santos ha decidido solicitar financiamiento a Soluz Honduras para la compra de un Sistema solar, ya que hasta ahora  la única forma de mantenerse alumbrados es por medio de  velas y lámparas de kerosén,  lo que  ocasiona graves problemas a la salud y provoca gastos en la economía, por ello es necesario  contar con el sistema solar, porque mejoraría sus vidas y las tareas del hogar también se facilitarían.
texts.en:
Santos is a farmer who grows basic grains and vegetables. He lives in the community of Olanchito, Honduras. Santos is 32 years old and, in order to earn extra money, he works as a day laborer. Together with his wife, Maria, Santos dreams of opening a small business selling food. They are both hardworking people who want to succeed and see their three children become professionals. For this reason, they work hard to achieve it. One of the obstacles facing them each day is that their community does not have electricity. 

Santos has decided to request a loan from Soluz Honduras in order to buy a solar energy system. Until now, the only way of keeping light in their home has been to use candles and kerosene lamps, which cause serious health problems and are expensive. A solar energy system is necessary for Santos in order to improve the quality of life of his family and let them carry out their household tasks.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system to improve the quality of life in his home and not damage his children's health.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old Kalpana lives in a small village named Madhya Boragari of Dhupguri in West Bengal. She is a careful mother of four daughters. She is illiterate but can sign her name. At a very early age she got married, but she has a great determination to provide her daughters a decent lifestyle with good education. Thus, she works hard to provide every support to her daughters. Her daughters read in grades 11, 9, 7, and 1 respectively. Kalpana’s husband is engaged with farming activities, and his income is marginal.

Kalpana’s daughter, 15-year-old Pabata, is studying in grade 11 in Vidyasram Divya Joti Vidyaniketan High School, a local school in Dhipguri. She has chosen the arts stream. She is serious about her studies and tries to score good marks in her examinations.

Kalpana faces difficulties to bear the education expenses of her four daughters after meeting the household costs with the sole income of her husband, yet she is striving hard to provide uninterrupted education to her daughter. Now Pabata needs some books for her daughter’s studies and a bicycle for her to go to school and tuition classes.

Hence, as a responsible mother, Kalpana is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to bear the educational expenses of her daughter. She plans to pay educational fees, and buy books and a bicycle for her daughter. This loan will help this bright young girl to continue her education without any obstacles.

Kalpana and Pabata (in the photo) are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's educational expenses.

loans.name: Marta Morena

texts.es: Marta de 49 años de edad, vive en casa propia a lado de su compañero de vida con quien lleva muchos años juntos. Ella es una mujer tenaz que se gana la vida como promotora de salud, y es gracias a este trabajo que apoya a su compañero de vida con la economía familiar, además por el tipo de trabajo que desempeña también es un aporte a la comunidad, ya que los apoya con temas muy importantes para su salud. Marta desea colocar una cerca de lamina y de malla al rededor de la vivienda como muestra la fotografía pero no posee el capital suficiente para realizarlo  por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lamina, malla de alambre, clavos, grapas para alambre de púas, madera,  etc.,  y de esta manera poder brindar a su familia una mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Marta is 49 years old, lives in her own home with her partner who she has been with for many years. She is a strong women who makes a living as a health promoter. Due to this job she is able to support her partner with family expenses. Additionally, due to the type of job that she carries out, she also supports the community, as she provides them with topics that are very important for health. 

Marta wishes to place a fence of metal and mesh around her house, as shown in the picture, but she doesn't have sufficient capital to make it happen. For this reason she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in metal, wire mesh, nails, staples for barbed wire, wood, etc. so that this way, she can provide her family with better security.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, wire mesh, nails, staples for barbed wire, wood, etc., to put a metal fence in her home.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 48 years old, married and a refugee. She is a widower and mother of three girls. She is a strong and very diligent woman.

Shahnaz is a farmer. She started to work in her field four years ago. She wants to plant new fruit trees, to grow different fruits and then sell them on the market.

Shahnaz gives importance to human lives - that’s why she grows organic. In addition, in Azerbaijan people prefer to buy fruits and vegetables from private gardens, because they are naturally raised and cheaper.

Her biggest dream is to expand her land and to plant more seeds, but, for this, she has to have some funds. With this loan, she will purchase more land and sow more seeds.

We need Kiva lenders to support Shahnaz.

loans.use: to expand her land and to plant more seeds

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik is 24 years old and he lives alone in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region. Garik’s mother and sister are abroad, and now he temporally takes care of himself, the house, and his farm, alone but perfectly. 

On the farm Garik has cows, calves, heifers and chickens. He sells milk, meat and eggs right from his farm. He is a beginner, but being alone, he is already skilled to overcome any hardship that may appear in his farming. With this Kiva loan he wants to buy a calf and cattle fodder. Garik mentions that he has great plans to enlarge his farm and with this loan he wants to take his first step.

loans.use: to buy a calf and cattle fodder.

loans.name: Sharafet

texts.en:
Sharafet is a 60-year-old married mother of four kids. She is a refugee and lives with her parents in an IDP settlement. 

Sharafet is a dairy farmer. She is a hardworking and successful person. When Sharafet was young, she started keeping dairy cows 30 years ago, with a small amount of capital. Ever since, Sharafet has developed and steadily grown her business to a point where she is able to get more then 10 liters of milk every day, which she sells to her customers in the local bazaar. 

Sharafet grew up in her village and loves and is attached to this place and her family. So, she does this work with great love and passion. Now, Sharafet wants to grow her business and buy a few more cows to improve her business and family's conditions. She has taken a loan two times from Agroinvest in the past and has always made repayments on time. She needs some funds and Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: to buy a few more cows to improve her business and family's conditions.

loans.name: Flor Anabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Artesanal se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable.
En este lugar vive la señora Flor, tiene  46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos, de 27 y 19 años de edad, el menor estudia en universidad. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Flor es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta trabajar y así ganarse la vida honradamente, ella se dedica al comercio de calzado, todos los días instala un pequeño puesto en una de las calles principales de la ciudad lugar en la cual muchos comerciantes al igual que ella  venden sus productos, los días que más vende son los fines de semana ya que es cuando salen las personas del campo y le compran a ella, lleva más de 20 años en este negocio el cual le permite ganar algo por su cuenta y contribuir con los gastos del hogar y  estudios de su hijo.
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos en varios tamaños y modelos. Lleva 15 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un gran local y que su hijo sea un gran profesional.
texts.en:
The Grupo De Crédito Artesanal meets every 15 days in the Jipijapa canton, a canton known for having the name of the sultan of coffee due to its extensive coffee cultivation which has an incomparable taste.

In this region lives Mrs. Flor. She is 46 years old, married, and from this marriage has two children of 27 and 19 years of age. The youngest studies in the university. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Mrs. Flor is a very hard-working women who likes to work and this way, earn a living honestly. She works in shoe sales. Every day she installs a small kiosk in one of the main streets of the city, an area where many traders just like her sell their products. The days that she sells the most are during the weekends since this is when people from the country arrive and purchase from her. She has more than 20 years in this business, which allows her to earn on her own and contribute to the expenses of the household and education of her son.

This loan is to the buy shoes in various sizes and models. She has been with the Grupo De Crédito for 15 years and she likes it because the loans allow her to finance her business. Her dream is to have a large shop and that her son becomes a great professional.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Anas

texts.en:
Anas needs support to achieve his dreams. He is a simple guy who lives with his family in Mafraq. He is 27 years old.

Anas is studying at the University majoring in finance. He chose this major because his dream is to work in this field.

His current goal is to graduate from college and start a new life, but the financial problems faced by his family are an obstacle standing in front of him. He decided to apply for an education loan to be able to cover his university fees and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to cover tuition fees

loans.name: Seyla Edith

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Artesanal se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable.
En este lugar vive la señora Seyla, tiene  72 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es jubilado.
Doña Seyla es una mujer que le gusta ganarse lo suyo y con esto contribuir con los gastos del hogar y más ahora que su marido no puede trabajar porque está enfermo,  ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale casi todos los días en sus ratos libres y también vende en su casa, lleva más de 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual les ayuda a salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de todo tipo. Esta desde el inicio en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The Grupo De Crédito Artesanal (Group of Artisan Credit) meets every fifteen days in the canton of Jipijapa.  The canton is named after the sultan of coffee because of its extensive coffee production, of incomparable flavor.

Seyla lives here.  She is 72 years old and married.  She and her husband have six older, independent children. Her husband is retired.  Seyla is a woman who likes to earn her own money with which to contribute to the household expenses, even more so now since her husband cannot work due to an illness.  She makes her living through the sale of all types of clothing and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women).  Her method of selling is door to door.  She goes out almost every day in her free time and also sells from home.  She has worked at this business for over 12 years, which has helped them move forward.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and all types of clothing.  Seyla has been with the Grupo de Crédito from its start.  She likes it because thanks to its loans she began her business.  Her dreams are to keep advancing and be in good health in order to continue working.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Zamuka Group

texts.en:
Alphonsine is the group leader, aged 32. She is married with five children, who are between the ages of three and eleven years old. Four of them go to school. 

This group is called Zamuka, which means “shift” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change their futures for the better. Alphonsine sells food stuffs and has been in business for the past 15 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar and potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and make savings for the better future.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Thirty-one-year-old Babita is the mother of two school-going sons. She lives in a small village of Dhupguri. Her first priority in life is to provide good education to her sons. Her sons read in grades 8 and 4 respectively. Her husband is engaged with an agribusiness. His income varies with the season.

Babita is a housewife. Her elder son, Gopal, is a student of grade 8. He is 12 years old and reads in Bairatiguri High School. Babita is facing difficulty to cover her son’s educational expenses. Gopal is sincere about his studies and school curriculum. If he is provided with proper guidance, he can perform well in his examination. Babita has been unable to take care of all the things he needs to continue his studies.

Thus, as a responsible mother, Babita applied for an educational loan. She thanks BJS (Kiva’s partner) for helping her; this loan amount will resolve her anxiety. She will use the loan to buy education materials, pay the school fees, and will engage a private tutor for her son Gopal.

Babita hopes this educational support will give a boost to her son’s education. So, Babita and Gopal (as in the picture) are now very happy after getting the loan and are thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to bear the educational expenses of her son’s uninterrupted schooling.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a woman who is a model of ambitiousness and patience. She is a single mother of two children, who live with her in a poor area.
