After her husband left her with her children and no income, Huda felt that her children needed her more than ever, so she decided to overcome the obstacles and try her best to do anything to provide a living for her and them. She started a retail business in her house, but she needs to increase her income to provide a good life and perfect education to her children and to cover the household expenses. Huda applied for a loan to buy products like blankets or clothes to sell to increase her profits and improve her life.

She hopes to expand her work and to have an independent shop.

loans.use: to buy products like blankets or clothes to sell.

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: Louise, 34 ans, est célibataire et sans d’enfant. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et se préparer un avenir meilleur, elle fait de la vente de produits alimentaires. Sur son stand bien garni, on trouve un peu de tout pour préparer à manger. Ayant vu qu’elle n’a pas suffisamment de fonds pour augmenter ses stocks, Louise sollicite un emprunt afin d'acheter du riz, des spaghettis et d’autres produits à grande consommation journalière pour satisfaire la demande de ses clients.
texts.en:
Louise, 34 years old, is single and has no children. In order to support herself and prepare a better future for herself, she sells foodstuffs. On her well-stocked stand, you can find a bit of everything you need for preparing a meal.

Having seen that she doesn't have enough funds to expand her inventory, Louise is asking for a loan to buy rice, spaghetti, and other products that are used daily in great quantity, so that she can satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, spaghetti, and flour.

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Meena is a 55-year-old hardworking lady from Koraput district. She is the one who took the bold step of forming Maa Durga SHG-C Group by uniting and motivating the members to become self-reliant.

The lady standing to the left is Meena. She lives with her husband, who is engaged in farming, and two daughters who help her in the bakery business. She sells biscuits, cakes, buns, bread, and cookies in her shop.

Meena, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Meena will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase raw materials like milk, dough, flour, sugar and eggs, and a new oven. In this way, she will be able to make a voluminous number of items so as to meet the market demand and gain a higher amount of profit.

She has a dream of making her daughters married in a well-settled house by using part of her savings that she will gain from her bakery business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like milk, dough, flour, sugar and eggs, and a new oven.

loans.name: Kajal Mahila Mandal 1 Group

texts.en:
23-year-old Hetalben lives with her husband in Ahmedabad, Gujarat. She is the lady in the pink saree in the group picture. Hetalben runs her own petty shop. Her business helps her contribute 4,000 INR to her household monthly income. She wants a loan to expand her business and she will use it to purchase papads, sugar, tea, wheat, etc. to add to her stock at the shop. She expects her monthly income to increase by 2,000 INR after the expansion.

Lalitaben, Naniben, Laxmiben and Marimutap have joined Hetalben in applying for a loan to expand their businesses. The loan will be utilized by Lalitaben for her saree business; Naniben for her Bagsara (bangles, hair band, bindi) business; Laxmiben for her cloth business; and Marimutap for her snacks business. This group of women seeks a loan of 100,000 INR. Hetalben and her group are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to purchase papad, sugar, wheat, rice, etc. for expanding her petty shop business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bags of rice amongst others.

loans.name: Saharari

texts.en:
Saharari is a married woman of 31 years. She lives with her husband, Sudhindra, in the small village of Jogendrapur in Falakata with three sons, who are all students in different grades at the local village school. 

Saharari’s husband has been engaged in agriculture for many years. He cultivates different crops and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. Now they have thought of cultivating a crop which is profitable and in demand in all seasons. They have decided to grow chili on their farmland because chili is eaten cooked or raw for its fiery hot flavor in almost all Indian dishes. Having inadequate capital, they decided to seek some financial help for this cultivation. Thus, Saharari has applied for a loan from Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (Kiva’s partner). 

Saharari will use the loan to purchase good quality fertilizer and seeds for chili cultivation. The loan will greatly help this family to organize a good harvest, which will be lucrative as the crop has tremendous demand in the market. By expanding their agribusiness, Saharari dreams of building a concrete house for them in the future.

Saharari thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other necessary farm supplies for chili cultivation.

loans.name: Arevshat

texts.en:
This young farmer is 25 years old, and he is already the father of a year-old cheerful boy. Arevshat lives with his wife, son and parents in Geghamavan village of Gegharkunik region.

Arevshat is employed at a private workshop, but he is also engaged in farming and agriculture with the help of his father. Arevshat is a very industrious young man, and he is happy that his father shares with him all his skills in farming and in agricultural work as well. Arevshat already has a chance to become a skilled farmer at his young age.

Currently on the farm he has cows, calves, a heifer, a bull, a pig, sheep, lambs, a bee family and chickens. Arevshat sells his farm products (milk, cheese, honey, eggs and meat) with the help of his mother at the city’s wholesale market. On his plot of land Arevshat cultivates potato, cucumber, tomato and greens. These goods he also prepares for sale, mainly for re-sellers who are his regular buyers.

With this loan Arevshat wants to purchase animal fodder for his farm cattle and also a piglet for developing swine breeding.

loans.use: to purchase animal fodder for his farm cattle and also a piglet for developing swine breeding.

loans.name: Madhabi

texts.en:
Twenty-five-year-old Madhabi is a rural housewife from a small village, Purba Magurmari, in Dhupguri. She lives there with her husband Biplab and three daughters. One of them is a student, and the other two daughters are preschoolers. Madhabi has received education until grade five and did not continue further because of her family’s financial issues.

Her husband is a farmer by profession. He sells different crops and vegetables on his farmland and sells to the local market. This is the sole source of the family’s income. Being a housewife, Madhabi assists her husband in his agribusiness after managing her household work. The couple works hard for their livelihood, but they can hardly cover all the basic necessities of the family.

To achieve satisfactory earnings, Madhabi decided to grow paddy on their farmland because it is a very demandable and profitable crop all over India. Paddy is a crop that is full of nutrition and is a staple food in most of the rural areas. So, Madhabi seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to enhance her agribusiness with the cultivation of paddy.

She will purchase good-quality paddy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and other farm resources for cultivation. She hopes this will enable her to generate more income and profit, as well as improve her family’s economy.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase necessary farm resources for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Tabgninga Group

texts.fr: Sadongo, est âgée de 47 ans, elle est mariée mère de 5 enfants tous scolarisés. Vendeuse de condiments depuis plus de 10 ans. Son expérience et l’approvisionnement à tout moment et l’emplacement de son commerce sont pour elle un atout pour réussir son activité. Elle veut le prêt pour s’acheter 50000 d’oignon, 60 000 pour l’arachide qui sera transformé en pate d’arachide, 35 000 f pour le maïs qui va servir à la farine, 5000  pour des épices et autres. L’utilité du prêt c’est approvisionner son étalage en quantité suffisante afin de revendre et acquérir un bénéfice. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 2 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévue elle est une bonne cliente à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Sadongo, aged 47, is married and the mother of five children, all enrolled in school. She has been selling condiments for more than 10 years. Her experience, always having a good inventory, and the venue of her business are all trump cards for the success of her business.

Sadongo wants the loan to buy 50,000 francs worth of onions, 35,000 francs worth of maize to make flour, 60,000 francs worth of peanuts to be made into peanut butter, and 5,000 francs worth of spices and other items. The loan will serve to stock her shelves with a sufficient quantity to cover resale so that she can make a profit.

Sadongo has already received a loan twice and has reimbursed her loans on the due dates. She is a good client of ACFIME.

loans.use: to buy 50,000 francs worth of onions, 35,000 francs worth of maize, 60,000 francs worth of peanuts for peanut butter, and 5,000 francs worth of other items.

loans.name: Thembi

texts.en:
Thembi is a 48-year-old mother of one. She runs a daycare center from her backyard. The center is not financially stable yet due to low attendance by children. She thinks this is because she is not providing quality services that would make children comfortable. 

Thembi is therefore requesting a Kiva loan to buy chairs, tables, mattresses and educational toys to keep the children entertained and stimulated. She believes that these changes will create a better environment and help attract more children.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, mattresses and educational toys.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina is a light-hearted woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1986. She is living in a remote district with her family. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a constructor. She is a tailor. She sews beautiful traditional women's dresses at home. She was taught how to sew by her mother and sisters. She has two sewing machines that help her to work efficiently. She is planning to buy a new sewing machine and get students to teach how to sew. She appealed to IMON and Kiva to get a loan to buy a new sewing machine. She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Tapasi

texts.en:
Tapasi, 48 years old, is an enterprising lady and mother of one son. Her son is engaged with masonry work and her husband is a farmer by trade. Tapasi is illiterate but can sign her name. She lives with her family in a small village, Raghunathpur, in Kandi of West Bengal.

Tapasi runs a puffed rice making and selling business. Locally puffed rice is called ‘muri’. Puffed rice is a type of puffed grain made from rice, commonly used in breakfast cereal or snack foods, and served as a popular street food in India. It is usually made by heating rice kernels in a sand-filled oven. Puffed rice is very popular in rural areas.

Tapasi makes puffed rice in her home and supplies it in her neighborhood. Gradually her customers are increasing. Now she wants to expand her business by serving more customers, which will also increase her income. But the problem she is facing is inadequate capital to invest in her business.

Thus she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy good quality rice in bulk at a wholesale rate. Now she hopes she can satisfy her customers' demand by making more puffed rice. She expects a good profit from her business with the support of this loan.

Tapasi is grateful towards her lenders.

loans.use: to buy good quality rice in bulk, at a wholesale rate, for her puffed rice business.

loans.name: Gugulethu

texts.en:
Gugulethu is a 39-year-old mother of four who has been running a daycare center for the last 10 years. Her passion for children coupled with her business skills have seen the center grow consistently over the years. She currently employs four people to teach and help with other chores.

She wants to upgrade her center by installing a garden shade so that the children can play comfortably despite the weather. She also wants to put paving across the foot paths to provide quality and add safety for the children who run along these paths.

With a Kiva loan, she would be able to buy the shade, pay for its installation and buy pallets of paving bricks.

loans.use: to buy a garden shade and paving bricks

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
A furniture shop has been Merlyn's business involvement. She also offers coconut lumber to have an additional source of income. She has managed this kind of business for six years. She is married and has been blessed with five children. All her children are married.

According to her, she rented her stall amounting to PHP 2,200 a month. Merlyn is glad that her business operates well through the support of her husband and children. With her determination to keep her furniture shop business growing continuously and to improve her finished furniture products, she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000. She will use this loan to buy more stock of coconut tree, varnish and nails. She knows that this amount will help to increase her sales and satisfy her customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy coconut tree, varnish and nails for her furniture shop business

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 53 years of age, a widow who had four children. She offers a variety of used clothing within the public market of San Mateo. She has been running this business for more than three years.

Rosie's husband died 20 years ago due to hypertension. After her husband's death, she solely raised her four children. Her situation as a single parent pushes her to strive harder to sustain her family's basic necessities.

Rosie would like to focus herself on improving her clothing sales business to earn a living and save to secure her future. She plans to buy more stocks of second hand clothing ("ukay-ukay") such as pants, blouses, dresses, t-shirts and short pants to sell, but her capital is not enough. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000.

Rosie hopes that she can obtain the said loan amount to increase her sales and income and provide all that her customers demand.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of secondhand pants, blouses, dresses, t-shirts and short pants to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia Guadalupe

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Artesanal se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable.
En este lugar vive la señora Cecilia, tiene 45 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tuvo  tres hijos de 14, 12 y 6  años de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es empleado privado.
Doña Cecilia se dedica a la preparación de tortas y dulces que son muy solicitados por sus clientes, ella también elabora artesanías como diademas, collares, pulseras entre otras los mismos que al igual que sus dulces vende en su casa lugar donde tiene unas vitrinas en las que sus clientes pueden ver su mercadería. Ella lleva más de 6 meses con este local pero ya muchos años realizando esta actividad con la cual ayuda a su familia a vivir mejor.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para preparar los dulces y materiales para las artesanías. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta los créditos porque son  rápidos. Sus sueños son darles la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Artisan Credit Group” gathers each 15 days in Jipijapa Canton, known for the extensive cultivation of its 'sultan of coffee,' with its incomparable flavor.

Here we find Cecilia, who is 45 years old and lives in a common law marriage that has produced three children, ages 14, 12, and 6. The two elder children are studying in a primary school and the younger child is in first grade. Her husband is an employee in a private business. 

Cecilia prepares and sells sandwiches and sweets that are much in demand by her customers. "At home she also makes and sells artisan goods, such as diadems, necklaces and bracelets, among other things, and these also sell well. She displays them in glass cases where customers can see her merchandise. 

Cecilia has been selling from this location for more than six months but she has been making these items for many years. This helps her family to live better. 

The present loan is to purchase ingredients for preparing sweets and materials for her artisan jewelry. This is Cecilia's second loan cycle with the Artisan Credit Group. What she likes best about the loans is that they are dispensed in a timely fashion.

Cecilia's dream is to provide the best education for her children.

loans.use: buy ingredients for making sweets and materials for making her artisan jewelry.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle's primary source of income comes from her variety store. She has been doing this kind of business for 30 years. She also offers viand and has engaged herself in the hog-raising business.

Anabelle would like to increase her stocks of grocery items, such as ingredients, raw meat, frozen foods and cases of soft drinks to sell. With her determination to improve her variety store business, she decided to borrow additional capital of PHP 30,000. She knows that this loan amount will enable her to increase her generated income and satisfy her customers' demands.

Anabelle hopes and prays for approval of her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as ingredients, raw meat, frozen foods and cases of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ederlina

texts.en:
Ederlina has operated her variety store for ten years. She is married and had five children. Her husband is security. The couple works hard in order to generate income to sustain their family needs. She also offers siomai (steamed dumplings) and fruit shakes to have additional income.

Ederlina plans to increase the grocery items she offers, which is the reason she would like to borrow additional capital of PHP 10,000. She will use this loan amount to buy grocery items, such as cases of soft drinks, canned goods, charcoal and ten kilograms of rice. She knows that this loan amount will enable her to increase her income and provide what her customers demand.

Ederlina hopes that her requested loan will be granted.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as cases of soft drinks, canned goods, charcoal and ten kilograms of rice to sell.

loans.name: Nancy Azucena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Artesanal se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable.
En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 22 años que estudia en universidad. Su esposo trabaja en el Municipio del cantón.
Doña Nancy es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y así generar sus propios ingresos que les ayuden a salir adelante junto a su familia, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de víveres, pollo, carnes, granos, embutidos y muchos otros productos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes que a diario acuden a su local, su hijo le ayuda cuando está desocupado de sus estudios pero siempre es ella que está en su local, lleva más de 15 años con este negocio el cual es parte de su vida.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda y comprar más variedad de víveres. Lleva más de 13 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella cada vez aumenta su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su tienda.
texts.en:
The "Artesanal" communal bank meets every fortnight in Jipijapa canton, which is known as "the Sultan of Coffee" for it's extensive coffee crops with an incomparable taste.

Nancy lives in this place. She is 51 years old, married and from this realtionship has a 22 year old son who is studying in university. Her husband works for the municipal government.

Nancy is a woman who likes to earn her own way and generate her own income which helps the family get ahead. She has a small food store in her house where she sells all kinds of foods, chickens, meats, grains, sausages and many other products to satisfy the needs of her clients who come to her store daily. Her son helps her when he is not occupied with his studies but she is always in her store. She has been in this business for more than 15 years and it is part of her life.

This loan will be used to stock her store more and buy a greater variety of foods. She has been in the communal bank for 13 years and she likes it as she increases her business with each loan. Her dream is to continue to improve her store.

loans.use: to buy food.

loans.name: Kajal Mahila Mandal 2 Group

texts.en:
The lady in the centre in the picture is Ranjanaben. She runs her own saree business in Ahmedabad, Gujarat. She wants to take a loan to expand her saree business. With the loan, she will purchase materials to sell a variety of sarees – Bandhni sarees, plain sarees, Jarri Butta Sarees, etc. With the increased demand for her sarees, she expects her monthly income to increase by INR 1,000, making it INR 5,000.

Ranjanaben is 30 years old, and she lives with her husband and her little child, who is below the age of 6 years. Her household monthly income is INR 10,000, out of which INR 4,000 is saved, after deducting the monthly expenses.

Sarmista, Maunniben, Laxmiben and Manjulaben have joined Ranjanben in applying for a loan. Together, they seek a loan of INR 100,000, which they plan to repay over 12 months. This loan will be used by Sarmista in her wood business, Maunniben to run her snacks business, Laxmiben to purchase tea, milk, sugar, etc., for her new tea stall business, and Manjulaben for expanding her cloth business. Your loan will help these ambitious women realise their dreams. They are grateful for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase materials to expand her saree business.

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Artesanal se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene  65 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad.
Doña María es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado ganarse lo suyo y así salir adelante sola, ella tiene un taller de costura en su casa, allí confecciona ropa pero de preferencia de damas, ella también elabora artesanías como pulseras, aretes, collares  y otras bisuterías, las mismas que envía al Oriente Ecuatoriano donde unos familiares se encargan de vender. De esta forma ella logra salir adelante sin estar dependiendo de sus hijos. 
Este crédito lo va  emplear en comprar telas, cierres, hilos, materiales para la  costura y para las artesanías. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son  seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The Artisan Credit Group meets every two weeks in the Jipijapa district, which is known as the Sultana of coffee because of the vast coffee plantations whose coffee has a unique flavor. 

María, who is 65 years old, lives in this place. She is separated and has four independent, adult children from this relationship. Several years ago she learned dressmaking at an academy in town.

Maria is a woman who has always liked to earn her own living and succeed on her own. She has a sewing workshop at home, and makes ladies clothing. She also makes handicrafts such as bracelets, earrings, necklaces and other costume jewelry, which she sends to eastern Ecuador where relatives sell them. In this way she manages to get by without being dependent on her children.

She will use this loan to buy fabric, zippers, threads and materials for sewing and handicrafts. She has been part of the Credit Group since the beginning and she likes it because she gets ahead with the loans. Her dream is to continue working.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, zippers, threads and materials for sewing and handicrafts.

loans.name: Fulmala

texts.en:
Fulmala, 40 years old, is a permanent resident of Shoulmari village in Falakata. She is married and a mother of two sons. She is a housewife and her husband runs a shuttering business, making the basic structures of houses. Fulmala covers all the household costs and her son's education expenses with her husband’s income.

Her elder son, 20-year-old Prasanta, is a student of Bachelor of Arts 2nd year in Falakata College. He passed his 12th grade with good marks. Prasanta's aim is to be a teacher in the future, and so he wants to prepare himself from now onwards. But the family income is too low to cover daily household expenses as well as educational expenses. Prasanta needs books and study materials to score good marks in this academic year.

Therefore, as a responsible mother, Fulmala wants to apply for an educational loan from Kiva via BJS for her son, Prasanta, so that he can study throughout the year without any lack of basic student requirements. With the Kiva loan, she will pay his college fees and buy books and study materials for her elder son, Prasanta.

She is filled with so much joy to know that Kiva is lending a helping hand. Fulmala and Prasanta are thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for her son's education expenses.

loans.name: Tania Alexandra

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Artesanal se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable.
En este lugar vive la señora Tania, tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de seis y 1 año, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido trabaja en una camaronera. 
Doña Tania con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta,  sale casi todos los días a realizar sus ventas y también vende en su casa. Ella también prepara postres y comida pero solo bajo pedido.  Ella deja la mercadería a crédito y  cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 4 años dedicada a esta actividad, antes solo vendía comida pero aumento su negocio y ahora así le está yendo mucho mejor.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y zapatos. Lleva más de 7 años  en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque con los créditos financia su negocio que le permite salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Artesanal" meets every 15 days in Jipijapa canton (Ecuadorian state). This canton is known by the name "the sultan of coffee" because of its extensive plantings of coffee, which have an incomparable flavor. 

Tania lives in this area. She is 35 years old and has a common-law marriage from which she has two children, a six year old and a one year old. The oldest child studies at school. Her husband works in a shrimp company. 

Tania works in retail in order to earn something on her own. She sells all kinds of clothes, shoes, and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for ladies). She sells door to door; she goes out nearly every day to make her sales and also sells from her house. She also prepares desserts and food but only on request. She offers merchandise on credit and collects payments every eight days. She has worked for more than four years in this business. Before, she only sold food, but she increased her business and is doing much better. 

This loan is for buying clothing and shoes. She has been in the communal bank for more than seven years. She likes it because with the loans she finances her business which allows her to succeed. Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Al pasar los años, la comideria de Maria se ha venido convirtiendo en una de las mejores en su vecindario. Con más de quince años en la industria, ella siente que está en una de sus mejores etapas, pues se siente orgullosa y agradecida con todas las personas que la apoyaron con el último préstamo para comprar arroz, aceite y otros productos para aumentar su producción y venta de comida. 
Los resultados de esta emprendedora de 61 años de edad han sido más que positivos, de manera que solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar más arroz, aceite, leña, frijoles, vegetales, entre otros materiales indispensables para elaborar una comida de calidad. Con esta inversión podrá seguir incrementando más ganancias, ahorrar tiempo en las compras y dedicarle más tiempo  dedicación a su familia. Al cancelar, Maria pretende seguir invirtiendo pues, ella trabaja sola y es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
With the passing of the years, Maria's eatery has become one of the best in her neighborhood. With more than 15 years in the industry she feels that she is in one of her best periods. She feels proud and is grateful to all the people who supported her with her last loan with which she bought rice, oil and other products to increase her production and food sales.

The results for this enterprising 61 year old have been more than positive. So she is requesting a new loan to buy more rice, oil, wood, beans and vegetables amongst others needed to prepare her quality foods. With this investment she can continue to increase her income, save time on her purchasing and have more time to dedicate to her family. As a final note Maria hopes to continue to invest as she works alone and this is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy more rice, oil, wood, beans and vegetables amongst others.

loans.name: Sonia Rosanna

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuevas Amigas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable. 
Aquí vive la señora Sonia, tiene 45 años  de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 27 y 17 años de edad, el menor esta por ingresar a la universidad, ambos aun viven en su casa. 
Doña Sonia es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar duro para ganar sus propios recursos  para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella  se dedica al comercio, vende de ropa de todo tipo, perfumes, carteras, relojes entre otras cosas, ella recibe mercadería desde los Estados Unidos, cuando le llega la mercadería sus clientes la visitan ya que es de primera calidad y a muy buen precio. Lleva más de 25 años con este negocio razón por lo cual cuenta con muy buena clientela que siempre le piden más productos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, carteras, relojes entre otras cosas que ella vende. Esta desde el inicio en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The "Nuevas Amigas" communal bank meets every fortnight in Jipijapa canton which is known as "The Sultan of Coffee" for it's extensive coffee crops with it's incomparable taste.

Sonia lives here. She is 45 years old and the mother of two children aged 27 and 17 years old. The youngest is about to enter university and both of them still live at home.

Sonia is a woman who has had to work hard to earn her own resources to raise her children. She works in commerce selling all kinds of clothing, perfume, handbags and watches amongst other things. She gets her merchandise from the United States and when the merchandise arrives her clients visit her as it is of top quality and very well priced. She has been in this business for more than 25 years so she has a good clientele who always request her products.

This credit will be used to buy clothing, perfume, handbags and watches amongst other things that she sells. She has been in the communal bank since it's inception and she likes it as the loans are quick. Her dream is to own a large store.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfume, handbags, watches, etc.

loans.name: Hill Edwin

texts.es:
Hill considera que los derechos de las personas son los más importantes para un mundo lleno de justicia, por esta razón decidió estudiar la licenciatura en Derecho. A sus 28 años de edad, es egresado de la carrera y trabaja como docente para seguir compartiendo sus conocimientos en un área que ya aprendió lo necesario para crear líderes. 
Este joven con grandes visiones para el futuro, sueña con llegar a sacar un posgrado y poner más en práctica lo que ha aprendido en la carrera, pero ahora está enfocado como docente de la licenciatura. Por esta razón, solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora que le sirve para impartir sus clases y seguir en ese trayecto en búsqueda de la justicia mediante los derechos.
texts.en:
Hill considers that the rights of a person are of utmost importance for a world full of justice and for this reason he decided to study for a Law degree. At 28 years of age he graduated and works as a teacher in order to continue to share his knowledge in a field that he has learned what is necessary to create leaders.

This young man with great vision for the future dreams of getting a post graduate degree and put more of what he has learned in this studies to practice. But for now he is focusing on being a Law professor. For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy a computer which will help him give his classes and continue on his path searching for justice through the Law.

loans.use: buy a computer.

loans.name: Famille Kibi Group

texts.fr: C'est à partir des années 1995 que les membres de la famille KIBI ont commencé à pratiquer la riziculture pour subvenir aux besoins familiaux. Souvent frappés par l'insuffisance de moyens financiers, les maladies du paddy et le manque d'un bon marché pour l'écoulement du produit constituent les obstacles majeurs à l'activité; ils espèrent que la fréquence de crédits PAIDEK aura un effet sur l'amélioration réelle de leurs foyers. Museserwa est président du groupe KIBI,il tient un carnet rose sur la photo.
texts.en: Starting in 1995, the members of the Kibi family began to grow rice to support their family. Often hampered by insufficient financial means, paddy rice diseases and the lack of a good market where they could sell their harvests were major obstacles in their activity. They hope that frequent loans through PAIDEK will bring about a true improvement in their households. Museserwa is the president of the Family Kibi Group; he is holding a pink booklet in the photo.

loans.use: to maintain his fields, buy fertilizer and phytosanitary products, and pay labor.

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Veuve de 54 ans, Afiwa est une femme qui habite à Tokoin et ayant un enfant à charge. Afiwa prépare et vend de la pâte et du foufou au marché. Afiwa achète le nécessaire au marché deux fois par mois. Afiwa sollicite ce crédit pour commander le maïs, le manioc et des condiments. Avec le surplus de son revenu, Afiwa va pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires de son enfant.
texts.en:
Widowed at 54, Afiwa is a woman who lives in Tokoin and is raising one child. She prepares and sells dough and foufou (cooked, mashed manioc) in the market.

Afiwa buys the necessary ingredients at the market twice a month. She is requesting this loan to order maize, manioc, and condiments. With the surplus revenue, Afiwa will be able to cover school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of manioc, one sack of maize, and two piles of condiments.

loans.name: Hanta

texts.fr:
Hanta est une mère travailleuse et combative de 39 ans. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur de taxi, et il n'est pas le propriétaire de la voiture qu'il conduit. Ils ont ensemble trois adorables filles de 14 à 19 ans. Elles vont tous à l'école en ce moment. Hanta était orpheline depuis sa toute petite enfance et c'est la raison pour laquelle, elle voudrait une vie meilleure pour ses trois filles et tout cela la pousse vivement à travailler dur.
Elle exerce une activité de vente de friperie depuis 1999 c'est à dire juste après son mariage. Et tous les week-ends, elle fait de vente ambulante de collations. C'est une femme débrouillarde qui cherche toujours à améliorer son affaire et la vie de sa famille. Elle va utiliser le prêt pour acheter des marchandises supplémentaires pour améliorer son achalandage.
Plus tard, lorsque ses épargnes lui permettent, elle envisagera de construire sa propre maison, elle possède déjà en ce moment un terrain.
texts.en:
Hanta is hard-working and has a fighting spirit. She is married to a taxi driver but he is not the owner of the car he drives.Together, they have three adorable daughters from 14 to 19 years old. They all attend school at the moment.

Hanta was an orphan from early childhood, and that is the reason why she would like her three daughters to have a better life. All that pushes her to work very hard. She has been selling used clothes since 1999, that is, since right after her marriage. And all weekend, she sells snacks on foot. She is a can-do woman who is always looking to improve her business and her family's living conditions.

Hanta is going to use the loan to stock up on more inventory to improve her business's attractiveness. Later on, when her savings allow it, she hopes to build her own house. She already owns a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy sheets, towels, socks, and peuches.

loans.name: Jesús Irene

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Artesanal se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable.
En este lugar vive la señora Jesús, tiene  41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 23, 14  y 11 años de edad, los dos menores estudian en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Jesús es una mujer muy buena que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su labor, él se dedica al comercio, vende  sabanas, cortinas, edredones, ollas, planchas, artículos de plásticos, cucharas y muchos otros artículos para el hogar, el fleta un carro en el cual una o dos veces por semana se desplaza a otros pueblos donde siempre le compran y el resto de la semana vende por la ciudad y otros lugares más cercanos. El trabajo es un poco cansado pero él lo hace ya que es así como puede sacar adelante a su familia. Tiene más 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual empezó con los créditos que recibió. 
Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, cortinas, edredones, ollas, planchas y otros artículos para el hogar. Lleva más de 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó  su negocio. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Artesanal” communal bank meets every two weeks in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as “La Sultana del Café” because of the large fields of incomparably flavored coffee.

Jesús lives here.  She is 41 years old, married and from this relationship she has three children who are 23, 14 and 11 years old.  The two younger ones attend school.  Her husband is a salesman.

Jesús is a very good woman who is taking out the loan so that her husband can use it in his work.  He makes a living selling sheets, curtains, quilts, cooking pots, irons, plastic products, spoons and many other items for the home.  He hires a car in which once or twice a week he goes around to other towns where they always buy from him and the rest of the week he sells around the city and in other places that are closer.  The work is a little tiring but he does it as this is the way he can get his family ahead.  He has been working in this activity for more than three years; he started it with loans received. 

This loan is to buy sheets, curtains, quilts, cooking pots, irons and other items for the home.  She has more than three years in the communal bank and she likes it because with one of the loans her husband started his business.  

Their dreams are to give their children the best.

loans.use: to buy sheets, curtains, quilts, cooking pots, irons and other items for the home.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is the single mother of three children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She earns a living by selling clothing and has been in this business for four years. She works in a local market seven days a week on retail basis, and is requesting a loan for 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes, including more blouses and skirts, to sell. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. In the future, Joan hopes to become a wholesaler and buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house that has access to electricity but not plumbing. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en: Aminah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child. She takes care of additional family members. She sells fried cassava, pancakes and other snacks at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last two years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy cooking oil, flour, cassava and baking powder. Her major challenges include the seasonality of cassava flour. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house, and the family has no access to piped water or electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, cassava and baking powder.

loans.name: Alla Ka Tiedeme Group

texts.fr:
AMARA  a  le  ver sur  sa  poitrine avec ses barbes blanches au bout juste a coté de la tête du bœuf sur la photo. AMARA  est  âgé de  52 ans, père de famille  avec   12 enfants  qui  sont  âgés  de  5 à 26 ans  donc  9  sont  scolarisés ,. Il est  gentil  avec  tout  le  monde  dans  son domicile.  Son  activité  principale  est l’embouche  des  bœufs, c’est-à-dire, il s’approvisionne en  bœufs à Nara, et juste après il s’occupe directement à l’entretien et les soins vétérinaires.    Il peut également gagner des bœufs  qui  lui  produit  du lait, il commercialise le lait produit par des vaches aux consommateurs et qui lui permet de couvrir les petites dépenses de la famille.il les  vend aux acheteurs ruraux et urbains et qui peut lui rapporter un bénéfice 100 000 FCFA par bœuf.   sa  femme  est  une  fonctionnaire  à la  retraite ,de nos  jour  elle  fait  le  petit  commerce  de  thé, sucre, etc…  
Il fait recourt  au RMCR pour augmenter  le nombre de ses bœufs qui était un obstacle de son projet.
Il exerce  cette activité génératrice de revenu, il y a plusieurs  années  cela.
Amara, son rêve est d’avoir  une laiterie à sa  disposition pour bien relancer son projet.
texts.en:
Amara, with glasses on his chest and a white beard, is at the end beside the head of the cow in the photo. Amara is 52, the father of a family, with 12 children aged 5 to 26, of whom nine are enrolled in school. He is kind to all those in his household.

Amara's main activity is fattening cattle, that is, he buys cattle at Nara, and then he immediately cares for them and provides them veterinary care. Sometimes he buys cows that produce milk. He sells the milk the cows give to customers and that allows him to cover small expenses for his family. Amara resells the cattle to buyers, both rural and urban, and he can make a profit of 100,000 F CFA per animal. His wife is a retired civil servant; presently she is a small-scale retailer of tea, sugar, etc.

Amara came to RMCR to expand his herd, whose size was an obstacle for his business. He has been in this money-earning activity for a number of years. His dream is to have a milking barn that he can use to get his business going well again.

loans.use: to buy cattle, raise them, and then resell them.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a single mother of two children; one child goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members.

She operates a food stall at the market on a retail basis and has been in this business for two years.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy yams, sweet potatoes and cassava.

She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality of food.

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO to get additional capital.

She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy yams, sweet potatoes and cassava.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married mother of one child who goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members.

She operates a beauty salon in her home area on a retail basis and has been in this business for two years.

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy weaves, braids and hair relaxers.

She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO to get additional capital.

She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food. Her goal is to see her beauty salon expand, providing more services to her customers.

loans.use: to buy weaves, braids and hair relaxers.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She also looks after her parents.

She has operated a beauty salon at the market for several years, working seven days a week. She is also involved in farming as an additional source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 1,200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy braids, weaves, hair relaxers, treatments and other cosmetics. Her major challenges include seasonality, an unstable power supply and high taxes.

Her dream is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy braids, weaves, hair relaxers, treatments and other cosmetics.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married with four children, all are attending school. She also takes care of additional family members.

She operates a beauty salon at the market on a retail basis in a shop that she rents. She has operated the shop for nine years. She works seven days a week. Her major challenge is on and off power affecting her work at the salon.

She has applied for a loan of UGX 1,200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy boxes of cream relaxers, hair treatments, weaves and braids.

She would like to get more capital to start selling cosmetics. She lives in a rented house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy boxes of cream relaxers, hair treatments, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is married with six children, three of whom attend school. She takes care of additional family members. She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for 15 years.

She has applied for a loan of 1,100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil and crates of soda.

She generates additional income from poultry farming. She works in the shop seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include the unstable prices of the commodities she sells. She aspires to build rental houses.

She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, boxes of soap, cooking oil and crates of soda

loans.name: José

texts.fr:
25 ans, marié, José est un jeune père de famille responsable et consciencieux. Il a un enfant de 5 ans et qui est en classe de 11ème.
Il dirige avec sa femme un magasin général avec gargote (mofo sy kafe), il y a maintenant 5 ans, pour gagner sa vie. Auparavant, il était chauffeur de taxi et c'est sa femme seule qui était à la tête de cette activité. L'exploitation se développait petit à petit et c'est pourquoi, il décidait de laisser tomber le taxi et d'aider sa femme à tenir le magasin. C'est un homme travailleur infatigable, il commence très tôt le matin et tard le soir. Il projette d'étendre l'activité,renforcer le fonds de roulement, renouveler les stocks de marchandises avec le prêt.  
La famille habite actuellement dans une maison à location, le projet est d'épargner davantage d'abord, acheter un terrain ensuite, et construire sa propre maison après.
texts.en:
At 25 years of age and married, José is a young, responsible and consciencious father of a family. He has a child of five who is in first grade.

Together with his wife, José has been running a general store and coffee shop for five years now to earn his living. Earlier, he was a taxi driver and it was his wife who ran the activity alone. The business developed little by little and that's why José decided to stop the taxi-driving and help his wife keep the shop.

José is an indefatigable worker; he starts work early and works till late in the evening. He hopes to expand the business, grow his working capital, and renew his inventory with the loan. The family is presently living in a rented house. They hope to save more first to buy a plot of land, and then build their own house.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, coffee, edible oil, and pasta

loans.name: Cruz Antonia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuevas Amigas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable. 
Aquí vive la señora Cruz, tiene 51 años  de edad, es madre soltera de tiene un hijo de 19 años el cual estudia en universidad y aún viven en su casa. 
Doña Cruz es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante junto a su hijo, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, aguas, colas, helados, entre otros productos de primera necesidad, trabaja todos los días y en ocasiones su hijo le ayuda con el negocio, aunque es ella la que le gusta estar atenta a las necesidades de sus clientes. Lleva más de 10 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganarse la vida honradamente.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, colas, aguas, helados y otros víveres. Está desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son una bendición para ella. Sus sueños son que su hijo sea un gran profesional.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" meets every 15 days in Jipijapa canton (Ecuadorian state). This canton is known by the name "the sultan of coffee" because of its extensive plantings of coffee, which have an incomparable flavor. 

Mrs. Cruz lives here. She is 51 years old and is the single mother of a 19-year-old son who studies at university and still lives at home. Mrs. Cruz is a woman who likes to work to get ahead alongside her son. She has a grocery store in her house. She sells products like rice, sugar, oils, detergents, water, sodas, and ice cream among other necessities there. She works every day, and on occasion her son helps her with the business, although she is the one who likes being attentive to the needs of her customers. She has spent more than ten years in this business which lets her earn an honest living. 

This loan will be used to supply more in her store. She will buy rice, sugar, sodas, water, ice cream, and other supplies. She has been with the communal bank from the beginning, and she likes it because the loans are a blessing for her. Her dream is that her son becomes a great professional.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, sodas, water, ice cream, and other items

loans.name: Alba Elena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Nuevas Amigas que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable. 
En este lugar vive la señora Alba, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo trabaja en un cementerio privado.
Doña Alba es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de Yanbal y Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y en su casa, a ella le encanta vender y ya son más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio el cual siempre le deja muy buenos beneficios.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Esta desde el inicio en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante en su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en: The Credit Group "Nuevas Amigas" meets up every two weeks in the Jipijapa canton, a canton known as "Coffee Sultan" for its extensive coffee plantations which have an incomparable taste. This is where 54 year old Alba lives. She is married and has three adult children: two of them are still living at home. Her husband works at a private cemetery. Alba is a housewife, who works selling Yanbal and Avon cosmetics (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women accessories) in order to earn her own resources. Her way of sale is door to door and in her house. She loves to sell, and it has been more than 15 years since she has worked in this business which always leaves her with good profits. This loan is to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics. From the beginning, she has been in this Credit Group, and she likes it because the loans allow her to progress in her business. Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Libia Sofia

texts.es:
Un quintal de maíz fue el inicio del emprendimiento de Libia, una madre soltera de 29 años de edad, que deicidio lanzar su tortillería hace cinco años para tener un ingreso fijo para ella y para su hijo de 13 años, quien sueña con emprender inglés como segundo idioma. Luego ella fue agregando la venta de verduras. 
Afortunadamente Libia cuenta con el apoyo de su madre y de su hijo, quienes le ha ayudado hacer crecer el negocio. Ahora quiere invertir más en su negocio, pues se ha diversificado. Por esta razón, solicita un préstamo para comprar frutas, verduras, maíz, leña y cal, productos necesarios para seguir ofreciendo producto de calidad y en grandes cantidades. En sus metas esta seguir agregando los productos y hacer mejoras en el local.
texts.en:
A quintal of corn was the start of Libia's entrepreneurship. She is a 29 year old single mother who decided to open her tortilla shop five years ago in order to have a fixed income for her and her 13 year old son. He dreams of learning English as a second language. Later she added the sales of vegetables.

Fortunately Libia can count on the help of her mother and son who have helped her to expand her business. Now she wants to invest more in her business as she has diversified. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy fruits, vegetables, corn, wood and lime, products needed to continuing offering her quality products in large quantities. Amongst her goals is to continue adding products and improving her sales space.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, corn, wood and lime.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba is a communicative woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan into a family of workers.

For about 15 years she has been doing business buying and selling greens and vegetables. She has a good amount of experience in this sphere. She knows her business well and is well-mannered with customers. She is a nice woman with a heart of peace

She is planning to expand her business and is requesting a loan to buy grocery products as vegetables and greens. She hopes to be supported, because her only source of income to make a living is her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery products as vegetables and greens

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 54 years old. She is married with six children. She is a cereals trader and has been in this business for 25 years.

She will be using the loan to buy more maize to sell, and she hopes this will enable her to make more income to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to grow her business, make more income, and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell, and she hopes this will enable her to make more income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Scolastica

texts.en:
Scolastica 36 years old. She is married with four children.

She does farming, growing maize and green grams (mung beans). She has been farming for the past 17 years and it has been profitable. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, and she will use it to buy fertilizer and also pay school fees for her children. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be a successful farmer with enough income to cater for her family needs comfortably.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra lives in the small village of Kandi in West Bengal, India. She is 32 years old and the mother of three children (one son and two daughters). All of her children are studying in different grades in the local village school.

Sumitra and her husband have been engaged in a milk and cottage cheese selling business for five years. Sumitra rears cows and supplies milk to her neighborhood. She also prepares cottage cheese in her home and sells it in the market and in local sweetmeat shops. There is a great demand for her pure milk and cottage cheese in their locality, so gradually their customers are also increasing. Now they need to expand their business to produce more cow's milk and cottage cheese. Thus Sumitra plans to buy one more cow. To execute her plan, Sumitra is seeking a loan from BJS (a Kiva partner).

The loan amount will be of great help to Sumitra in terms of getting more milk and cottage cheese for running her business smoothly. She will provide continuous education to her children with the profit from her business.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her cottage cheese and milk selling business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a talented woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1977. She lives in a small city with her family. She is divorced and has one daughter.

Marina has her own business. She is a tailor and sews traditional Tajik women's dresses at home. Year by year she increased her working capital and now she has a mini enterprise of sewing dresses. She has permanent clients every day.

Marina's sewing machine has become old and does not sew right. She appealed to Kiva lenders to buy a new sewing machine. She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Mayarani

texts.en:
28-year-old Mayarani is a married woman and a mother of two sons who are pursuing quality education. She lives with her family in a remote village of Falakata.

Mayarani's husband is a farmer who has his own agricultural land where he grows different types of crops and vegetables. Having lot of experience in this line, he grows good quality crops and sells his produce at a cheaper price compared to other sellers. That's why there is a huge demand of his production in the local market. Being a housewife, Mayarani helps her husband in his daily agricultural activities. Now they want to cultivate the paddy because the climate and soil of their region are perfectly suitable for this cultivation.

Mayarani has applied for a loan from BJS (a Kiva partner) to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies to grow good quality paddy so that they can satisfy more customers. This will enable them to generate more income and better profits so that they can improve their family’s standard of living.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen has successfully built her business of milk sales with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. She also sells animals to generate an extra amount of income.

Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan, she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase another cow to increase her sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her sales to more cities and to gain more profits

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 55 years old. She is married, and she and her spouse have two children. 

Damaris is a farmer, a business she has done for 15 years, and it has been profitable. This is her third loan from VisionFund Kenya, and she will use it to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds.

She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to meet her family budget. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to see her farming business grow stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad has successfully built her milk sales business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another cow to increase her sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her sales to more cities and to gain more profits

loans.name: Sai Mahila Mandal -1 Group

texts.en:
Minaben (the lady in the pink saree) is a young entrepreneur from the Kutch district in Gujarat. At the age of 22, she runs her own general store. She earns 5,000 INR per month from her business. Seeing the demand in her locality, she has decided to expand her business to sell other items, such as cold drinks, wafers, etc. She expects her business to grow and give her an additional income of 1,500 INR per month, if she invests more into her business. Therefore, she seeks a loan to purchase more items for her store.

Minaben is not alone when it comes to women who are successfully running their own businesses. Aminabai runs a vegetable business, Kajbanu has a livestock business, and Manjuben manages her fodder-selling business. This group of four women seeks a loan of 60,000 INR to expand their individual businesses. Your loan will help these women contribute more to their household income. They are grateful to you for your loan.

loans.use: to purchase items such as cold drinks, wafers, etc. to expand her general store.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria inicio desde muy joven con su pulpería, pues desde pequeña se miraba como una mujer independiente. Ahora a sus 42 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos menores de 17 años, es esposa de un marido que la apoya en todo lo que necesita y posee por más de 22 años una pulpería muy reconocida en su vecindario.  
Las expectativas de Maria son seguir creciendo y ayudar a que sus hijos se vuelvan en grandes profesionales. Por esta razón, no duda en invertir en su negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar jabón, leche, arroz sopas instantáneas, entre otros productos de gran demanda en su pulpería. Esto le permitirá seguir obteniendo la variedad en su negocio. En sus metas esta mejorar el local y seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria started with her grocery store from a young age, since from being little she saw herself as an independent woman. Now at the age of 42 she is the mother of two children under 17 years of age, and is the wife to a husband who supports her in everything she needs. For more than 22 years she has had a grocery shop which is very well-known in the neighbourhood. 

Maria's hopes are to continue to grow and to help her children to become great professionals. For this reason she does not hesitate to invest in her business, which is why she is asking for a loan to buy soap, milk, rice, instant soups and other items which are in high demand in her grocery shop. This will allow her to continue providing variety in her business. Among her goals are to improve her premises and to continue supporting her children.

loans.use: to buy soap, milk, rice, instant soups and other items.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia has successfully established her embroidery business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more spools of threads along with beads, sequins, and glittering material.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads along with beads, sequins, and glittering material

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La venta de gas líquido, ha sido la principal fuente de ingresos de Maria, quien ya lleva más de cuatro años trabajando en este negocio que ha ido creciendo fuertemente. Anteriormente, ella había solicitado un préstamo para comprar líquido de tropigas, lo que la ayudó a incrementar sus ventas, razón por la cual se siente muy agradecida con las personas que le han apoyado en ese préstamo. 
Ahora siente que es tiempo de hacer una nueva inversión, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar diez tanques de gas vacíos y más gas líquido para seguir vendiendo. Esta emprendedora de cuarenta años de edad, siente que esto le permitirá seguir creciendo la lista de clientes y seguir ahorrando para tener más ingresos para montar su nuevo negocio de productos nutritivos y vitamínicos.
texts.en:
The sale of liquid gas has been Maria's main source of income. She has been working in this business for more than four years and it has been growing strongly. Previously she had asked for a loan to buy liquid Tropigas, which helped her to increase her sales. For this reason she feels very grateful to the people who helped her with that loan. 

Now she feels that it is time to make a new investment and so she is asking for a loan to buy ten empty gas bottles and more liquid gas to continue selling. This 40-year-old entrepreneur feels that this will allow her to continue growing her customer base and continue saving up so she can have more income to set up her new nutrition products and vitamins business

loans.use: to buy ten empty gas bottles and more liquid gas.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Portoviejo es la capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador, conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana asentada en la región costanera, aquí se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo de Crédito La California.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 70 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es jubilado. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Rosa con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta para poder salir adelante se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja dos días a la semana desde las 9h00 hasta 17h00, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene 16 años a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 16 años  y le gusta la unidad del grupo y la seriedad de la fundación. Su sueño es seguir trabando y que su negocio crezca más.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of the Manabí province in Ecuador, which is well-known as the first Ecuadorian city situated in the coastal region. Here the members of the La California communal bank meet up every fortnight. Rosa lives here. She is 70 years old and is married and from this relationship she has 5 adult children who are independent. Her husband is retired and they live in their own house.

With the aim of earning something herself in order to be able to make progress, she makes a living selling all kinds of clothing. Her sales method is door-to-door and she also sells from home where she has a small shop. She works two days a week from 9am to 5pm. She sells to her customers on credit and collects the money every fortnight. She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise once a fortnight or once a month, depending on what she needs. She has been in this business for 16 years and it is going well for her.

She will use the loan to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing. She has been in the communal bank for 16 years and she likes the unity of the group and the trustworthiness of the institution. Her dream is to continue working and for her business to grow further.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz has successfully built her milk selling business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another cow to increase her sales and profits. She wishes to expand her business in the near future to provide a prosperous future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her sales and profits.

loans.name: Fernanda Natalia

texts.es:
Portoviejo es la capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador, conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana asentada en la región costanera, aquí se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo de Crédito La California.
En este lugar vive la señora Fernanda, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 1 hija de 6 años que estudia en la escuela. Su esposo trabaja para una compañía privada. Ella es ing. Civil y viven en casa propia.
Doña Fernanda con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos de Avon, Esika, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Además de ropa por catálogo y zapatos, trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, le encanta vender y esto lo viene realizando desde hace cinco años y le ha ido muy bien,  lo que más vende son los cosméticos y los perfumes. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas, pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 2 años  y le gusta la facilidad que le dan con el crédito para poder invertir. Su sueño es arreglar su casa y comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of the province of Manabí in Ecuador. It is known for being the first Ecuadorian city established on the waterfront region. Here is where the members of the loan group, La California, meet up every other week. It is also where Fernanda lives. She is 29 years old, married and has one 6 year old daughter who is in school. Her husband works for a private company. She is a civil engineer and they live in their own home. 

With the goal of having her own income, Fernanda works selling products from Avon, Esika, and Yanbal catalogs (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  For selling clothing and shoes from the catalog, she works every day mostly in the mornings because it is easier for her to make her rounds at these hours. Her sales form is door-to-door. She loves to sell and has been doing it for 5 years, and has done very well. She sells the most of cosmetics and perfume. 

She is going to use this loan to buy perfume, imitation jewelry, cosmetics, lotions, pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing. She has been in the loan group for 2 years and she likes the ease of the loan to be able to invest. Her dream is to fix up her house and buy a car.

loans.use: to buy perfume, imitation jewelry, cosmetics, lotions, pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Patricia Janeth

texts.es:
Portoviejo es la capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador, conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana asentada en la región costanera, aquí se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo de Crédito La California.
En este lugar vive la señora Patricia, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene  2  hijos, uno de 9  años que estudia en la  escuela y un bebé de 7 meses. Su esposo es taxista y también trabaja en un taller automotriz. Viven en casa de sus padres.
Doña Patricia es una muy  buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo  lo utilice en su trabajo, él tiene un taxi en el  cual realiza todos los días por las noches fletes dentro y fuera de la provincia y en las mañanas tiene un chofer contratado, el sale en las noches de 20h00 a 24h00 ya que él también trabaja en un taller automotriz durante el día.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar repuestos y llantas para darle mantenimiento al taxi. Lleva tres años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta ya que el grupo es unido. Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of the province of Manabí in Ecuador. It is known for being the first Ecuadorian city to be established on the waterfront region. Here is where the members of the loan group, La California, meet up every other week. It is also where Patricia lives. She is 31 years old, married and has 2 children, one 9 year old who goes to school and a 7 month old baby. Her husband is a taxi driver and also works in an auto shop. They live in her parent's house. 

Patricia is a very good wife who is carrying out the loan so her husband can use it in his work. He has a taxi that he uses for cargo every night in and outside of the province and in the mornings he has a hired driver. He works from 8 PM to 12 midnight and also works in an auto shop during the day. This loan will be used to buy spare parts and tires to do maintenance on his taxi. 

Patricia has been in the loan grow for 3 years and she likes that the group is unique. Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Basanti

texts.en:
Basanti is a 31-year-old married woman from the small village of Latapota in Falakata. She is a homemaker and is blessed with three children (a son and two daughters). She attended school until grade 1 and her husband studied until grade 8. One of her children reads in grade 1 and the other one is engaged in farming while her daughter is married.

Basanti's husband is a farmer by profession. He has been working on his own land for many years. He learned his profession from his parents. He mainly grows paddy along with other seasonal vegetables. Basanti looks after her household work and after that, she helps her husband in his agricultural activities. As a farmer, he has a great passion for his profession, as all day long, without regards for climatic hazards; he goes to look after his crops. The couple works tirelessly to provide financial sustenance to their family. They have achieved many good customers for their polite and simple behavior and supply of good quality crops at a cheaper rate. Like the other farmers, they also dream of extending and improving their production.

That is why Basanti is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for the purchase of good quality paddy seeds, compost and fertilizer. This loan will be a great help because it will allow her to be vigorous in maintaining good production for her family’s well-being.

She is very much thankful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Sukirani

texts.en:
Sukirani is a 44-year-old rural woman from the small village of Gokul Singhabati, Kandi in West Bengal. She is a mother of four children (two sons and two daughters). Her daughters are married. She is illiterate and can only sign her name.

Sukirani is engaged in a cottage cheese business with the help of her two sons. Her husband is associated with farming. Sukirani buys milk from different dairy farms and prepares cottage cheese and paneer in her home to sell in the markets as well as in the local sweetmeat shops.

Now Sukirani wants to expand her business. Thus, she needs milk abound. Due to a lack of adequate capital, Sukirani applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase milk in a bulk amount. She hopes this loan will give a boost to her business and improve her family’s financial status. She dreams of opening a sweetmeat shop in the market in the future.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for funding her.

loans.use: to purchase milk in a large quantity from the dairy farms for her cottage cheese business.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 39-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a distribution business and deals with candies, soap bubbles, and Nimko (snacks), etc. He has been purchasing these goods from wholesalers.

Now, due to household expenses, he does not have the money to buy the required goods and earn money. Therefore, Yasmeen requested a loan for her husband, so that he could buy the goods, establish his enterprise, and acquire some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. 

Yasmeen is very impressed with this support system and expresses her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She gives thanks to Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous goods, such as candies, soap bubbles, and Nimko (snacks), for her husband's distribution business.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Portoviejo es la capital de la provincia de Manabí en Ecuador, conocida por ser la primera ciudad ecuatoriana asentada en la región costanera, aquí se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del Grupo de Crédito La California.
En este lugar vive señor Alfonso, tiene 52 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual no tiene hijos. Su cónyuge es ama de casa. Viven en casa propia.
Don Alfonso es vendedor ambulante de lotería por más de 30 años, el recorre las calles de Portoviejo ofreciendo los billetes de lotería, pozo millonario, lotto, entre otros, sale hacer los recorridos desde la 9h00 hasta las 13h00 y le va muy bien ya que le gusta su trabajo.
