Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar billetes de lotería.  Lleva tres años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque son rápidos los créditos y bajo los intereses. Su sueño es mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of the province of Manabí in Ecuador. It is known for being the first Ecuadorian city to be established on the waterfront region. Here is where the members of the loan group, La California, meet up every other week. It is also where Alfonso lives. He is 52 years old and is in a relationship with no children. His partner is a housewife and they live in their own home. 

Alfonso has been selling lottery tickets on the street for more than 30 years. He roams the streets of Portoviejo offering tickets for lottery, millionaire pit, lotto and others. He goes out to do his rounds from 9 AM until 1 PM and is doing very well because he likes his job. This loan will be used to buy lottery tickets. He has been in the loan group for 3 years and he likes it because the loans are quick and the interest is low. His dream is to improve his house.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets.

loans.name: Dolores Del Rocio

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito La California. 
Aquí vive la señora Dolores, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada  y tiene dos hijos de 20 y 15 años que estudian  en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es taxista. 
Doña Dolores es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y así salir adelante, con sus ganancias colaborar con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene un comedor en su casa donde prepara deliciosos platos y comidas rápidas que son del agrado de sus clientes, trabaja  seis  días  a la semana, ella varia el menú para darles a sus clientes algo diferente todos los días, trabaja con la ayuda de su hermana a quien le paga por sus servicios, lleva más de 10 años con esta actividad la cual le ayuda a salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar productos para la preparación de los alimentos como arroz, carne y otros víveres. Lleva más de seis años en el Grupo De Crédito, le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son  tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The members of La California Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the Nueva California residential development in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds. It is also where Dolores lives. She is 45 years old, married, and has two children who are 20 and 15 and are in college and high school. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

Dolores is a woman who likes to work and get ahead. With her earnings she contributes to the household expenses. She has a diner in her house where she prepares delicious meals and fast foods that are liked by her customers. She works 6 days a week. She varies the menu to give her customers something different every day. She works with her sister's help, who she pays for her service. She has been doing this job for more than 10 years and it helps her to get ahead. 

This loan is to buy products to prepare the food such as rice, meat and other food supplies. She has been in the loan group for more than 6 years and she likes it for the help that the loans give her. Her dream is to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat and other food supplies.

loans.name: Shakuntala

texts.en:
Shakuntala is a 51-year-old humble and hardworking woman from Rudrabati village in Kandi, India. Her family is comprised of her husband and two children (a daughter and a son). Her daughter is married and her son works as a driver. She and her husband both are illiterate and can only sign their names.

Her husband is a farmer by profession. To support her husband financially, Shakuntala has been engaged in cattle breeding for the last 10 years. She started her business with the purchase of one cow. She supplies milk to her neighborhood and earns income for her family. Now this business is in demand in her local area and is a strong financial support for the family. As the prices of essential commodities are increasing by leaps and bounds, she has to work hard so that she can generate more income. She has decided to purchase one more cow to sell more milk, ghee and other dairy products.

For this reason, she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a dairy cow that will help her in terms of getting more milk and other dairy products for enhancing her business. She dreams of purchasing more cows in the future to expand her milk-selling business widely, which will help her to save more money for her old age.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Idalba Poderosa

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito La California. 
En este lugar vive la señora Idalba, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene una hija de 13 años la cual estudia en escuela. Su marido es comerciante. 
Doña Idalba es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y así lograr sus ingresos que le sirvan para sacar adelante su hogar, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende de todo, granos, legumbres, carne, queso, embutidos pescado,  helados, hasta cosas de bazar y papelería y ciertos remedios, trabaja todos los días. En su negocio sus clientes encuentran de todo, razón por lo cual la prefieren y sus ventas siempre son muy buenas, su  esposo y su hija le ayudan en el negocio cuando ellos pueden aunque es ella la que pasa más tiempo allí brindando la mejor atención a sus clientes. Lleva más de 17  años con su  negocio el cual le da lo necesario para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en surtir más su tienda y comprar más variedad de víveres. Lleva varios años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le ayudan mucho.  Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The members of La California Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the Nueva California residential development in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds. This is where Idalba lives. She is 52 years old, married and has a 13 year old daughter who is in school. Her husband is a trader. 

Idalba is a woman who likes to stand on her own and achieve her income which serves to support her home. She has a provisions store in her house. There she sells everything from grains, vegetables, meat, cheese, fish sausages, ice creams, to bazaar things and certain remedies. She works every day. In her business, her customers can find everything, which is why they prefer her and her sales are always very good. Her husband and daughter help her in the business when they can, although she spends the most time there giving her customers the best attention. She has been in the business for more than 17 years, and it gives her what she needs to get ahead. 

This loan will be used to supply her store and to buy a greater variety of provisions. She has been in the loan group for several years and she likes it because the loans always help her a lot. Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to buy provisions.

loans.name: Santu

texts.en:
Santu is a 46-year-old active woman from Kandi in the Murshidabad district of West Bengal. Her family comprises her husband and three children (two daughters and a son). Her daughters are married, and her son is engaged in masonry work after completing his secondary education.

Her husband is a cycle van puller; the cycle van is rented from a local owner. The main source of her family’s income depends on her husband, and he has been doing this work for twenty years. Her husband is providing transportation service in the nearest town in Kandi. He works for long hours a day and earns an average monthly income. With this income, Santu hardly manages her family’s expenses.

So, Santu needs to buy a new cycle van for her husband so that he can give transportation service to the local people, and Santu can save the rental cost of a cycle van. Cycle van is a type of transportation that carries people and goods from place to place in rural areas. Thus, Santu wants to avail herself of a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to buy a new cycle van for her husband. She hopes her husband now can earn the whole profit that he generates from the business by using his own cycle van.

She hopes her husband will earn more than before and her family economy will improve with this new planning. Her future plan is to buy another cycle van within the upcoming two years.

Santu is grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cycle van for her husband's transportation business.

loans.name: Juthika

texts.en:
Fifty-two-year-old Juthika is an enterprising woman and mother of four children (three sons and a daughter). Two of her sons are engaged in some small income-generating work, the younger son is a student of grade 7, and her daughter got married. Unfortunately, she lost her husband and lives with her children in a small village of Kandi.

Juthika runs a puffed rice business solely. Puffed rice is a type of puffed grain made from rice, commonly used in breakfast cereal or as snack food, and is served as a popular street food in India. It is usually made by heating rice kernels in a sand-filled oven. Puffed rice is very much popular in rural areas, and locally it is called “muri”.

Juthika makes puffed rice in her home and supplies it in her neighborhood. Sometimes, for additional income, she also sells fried nuts. Gradually her customers are increasing day by day. Now she wants to expand her business by serving more customers, which will also increase her income, but the problem is lack of adequate capital to invest in her business.

Thus, she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy good-quality rice in bulk at a wholesale rate. Now she hopes she can satisfy her customers’ demand by making more puffed rice. She expects a good profit from her business with the support of this financial help. In the future, she dreams to start a shop of puffed rice in her local area market.

Juthika is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: to buy good-quality rice and necessary ingredients for her puffed rice business.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Jayanti hails from a small village of Kandi. She is blessed with four children (a daughter and three sons). Her daughter got married, and all her sons are now students.

Jayanti’s husband is associated with the milk business. Jayanti makes herself busy in the business of cottage cheese. Cottage cheese is made from whole, part-skimmed, or skimmed pasteurized cows’ milk. It is locally known as “chhana” and makes a delicious light breakfast or lunch in rural areas.

Jayanti purchases cows’ milk and prepares cottage cheese at her home; then sells it to the local market. There is a huge demand for this product in her rural area. Now she wants to enhance her business, but the main challenge is her lack of capital. So, Jayanti seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy cows’ milk, salt, and other necessary ingredients on a large scale for more production.

She hopes she will earn more profit for her family’s well being. In the future, she dreams to open a sweetmeat shop in the local market.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase cows' milk and necessary ingredients for her cottage cheese business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 42-year-old lady. She is married and has two children. She sells cereals and has been in business for 12 years. She also does farming, and she sells the farm produce to her customers.

She will use the loan to buy more stock of maize, rice, beans, cowpeas, and green grams to sell. She hopes this will enable her to make more income to support her family.

She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children as well as increase her stock. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to grow her business, make more income, and be able to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize, rice, beans, cowpeas, and green grams to sell; she hopes this will enable her to make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Aparna

texts.en:
Aparna is 33 years old. She is married and a housewife. She studied up to grade 11. She is blessed with two children (one son and one daughter). One of them is studying in primary grade, and the other is below school-going age. They live in a remote region of Falakata in Alipurduar district in their own mud and straw-made house.

Aparna's husband Kartik is 33 years old and a farmer by profession. He mainly grows vegetables such as potatoes, gourds, ladies fingers (okra), beans, etc. He grows quality products, and the price of his produce is also cheap. So, the numbers of his customers are increasing gradually. Now he wants to cultivate eggplant on their farmland because it is in huge demand in their locality for its nutritional benefits.

Thus, Aparna is requesting a loan to buy eggplant seeds, pesticide, fertilizer, etc. to grow eggplant. They hope they will get a good harvest for sale, and with the profit they hope they can secure some for their future. Aparna’s great desire is to build a concrete house with the profit in the future.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase necessary farm inputs for eggplant cultivation.

loans.name: Yenni

texts.es:
Yenni es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, está estudiando para poder ser un buen contador y poder ayudar a las demás personas por medio de su carrera.
Ella es una persona que quiere salir adelante para poder ayudar a su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Yenni is from the city of Coronel Oviedo.  She is studying to be a good accountant and to be able to help others through her career.

She is a person who wants to get ahead in order to help her family.  She seeks this loan to be able to pay the fees associated with her program, in order to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, se desempeña como auxiliar administrativo de una empresa, para poder costear sus estudios universitarios, su anhelo es ser un profesional exitoso en su carrera de contador. 
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Augusto is from the city of Coronel Oviedo.  He works as an administrative assistant of a business in order to pay for his university studies.  His goal is to be a successful professional in his chosen career of accounting.
 
He seeks this loan to invest it in the payment of his university fees, so that he can continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es una joven estudiante, es de la ciudad de Santaní, está trabajando en una empresa de telefonía, es una persona  honesta y  responsable es muy dedicada al estudio.
Ella está estudiando para poder ser contadora, y por medio de sus estudios poder abrirse camino para poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Liz is a young student from the city of Santaní.  She works for a telephone company.  She is an honest, responsible person, and is very dedicated to her studies.

She is studying to become an accountant, and hopes through her studies to be able to pave the way to help others.  She seeks this loan to be able to pay her university fees, in order to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz es una joven estudiante, es de la ciudad de Santaní, es una persona trabajadora, honesta y  responsable es muy dedicada al estudio, desea sobresalir adelante profesionalmente a través de sus estudios en ciencias contables.
Ella está poniendo todo su esfuerzo para poder ser una buena contadora que ayude a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y continuar de esta manera sus estudios.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a young student from the city of Santaní.  She is hard working, honest and responsible.  She is very dedicated to her studies.  She hopes to excel professionally through her studies in accounting sciences.

She is working as hard as she can in order to be a good accountant who helps others.  She seeks this loan to be able to pay the fees associated with her degree, in order to continue her studies..

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Lucero

texts.es:
Lucero es una persona que se esfuerza por poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos y a las demás personas por medio de su profesión.
Está estudiando para ser psicóloga, por medio de sus conocimientos quiere hacerse conocida en el ámbito de la psicología.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo que le permitirá poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Lucero is a person who works hard to get ahead and to help her loved ones and others through her profession.

She is studying to be a psychologist.  She wants to be known for her knowledge in the field of psychology.  She seeks this loan to be able to pay the costs associated with her degree, which will allow her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy, aged 43, is married and supports a family of four children. He has been a farmer for the last 10 years and the business earns him KES 8,000 per month. 

Kennedy has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing his crops to get a better harvest for family use and to sell the surplus in the market. He plans to use the gained profit to repay his loan and the surplus to open a wholesale shop. Kennedy's hopes and dreams are to expand his agricultural sector and to live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers for top dressing his crops to get a better harvest for family use and to sell the surplus in the market.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Kwanza is a typical village in the Kitale area of Kenya where people suffer from poverty and lack of capital. Most people who live in this area are smallholder farmers. Stephen has been practicing farming on a small inherited piece of land for the past six years. He believes in the slogan "Unity is strength", which is why he decided to join Mutua Boda Boda self-help group. 

For the past three years, Stephen has been actively involved in mixed farming. He never got the chance to get a white collar job but this has not been a setback. He has been practicing crop farming, but he has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements such as fertilizers, seeds and tools. He is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements, such as high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that he will use to greatly improve his crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure him of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. Stephen is very visionary, and his goal for the season is to boost his crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth, 40 years old, is married and has one child. For the last 10 years, Ruth has operated a wedding decorating and printing business. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya and she will use it to buy a printing machine. Ruth will use the profits from the expanded business to educate her daughter. Her hope and dream for the future is to have a happy life.

loans.use: to buy a printing machine

loans.name: Narmina

texts.en:
Narmina, 56 years old, is married and the mother of 4 children. She is a refugee who lives with her parents in an IDP (internally displaced persons) settlement. Narmina is a dairy farmer, and a hardworking and successful person. She started keeping dairy cows 32 years ago, having started this business with a small amount of capital. Narmina grew up in her village and loves and is attached to this place and her family. She does this work with great love and passion. 

Narmina wants to buy a few more cows and improve both her business and family conditions. Like all people, she needs some funds and Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: to buy a few more cows and improve both her business and family conditions.

loans.name: Eva Group

texts.en:
Evangeline is the featured borrower of Eva group. She and the other group members came together to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon to get a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Evangeline is a widowed mother of three children who works hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved family and to improve their living conditions. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay her children's university tuition fees in the Philippines.
 
In the photo, Evangeline is the second lady on the left. The other groups members are:  Valencia (first on the right), Jaolaza (first on the left), and Jaileza (second on the right).

loans.use: to pay her children's university tuition fees in the Philippines

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura comenta que su meta de aquí a cuatro años es recibirse y ser independiente; poder ejercer su profesión de administradora de empresas y ayudar a sus padres y hermanos. 
También su meta es ascender en su trabajo y poder ir creciendo más con sus conocimientos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Laura states that her goal in the next four years is to graduate and be independent, to be able to pursue her profession of business administration, and to help her parents and siblings.  In addition, her goal is to advance in her work and to continue increasing her knowledge.  

She seeks this loan to be able to pay the fees associated with her degree, in order to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Moussa est celui  qui tient les cordes  moutons  et chèvres  dans sa main  sur la photo
Moussa est un malien, âgé de 56 ans  alphabétisé dans la  langue national  marié père de 8 enfants dont  4 enfants scolarisés. Son épouse fait du petit commerce elle achète des bis sape et tamarin pour faire le jus et la revendre dans le marché de sa localité. Moussa exerce l’élevage  des caprins et ovins, il prend l’argent de RMCR pour acheter moutons et chèvres.  IL s’approvisionne dans les marchés de sa localité  et revend  dans la foire de sa localité. Il a une expérience de plus 10 ans  d’activité. Dans sa vente il  gagne  15 000FCFA  comme bénéfice mensuel. Avec le profit, il pourra subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (couverture de soins de santé nourriture suffisante, habillement…). Il est souvent confronté à des  situations de maladie d’animaux et perte d’animaux  mais il se débrouille pour relever les défis.  Moussa   aime cette activité d’élevage  car il s’en sort bien avec  les prêts du RMCR et a pour ambition d’amélioré son activité et sa vie.
texts.en:
Moussa is the man holding the ropes for the sheep and goat in the photo.

Moussa is a fifty-six year-old Malian. He is literate in the national language, married, and a father of eight. Four of the children go to school. His wife is in retail: she buys bissap and tamarind, juices them, and sells the juice in her town.

Moussa raises goats and sheep, and is taking money from RMCR to buy animals. He purchases from local markets and resells at the local fair. He has over ten years of experience in the business. With his sales, he earns 15,000 XOF monthly.

With profits, he will be able to provide for his family (healthcare, sufficient food, clothing…) He often faces animal illnesses and loss, but he manages to deal with the challenges. Moussa likes raising animals because he does well with the RMCR loans. His ambition his to improve his business and his life.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats to retail.

loans.name: Marietia

texts.en: Marietia, 51 years old, is married and has 7 children. For the past 20 years, Marietia has had a farming business, growing beans and cow peas. This is her second loan with VisionFund and she intends to use it to buy a water pump and seeds. Marietia will use her profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hope and dream for the future is to be a successful businesswoman

loans.use: to buy a water pump and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy flour, caramel, eggs, shortening, sugar and other supplies.

loans.name: Las Campeonas Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama LAS CAMPEONAS, es un grupo conformado por 18 mujeres realmente campeonas que se esmeran día a día por salir adelante a través del trabajo digno y conjunto.
La Sra. Felicita es integrante de este comité, se la caracteriza por su laboriosidad, ella se dedica a las ventas, tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día. Ella se está esmerando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtirse con productos variados para la venta, como ser verduras, carne, frutas, y otros, de manera a poder seguir esforzándose por mejorar en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The committee is called "Champions." It is a group comprised of 18 women who really are champions, who strive every day to get ahead through dignified, communal work.

Felicita is a member of this committee, characterized by its hard work. She works in sales. She has a well-stocked counter where she works every day from very early in the morning. Being able to improve her living conditions as well as those of her loved ones makes her happy.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy a variety of products for sale, such as vegetables, meat, fruits and more, in order to be able to continue working to improve her business.

loans.use: buy vegetables, meat, fruits and other products.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Frente Group

texts.es:
El grupo MUJERES AL FRENTE está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres integrado por 17 mujeres todos ellas vecinas y amigas, cada una tiene un emprendimiento en el que invierten para poder ayudarse e ir creciendo poco a poco.
Una mujer de las integrantes que se destaca es la Sra. Laura, es una persona muy activa se dedica al comercio en su kiosco y venta de artesanía, su préstamo lo quiere utilizar para ir surtiendo su pequeño kiosco con bebidas, comestibles, golosinas y otros.
Ella se define como una mujer trabajadora, que pese a los problemas del día a día se esfuerza para poder cumplir con sus metas y anhelos.
texts.en:
The "MUJERES AL FRENTE" is in their second loan cycle with the Woman's Committee Program. It is made up of 17 women who are all neighbors and friends. Each one has an enterprise in which they invest to be able to help themselves and go on growing little by little.

One woman amongst the members that stands out is Laura. She is a very active person who works in a business, a kiosk and the sales of handicrafts. She wants to use her loan to stock her small kiosk with drinks, food, sweets and others.

She describes herself as a hard-working woman who in spite of her day to day problems makes the effort to be able to reach her goals and dreams.

loans.use: to buy drinks, food, sweets and others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy oil, flour, vegetables, fruits, and meat to stock her kiosk.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 55 years old. She is married, and they have five children.

She does farming and also has a motorcycle taxi business. She has been in business for 15 years.

This is her third loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs: fertilizer and seeds.

She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to boost her motorcycle taxi business.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to see her motorcycle business grow stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs: seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rouba

texts.en: Rouba is a 38-year-old Lebanese woman living with her husband and four children, two of whom still attend school. Rouba's husband is the main income earner and she is a housewife, taking care of her house and family. Rouba is in need of a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., to pay her child's university fees. In the future, she is planning to take out more loans to ensure a great educational path for him to be able to work at a proper company to gain good experience in the field.

loans.use: to pay her child's university fees

loans.name: Rim

texts.en: Rim is a 23 year old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child. Due to the bad financial conditions, she cooperates with her husband who represents the main income provider in the family in order to offer her family additional financial support. She opened a clothing shop in 2008, where she offers a great variety of clothes for women and kids at good prices. Currently, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a new collection of clothes so that she can improve her business and raise her income by a good percentage.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Müberra

texts.en:
Müberra is 27 years old and has one child.  She bakes cookies and cakes by taking orders for special occasions and earns her living.  With the help of the loan from Maya she bought cake templates and bulks of sugar dough and increased her profit.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Müberra Hanım 27 yaşında ve 1 çocuk annesi.  Müberra Hanım sipariş üzerine özel günlere şeker hamurlu kurabiye ve pasta yaparak geçimini sağlıyor.  Maya dan kullandığı kredi ile kurabiye kalıpları ve toptan şeker hamuru alarak kar oranını artırdı.

loans.use: to buy cake templates and bulks of sugar dough

loans.name: Gülşen

texts.en:
Gülşen is 45 years old, living alone with her child. She has been designing and producing jewelry for 5 years. First she had orders from stores, later she made sales to her neighbourhood. With the help of the loans from Maya she bought bulk materials for her jewels and beads. She increased the number of her potential customers. Gülşen is a very hard working woman and her aim is to open a shop of her own.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Gülşen hanım 45 yaşında tek başına çocuğunu büyütmeye çalışan bir anne. Gülşen Hanım 5 yıldır hem takı tasarımı yapıyor hem de bunları üretiyor. Önce mağazalardan aldığı siparişleri yapmış daha sonra çevresine de yapıp satmaya başlamış. Maya’dan aldığı krediler ile takı malzemesi ve boncuk aldı. Böylece müşteri potansiyelini artırdı. Çalışkan bir kişi olan Gülşen hanımın hedefi takı tasarım atölyesi açmak.

loans.use: to build a jewelry stand and buy materials.

loans.name: Kotognongontala N°2 Group

texts.fr: Karim est celui  qui tient les moutons dans sa main  sur la photo. Karim est un malien, âgé de 39 ans non scolarisé  marié père de 8 enfants  2 enfants scolarisé. Son épouse est ménagère.  Il exerce l’élevage  des ovins, il prend l’argent de RMCR  pour acheter moutons.  IL s’approvisionne dans les marchés de sa localité  et revend  dans la foire de sa localité. Il a une expérience de 13 ans  d’activité. Dans sa vente il  gagne  75 000 à 100 000 comme bénéfice dans le semestre. Avec le profit, il pourra subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (couverture de soins de santé nourriture suffisante, habillement…). Il est souvent confronté à des problèmes de perte d’animaux  mais il se débrouille pour relever les défis.  Karim  aime cette activité d’élevage  car il s’en sort bien avec  les prêts du RMCR et a pour ambition renouveler ses habitats.
texts.en:
Karim is the man holding the sheep in the photo.

Karim is a thirty-nine year-old Malian. He did not go to school. He has eight children; two of them go to school. His wife is a housewife.

Moussa raises sheep, and is taking money from RMCR to buy animals. He purchases from local markets and resells at the local fair. He has thirteen years of experience in the business. With his sales, he makes 75,000 to 100,000 in profit every six month.

With the profit, he will be able to provide for his family (healthcare, sufficient food, clothing…) He often faces the loss of animals, but he manages to deal with the challenges. Karim likes raising animals because he does well with the RMCR loans. His ambition is to renovate his housing.

loans.use: to buy sheep to resell.

loans.name: Ibtissam

texts.en: Ibtissam is a 22 year old married woman living with her husband and two children who are still attending school. She is a housewife and her husband is the main source of income for the family. He works in a local company in his town. Due to the hard financial situation, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay the last installment of her children’s school fees. Her purpose is to help them achieve high educational levels.

loans.use: to pay the last installment of her children’s school fees

loans.name: Ghaziyah

texts.en: Ghaziyah is a 43 year old Lebanese married woman living with her four children. Since 2011, in order to support her husband financially, she opened a call center in her town where she sells rechargeable mobiles and accessories. She is well-known in her region by her good reputation and good work. To better develop her work, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l. to increase her business merchandise. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and therefore to improve her income and percentage.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formó en la ciudad de Paraguarí, ellas son mujeres unidas que quieren crecer y mejorar con la ayuda mutua. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Zulma, quien en su última encuesta de eliminación de pobreza mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel 3. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace, pero que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que se ha ganado la vida de una manera digna para ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de carne, harina, pan, aceite y harina de maíz, con lo cual podrá seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, y continuar deleitando a sus clientes con las deliciosas comidas que hace. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the city of Paraguarí. They are a united group of women who want to grow and improve by helping each other. One of the members is. Zulma, who in the last Poverty Stoplight survey showed a poverty level of 3.

She works selling meals that she prepares herself. After making them she goes out and sells them itinerantly. She is a hard-working woman who makes a living in a dignified manner in order to help her loved ones.

She is requesting this loan to buy meat, flour, bread, oil and cornflour so she can continue with her work as she has been doing and continue to delight her clients with the delicious food she makes. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, flour, bread, oil and corn flour.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en: Rania is a 42-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children. Two years ago, and after being through difficult circumstances, she started to work at her house as a beautician. She is a skilled worker always pleasing her customers. And now, she states that she requires having more makeup tools and equipment which she will acquire via the loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. Rania is eager to receive those funds hoping that it will help her improve her business as well as her way of living.

loans.use: to buy more makeup tools and equipment.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 42 years old. She is married and has two children. She has been a farmer for the last 21 years and it has been a profitable business. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. She will use the anticipated profits from the business to educate her children. 

Her hope and dream for the future is to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Müzeyyen

texts.en:
Müzeyyen is 48 years old and a mother of two. She financially supports her husband by making various handicrafts and embroidery to edges of scarfs. She sells them to her neighbours. With the help of the loan from Maya she bought bulks of scarfs and threads.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Müzeyyen hanım 48 yaşında ve 2 çocuk annesi. Müzeyyen hanım çeşitli el işleri ve yazma oyaları yaparak evine ve eşine maddi olarak destek oluyor. Yaptığı ürünleri çevresine satıyor. Maya dan aldığı kredi ile yazma ve oya ipini toptan aldı.

loans.use: to buy scarfs and threads

loans.name: Ayşe

texts.en:
Ayşe is 50 years old and a mother of two. She has been working as a beauty specialst for 15 years. After her divorce, she opened a shop with the help of a small amount of capital from her parents. She makes her family's living by herself. With the help of her fouth loan from Maya, she bought materials for her shop. Her aim is to provide a good future for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Ayşe hanım 50 yaşında ve iki çocuk annesi.  Güzellik uzmanı olarak on beş yıldır çalışıyor.  Eşinden ayrıldıktan sonra ailesinden aldığı küçük bir sermaye ile dükkanı açıyor.  Çocuklarının ve kendinin geçimini sağlıyor.  Dördüncü kez kullandığı mikro kredi ile dükkanına malzeme aldı.  Çocuklarına güzel bir gelecek hazırlamak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products for her shop.

loans.name: Ikram

texts.en: Ikram is a 59-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children. She works as a tailor to provide support to her husband who is the main income source in the family. She has a good reputation in her town and she earns barely enough income. Today, she is eager to borrow a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to pay her child's educational fees. She intends to provide her with a good education and ensure her with a secure future.

loans.use: to pay her child's educational fees

loans.name: Jhilik

texts.en:
Jhilik is a 22-year-old married woman and the mother of a daughter. She is from the rural village Lahiripara in Kandi. Her daughter is too small to go to school. Jhilik has completed her secondary level education.

Jhilik's husband runs a hardware shop. His income is inconsistent. To help her family financially, Jhilik started a business selling clothing two years ago. She mainly sells saris ("a garment consisting of a length of cotton or silk elaborately draped around the body, traditionally worn by the women of India"). For additional income, she also sells blouses, petticoats, shirts, pants, cut pieces of salwar suits, and many other clothes according to customers' demand. Her main customers are her neighbors, friends and relatives. 

Jhilik is taking out a loan from Kiva's partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) to buy more varieties of saris and clothing from the wholesale market to increase her stock collection. Her goal is to fulfill the demand of her customers. She hopes she can give more financial support to her family with the profit generated from this business and a boost in her earnings. It will also enable Jhilik to enhance her business, and she wants to save money from her generated profit for her daughter’s education.

Jhilik is grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase wide varieties of clothing to expand her business.

loans.name: Dionasso Group

texts.fr: Sur la photo, Maïmouna est la femme qui tient la Chèvre. Elle a 42 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants qui sont âgés de 02 à 25 ans, parmi eux il y a 4 écoliers. Elle fait l’élevage ovin, son mari aussi fait l’élevage (bovin). Maïmouna fait recourt au prêt de l’IMF pour acheter plus de moutons et chèvre pour son élevage enfin de gagner beaucoup de bénéfices. Elle exerce ce travail depuis 13 ans. Maïmouna est analphabète, c’est pour cela elle se soucit de la  scolarisation de ses enfants. Le prêt lui aide à subvenir à ses charges familiales ainsi que les frais de scolarité de ses enfants  grâce aux bénéfices générés. Ces achats et vente s’effectuent au marché de Kimparana ainsi que dans sa localité en espèce. Elle réalise un bénéfice mensuel de 12 500 CFA après ses dépenses. Les obstacles auxquels se heurte Maïmouna est que souvent l’aliment bétail devient un peu chère au marché et souvent leurs décès.
texts.en:
Maïmouna is the woman holding the goat in the photo. She is forty-two year-old, married, and a mother of six. Her children range in age from two to twenty-five; four of them go to school. She raises sheep and her husband farms cattle.

Maïmouna is turning to RMCR to buy more sheep and goat for her business, so she can earn a lot more. She has been in this business for thirteen years.

Maïmouna is illiterate, which is why she cares about sending her children to school. Thanks to the profits it make possible, the loan helps her to pay for the family’s expenses and the cost of her children’s education. Her purchases and sales take place at the market in Kimparana as well as in her town, in cash. She makes a monthly profit of 12,500 XOF after expenses.

The challenges Maïmouna has to face are that cattle feed can become a bit expensive at the market, and that the animals sometimes die.

loans.use: to buy animals for resale.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is 38 years old. He is married and they have 4 children. He operates a motorcycle taxi business and has been in the business for 13 years. 

He will be using the loan to buy spare parts to repair and service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers. 

He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and expand his business. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business,make more income and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for repair and maintenance of his motorcycle and serve more customers and hopes this will enable him to generate more income.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 63 years old. She is a widow and has ten children. She has been a farmer for the last ten years and the business is profitable. 

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use the loan to buy fertilizer and a water pump. She will use the anticipated profits from the business to buy a water tank. 

Her hope and dream for the future is to have a successful business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a water pump

loans.name: Joseah

texts.en:
Joseah is 41 years old. He is married with four children. He has had a motorcycle business for four years.

He will be using the loan to purchase a motorcycle and hopes this will help him improve the standard of living and educate his children. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful life and a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to help him improve the standard of living and educate his children.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 56 years old. He is a widower and has six children.

He does farming and has been in business for 30 years.

This is his second loan with VisionFund and he will use it to buy a water pump, seeds and fertilizer.

He will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for his grandchildren.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and a water pump.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 63 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Adelaida has a business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Adelaida requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Adelaida has been in this business for six years. Adelaida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Aysun

texts.en:
Aysun is 35 years old and has one child. She is working as a beauty specialist and sells beauty products by network system. She has been in the business for eleven years. She gained a good amount of money from the products she sold. With the help of her fourth loan from Maya she bought bulks of beauty products. She aims to prepare a good future for her child.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Aysun hanım 35 yaşında evli bir çocuk annesi. Güzellik uzmanı olarak çalışmakta ve network sistemiyle güzellik ürünleri satıyor. On bir yıldır çalışma hayatı var. Sattığı ürünlerden güzel ek gelir sağlamış. Dördüncü kredisinde network ürünleri aldı. Çocuğuna iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak istiyor

loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Meliha

texts.en:
Meliha is 65 years old, married and a mother of three. Meliha cooked delicious food and got requests from her neighbours. So she started cooking especially for working women. With the help of the loan from Maya, she bought flour, butter, oil, rice and meat in bulk.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Meliha 65 yaşında evli ve üç çocuk annesi. Meliha Hanımın güzel yemek yapması üzerine çevresinden bu konuda talepler gelmeye başlamış ve Meliha Hanım özellikle çalışan kadınlara ev yemekleri yapmaya başlamış. Maya dan aldığı kredi ile un, yağ, pirinç ve kıyma aldı.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, oil, rice and meat

loans.name: Mbogoini Women Group

texts.en:
The member raising her hand in the photo is Cathrine, 35 years of age, married and mother of two children. She is a member of Mbogoini women group that joined Hand in Hand eastern Africa (HiH EA) in year 2013 where she has been trained on enterprise development and record keeping.

Cathrine does mixed farming of maize, beans, bananas, goat keeping and also dairy farming. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farming enterprise. This will improve her farm produce and therefore enhance her ability to pay school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy ferlitizer and pesticides to boost her farm and be able to pay school fees

loans.name: Ngiini Grace S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Juliana, 41 years old, married and a mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2014 to benefit from training especially enterprise development and financial management.

She practices mixed farming. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy certified vegetables seeds and pesticides for her vegetable farming. This will increase production hence more income to buy food, clothes and pay for quality healthcare services for her family.

Juliana is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy certified vegetables seeds and pesticides to boost vegetables production for more income to buy food, clothes and pay for quality healthcare services for her family.

loans.name: Pagbneecre Group

texts.fr: Marie est âgée de 56 ans, veuve. Vendeuse de pagnes depuis 10 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c’est son expérience dans l’activité, son accueil, le respect des clients et la bonne écoute de ses clients. Elle veut le prêt pour s’acheter 35 000 de chaussures,  pour acheter 100 000  d’ensemble  d’habits, pour acheter 75 000 de pagnes et pour acheter 40 000 des quotas.L’utilité du prêt c’est d’approvisionner sa boutique afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 11 fois et à rembourser à ACFIME aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Marie is a fifty-six years old widow. She has sold “pagnes,” the local dress, for ten years. Her business does well thanks to her experience, her welcoming respect for her clients, and her being a good listener for them.

She wants a loan to purchase 35,000 XOF worth of shoes, 100,000 XOF in assorted clothes, 75,000 XOF in “pagnes,” and 40,000 for quotas. The loan is useful to procure supplies for her store and satisfy her clientele.

She has already been granted eleven loans, and has paid them back punctually to ACFIME.

loans.use: to buy 45,000-XOF worth of shoes, and 105,000 XOF in local dresses.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 56 years old. She is married and they have three children.

She grows cow peas and beans and has been in business for 10 years.

This is her second loan with VisionFund and she intends to use it to buy fertilizer and seeds.

She will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to grow her business to make her be successful in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Bidii Muvakani Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Elizabeth, 31 years old and single. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from training especially enterprise development and financial management.

Elizabeth does tailoring. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy a second hand sewing machine for decorating seat covers and tablecloths. She believes this will enable her increase income to enable her pay for her mothers medical bills and also school fees for her younger brother.

She is grateful to Kiva and the lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy a second hand sewing machine for sewing decorations, hence increase income to pay for her mothers medical bills and school fees for her younger brother.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is forty three years old, married and blessed with six children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the training especially enterprise development. 

He operates a scrap metal business.  He is borrowing Kiva loan to buy more scrap metals hence add stock for increased income. This will enable him pay school fees for his children at ease.

Joseph is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more scrap metals for resale and earn more income to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is fifty five years old and married with six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) to benefit from training especially enterprise development and financial management. 

She practices mixed farming and mostly farming maize and beans. She is borrowing Kiva loan to purchase farm irrigation equipment and storage sacks. She hopes this will enable her boost  farming production for increased  income to provide modern housing and quality health care for her disabled child. 

Margaret is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm irrigation equipment and storage sacks to boost farming production for more income to provide modern housing and better healthcare to her disabled child.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy biscuits, bread, chips, candies, canned goods, coffee, sugar, powdered milk, powdered juice, toiletries, laundry soap, noodles, and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply for more income gain

loans.name: Magsolita

texts.en:
Magsolita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Magsolita is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Magsolita has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Magsolita requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Magsolita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Magsolita would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is a hard working married lady aged 32 charged with the responsibility of taking care of 3 children of ages ranging from 1 to 14 years. She owns a beauty saloon mainly plating lady’s hair, selling lotions among other items. She has hopes of growing and expanding her business as well as educating her children. 

She will use the loan facility to complete her beauty salon..

loans.use: to complete her beauty salon.

loans.name: Tumaini Keriko Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Salome, a member of Tumaini Keriko Women group. She is a widow, 67 years old and blessed with one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014. From there, she has been able to gain experience and acquire skills on Enterprise Development and Financial Management, which has further helped her operate her business.

Salome’s economic activity is maize and beans farming. She is therefore borrowing a loan to buy top dressing fertilizer. This will enable her to get high yields, which will lead to more income in her business. She will be in a position to meet the basic needs such as food, clothing and a modern shelter.

She is grateful for Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer that will boost her farming and thus her income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, beams and stones to continue building his home

loans.name: Mary Ann Janit

texts.en:
Mary Ann Janit thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail financial assistance for her chosen business. She has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. 

She has taken several loans and all were paid back in a timely manner. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Analyn wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina has mastered her-hog raising business in Tudela. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when her husband died. His death crippled their family because she didn't how to address the family's needs.

Without enough capital for her business, she joined PMPC. She was truly grateful to access credit to fully support her business. Just as she takes care of her hog-raising business, she takes her membership with PMPC very seriously. She wants to remain in good standing with PMPC so that she can always seek financing.

Now she is seeking a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP, which will help her build a concrete pig pen to improve sanitation and the environment.

loans.use: to improve her business by building a concrete pig pen

loans.name: Matha

texts.en:
Matha is 46 years old and a mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2015 to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development.

Matha practices dairy farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy dairy meal and hence increase milk production to be able to pay school fees and provide better food to her family.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy dairy meal and hence increase milk production to be able to pay school fees and provide better food to her family.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 43-year-old married woman with three children. One of her children is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. She explains that she has been in this business for five years.

Rosalina requested a loan in the amount of 28,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell. In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Letecia works hard to support her family.

To earn a living, she has a fishing business in the Philippines. She explains that she also earns additional income through transportation-related activities.

Letecia is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 19,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business. Notably, Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through 13 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a farmer from a rural home in South Rift, Kenya. He makes a living by raising cattle and selling milk and meat. He has been livestock farming for years and is still committed to the growth of his farm.

Robert is seeking a loan to buy a cow. He plans to spend a small portion of the loan proceeds to purchase insurance on the cow as a risk-mitigating measure to protect his family from slipping further into debt or poverty in the event the cow dies. The impact this loan will have on Robert and his family includes financial inclusion, business growth, capital accumulation, an increased income. His ultimate goal is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and cow insurance

loans.name: Cristiano

texts.pt:
Senhor Cristiano tem 28 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 estudam frequentando o ensino primário, é serralheiro, vive em casa própria com a sua família.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de cimento, areia, varões, para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa visto que vive na mesma mas ainda não está concluída.
No futuro pretende terminar a construção da sua casa e iniciar um negocio de modo a incrementar a renda familiar visto que o salário não é suficiente para suportar as despesas.
Liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora é o seu maior desafio de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos
texts.en:
Cristiano is 28 years old and lives with his wife. He is the father of three children, two of whom go to primary school. He works as a blacksmith and lives in his own home with his family. 

This loan will be used to buy cement, sand and rods to continue building the home where he lives, even though it is still unfinished. 

In the future Cristiano would like to finish building his house and start a business so he can increase his family's income since his salary is not enough to cover the bills. His main challenge is to  pay off his loan without falling behind with the repayments to ensure he receives loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and rods to continue building his home

loans.name: Philister

texts.en:
Philister is a 53-year-old farmer. She has a mixed-farm in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, where she lives with her family.

On the farm, she grows various crops and keeps dairy cattle and poultry. For the last six years, she has made money selling her farm's produce and engaging in other side businesses. She feels passionate about farming. However, her business is facing challenges, such as high costs of farming inputs and occasional droughts.

Philister is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. In Philister's view, the upside of focusing more on her poultry business is that it is barely affected by the major challenges she faces (i.e., high costs of farm inputs and drought conditions). For instance, poultry feed is readily available, and the birds lay eggs regardless of the season of the year.

She believes that this loan will enable her to provide a certain and steady stream of income all year round. The money Philister expects to make from this expansion will be used to cover her family's expenses, such as food and school fees. She wants her family to enjoy a balanced diet to grow strong and healthy so that they can be more productive towards generating income for the family.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing poultry

loans.name: Adelia

texts.pt:
Senhora Adélia tem 39 anos de idade, solteira, mãe de 1 uma filha frequentando o ensino primário, é negociante e vive em casa própria.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de refrescos, frangos, açúcar, cerveja, amendoim, para revender na sua mercearia.
No futuro pretende ampliar o seu negócio, construir aviários para iniciar a criação de frangos de modo a incrementar a renda familiar.
O seu maior desafio e de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em atraso de reembolsos de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos.
texts.en:
Adélia is 39 years old, single and the mother of one daughter who goes to primary school. She is a businesswoman and lives in her own home. 

This loan will be used to buy soft drink, chicken, sugar, beer and peanuts to resell in her grocery store. In the future Adélia would like to expand her grocery store and build a chicken coop so she can start raising chickens and increase her family's income. 

Adélia's main challenge is to pay off her loan without falling behind with the repayments to ensure she will receive loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drink, chicken, sugar, beer and peanuts to resell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Ananias

texts.pt: O Senhor Ananias é solteiro, vive com a mãe, irmã e a sobrinha. É polícia, com o presente empréstimo pretende regularizar um espaço na zona de Marracuene para no futuro começar a reunir material para erguer sua habitação. Tem sonho de ser um empreendedor. Tem como maior desafio terminar o nível superior e possuir habitação propria.
texts.en:
Ananias is single and lives with his mother, sister and niece. He is a policeman. 

With this loan Ananias would like to pay for the title to a plot of land in Marracuene so that in the future he can get together the materials to build a home there. His dream is to be an entrepreneur and his main challenge is to finish high school and own his own home.

loans.use: to pay for the title to a plot of land

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Rory es grupo de señoras Indígenas se encuentra en el primer ciclo, con 19 integrantes, estas mujeres son muy guapas, casi todas se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales. 
La Sra. Estela, presidenta de este grupo, cuenta con una pequeña despensa donde ofrece todo lo necesario para el hogar  y de ahí se surten a todas las personas de su barrio. Este es un grupo digno de admirar, trabajan con esmero y responsabilidad. 
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para surtir su despensa, como ser verduras, carne, bebidas, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Kuña Rory is a group of 19 indigenous women that are in their first loan cycle.  These women are very nice, and almost all make a living in agriculture and animal breeding.  This is a group worth admiring; they work with care and responsibility.

Estela, president of this group, has a small grocery store where she offers everything you need for the home and from which everyone in her neighborhood is supplied.  

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of supplies to restock her store, such as vegetables, meat, drinks, baked goods, and more.  In this way she will be able to continue with her work as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, drinks, baked goods and more.

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de artesanía y a la elaboración de trabajos hechos en arcilla como vasijas y plato entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia es una persona responsable, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arcilla entre otros.
texts.en:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de artesanía y a la elaboración de trabajos hechos en arcilla como vasijas y plato entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia es una persona responsable, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arcilla entre otros.
This member is a part of the community bank “INTI QUILLA.” This bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and the department of Cusco. She continues to be involved in buying and selling crafts and creating works made of clay like vases and plates for her clients. This member is grateful for the offered loan and promises to comply with the terms of repayment of the loan. The member is requesting the loan to purchase clay among 
other items.

loans.use: To purchse cay among other items.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
La socia Violeta sigue con su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo a sus clientes que más le solicitan son como amistades y familiares, la socia es una persona responsable, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como chompas, casacas entre otros.
texts.en: Violeta is still working in her clothes selling business. Violeta is really grateful for the loan that has been given to her and she makes herself responsible to pay for her installments on time. She continue selling to her clients such as friends and family. She is a responsible person, and it is this way that she gets ahead to help her family. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such s sweaters, jackets and other items.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as sweaters, jackets and other items.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: La señora María vive en el departamento de Cochabamba de la provincia carrasco tiene hijos. La señora Maria es de la provincia chapare, uno de los lugares  pobres de Bolivia se trasladaron de su comunidad de Capinota como la mayoría de las personas buscando mayor oportunidad de vida junto con sus hijos, en su comunidad la producción bajo debido a los cambios climatológicos, difícil de controlar, cada vez la producción escaseo, por lo que decidió migrar al trópico,  al terreno en la que hoy en día trabaja en el sector pecuaria y agrícola y se dedica a la crianza de ganado, producción de cítrico y venta de leche, de donde tiene en producción dos hectárea de cítrico 2600 centenas,  lo que comercializa a los intermediarios que le vienen a comprar al lugar de su sindicato el préstamo que está solicitando es para mantenimiento de potrero y cítrico lo que obtendrá mejoras su potrero de ganado vacuno y mejorara su cosecha de producción de cítrico.
texts.en:
María lives in the department of Cochabamba in the Carrasco province. She has children. María is from the Chapare province, one of the poor areas of Bolivia, and she moved from her community in Capinota like many people who were looking for better life opportunities together with her children. In her community, there is low production due to climate changes, which is difficult to control. Every time the production is more scarce, and for this reason she decided to migrate to the tropical region, to a location where today she works in the livestock and agriculture sector. 

She makes a living raising livestock, producing citrus, and selling milk. She has two hectares of citrus, which she sells to intermediaries who come to buy at the trade union.

The loan she is requesting is to maintain her paddock and citrus trees, which will improve her paddock of cattle and improve her citrus harvest.

loans.use: to maintain her paddock and citrus to stock her business and generate a better income for her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve the purchase and production of potatoes and to expand herbusiness and improve her household income.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana, who is 54 years old and married, is from the village of Tandzia. She has a son and daughter. Nana is involved in an agribusiness. In particular, she cultivates a plot of land, where potatoes are harvested and Nana sells them at the local market. All family members work as waiters at the local restaurant and get a fixed salary. Nana has a great desire to expand her private business and start dairy farming. She received credit in the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo - the Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. Nana will use the requested amount for purchasing cattle and start milking it. She will produce dairy products for local selling and for family use also.

Nana is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to assure her children a good lifestyle. This credit will be a great support for the family. Nana is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to generate additional income.

loans.use: To purchase a cattle and start dairy farming

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.ru: Этого молодого человека на фотографии зовут Наимчон. Ему 28 лет. У Наимчона ответственная работа. Его работа заключается в том, чтобы вырастить фрукты и овощи и после закрывать их на консервы и продать народу. Всем процессом он занимается сам. Наимчон планирует расширить деятельность и посадить новые виды сельскохозяйственных культур. Для этой операции ему необходимо купить минеральные удобрения и семена. Поддержите Наимчона.
texts.en:
This young man is Naimjon. He is 28 years old. Naimjon has an important job. His job is to grow fruits and vegetables, and later conserve them in cans and sell them. He does everything independently. 

Naimjon plans to expand his business and grow new types of crops. He must buy mineral fertilisers and seeds for this work. Please support Naimjon!

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilisers and seeds.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 44 years old, married and has two children. For the past five years she has run a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income selling Avon products.

Melanie has borrowed and successfully repaid nine previous loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for a 19,000 PHP loan to buy more groceries to stock her shop. She’s always working hard to develop her store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock her shop.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El socio Antonio  pertenece al banco comunal TODOS UNIDOS, él socio sigue dedicándose a su negocio de venta de repuestos de automóviles, el socio se siente agradecido con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a  su familia.
El socio solicita le crédito para parabrisas, faros  entre otros.
texts.en:
Antonio belongs to the communal bank "Todos Unidos" (Everyone United). He continues working in his business of selling spare parts for automobiles. He is grateful for the loan, and he promises to make the payments on his account. He is a responsible and persevering person, since this is the way he is raising his family.

He is applying for the loan [to purchase] windshields and headlights, among other items.

loans.use: to buy windshields and headlights, among other items.

loans.name: Elisio

texts.pt: O Senhor Elisio é solteiro, vive com a mãe, três filhos e duas sobrinhas. É docente, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprer material de contrução, cimento, ferros, pedra. Tem sonho de ter um estabelecimento comercial e aquisição de uma viatura para o uso particular e continuar com os estudos. Tem como maior desafio formar-se em matérias de crédito e formar os seus filhos.
texts.en:
Elisio is single and lives with his mother, thee children and two nieces. He is a teacher.

This loan will be used to buy building materials such as cement, iron and stones. Elisio's dream is to have a store and buy a vehicle that he can use privately and continue with his studies. His main challenge is to educate himself through his loans and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron and stones

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La socia Rosa Elena pertenece al banco comunal TODOS UNIDOS, la socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de venta de auto partes de automóviles, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra parabrisas.
texts.en:
Rosa Elena belongs to the communal bank "Todos Unidos" (Everyone United). She continues working in her business of selling auto parts. She has had her business for some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it each day. She continues selling her merchandise to the customers who come to her, since this is the way she is raising her family.

She feels grateful for the loan granted and promises to make the established payments.

She is applying for the loan in order to buy windshields.

loans.use: to buy windshields

loans.name: Esenbek

texts.ru: Эсенбек, 59 лет, женат, отец 3 детей. У него высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве есть 5 коров, 25 овец, лошадь. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 18,000 сом (KGS). Эсенбек решил обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Эсенбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и планирует накопить на ремонт сарая.
texts.en:
Esenbek is 59 years old, married, and has three children. He has higher education, and works in animal husbandry as the main source of his family's income. There are five cows, 25 sheep, and a horse on his farm. The monthly profit is about 18,000 som (KGS). 

Esenbek decided to apply to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy some heifers in order to increase his livestock headcount. Esenbek plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further development of his business, and intends to save to renovate his barn.

loans.use: to buy some heifers in order to increase his herd.

loans.name: Zebuniso

texts.ru: Эту доброжелательную и весёлую девушку зовут Зебунисо. Она родилась и выросла в городе  Курган-Тюбе. Она любимая жена и заботливая мать одного ребёнка. Зебунисо с мужем занимаются растениеводством. Таким образом, они зарабатывают на жизнь и воспитывают своего ребенка. Зебунисо любит свое дело и довольна тем, что имеет собственный доход, несмотря на то, что у нее нет высшего образования, она добилась многого самостоятельно. Сейчас она готовит почву для посадки нового урожая и по этой причине обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения и семена различных овощей. Зебунисо очень ждет поддержку с вашей стороны!
texts.en:
This friendly and cheerful young lady is Zebuniso. She was born and rised in Qurgan-Tube city. She is a beloved wife and caring mother of one child. Zebuniso grows crops with her husband. They earn their living and bring up their child in this way. 

Zebuniso loves her work and is satisfied that she has her own income. Even though she does not have higher education, she has achieved a lot on her own. 

Now she is preparing soil for growing new crops, and for this reason she has applied for a loan, in order to buy mineral fertilisers and seeds for different vegetables. Zebuniso is eagerly waiting for your support!

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es:
La socia Lizbeth pertenece al banco comunal “Todos Unidos”, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio  de venta de auto partes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra faros entre otros.
texts.en:
Lizbeth belongs to the communal bank "Todos Unidos" (Everyone United). She continues working in the business of selling auto parts. She has had this business for some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it each day. She continues selling her merchandise to her customers who seek her, since in this way she is raising her family.

She feels grateful for the loan granted and promises to make her established payments.

She is applying for the loan to purchase headlights, among other items.

loans.use: to buy headlights, among other items.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Benedicta is 62 years old and married and she lives at Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She earns a living from taking in and raising pigs from her neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in profit upon their sale, which is divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending in their agreement. With a desire to earn more, Benedicta decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through Paglaum PC, she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now she requests a loan of 14,900 PHP to buy additional feed. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income from her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig pen to keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
