Aurora is a 56-year-old married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Aurora has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Aurora has been in this business for four years. In the future, Aurora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rahmonali

texts.ru: Этого миролюбивого человека зовут Рахмонали. Он живет со своей семьей в городе Курган-Тюбе. Рахмонали больше половины своей жизни, а точнее уже  40 лет занимается растениеводством. Он любит свое дело, потому что оно приносит ему хорошую прибыль. Рахмонали в его городе знают как лучшего растениевода. Люди приходят к нему посоветоваться, и хотят узнать, как он каждый год получает такой богатый урожай. В нынешнем году Рахмонали также посадил урожай, однако ему  не хватило средств на покупку минеральных удобрений. Он просит кредит и очень надеется, что и в этом году он получит хороший урожай, как и в прежние года.
texts.en:
This peaceful man is Rahmonali. He lives with his family in Qurgan-Tube city. Rahmonali has grown crops for forty years - more than half his life. He loves his work, because it brings him a good profit. Rahmonali is known as the best plant breeder in his city. People come to him for advice, and want to know how he receives such a rich harvest every year. 

This year, Rahmonali also planted crops, however he did not have enough funds to buy mineral fertilisers. He is applying for a loan and greatly hopes that this year he will receive a good harvest as usual.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.ru: Ее зовут Ражабгул. Ей 48 лет. Она отзывчивая женщина с чистой душой. Ражабгул всегда придет на помощь и поддержит. В этот раз ей самой нужна помощь. Ражабгул занимается продажей лука около 8 лет. Она хочет расширить деятельность. Сейчас люди начинают запасаться луком на осень и зиму. Сейчас ее товар пойдет очень хорошо. Она решила приобрести большое количество лука. Для этой операции она просит вас поддержать ее.
texts.en:
This is Rajabgul. She is 48 years old. She is a kindhearted woman with a pure soul. Rajabgul is always ready to help and provide support. Now, she herself needs help. 

Rajabgul has sold onions for about eight years. She wants to expand her business. Now people are starting to stock up on onions for spring and winter. Her sales are going very well now. She decided to obtain more onions. She appeals to you to support her with this job.

loans.use: to buy oniona and expand her business.

loans.name: Rene Wildon

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal TODOS UNIDOS, él socio continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de auto partes y adornos de autos, el socio se siente agradecido con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a  su familia.
El socio solicita le crédito para parabrisas, faros  entre otros.
texts.en:
Rene belongs to the communal bank "Todos Unidos".  He continues to make a living at his business selling auto parts and car ornaments.  He feels grateful for the loan and commits to making his installment payments.  He is a responsible and diligent person.  In this way, he is able to provide for his family.

Rene is requesting a loan for windshields and headlights, among other things.

loans.use: to buy windshields and headlights among other things.

loans.name: Micaela Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MICAELA BASTIDAS,el banco pertenece al distrito de Cusco,provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Micaela alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de lenceria, ropa de baño,medias,fajas entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con el plazo establecido de sus cuotas, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cuenta con un local por el centro de la ciudad , siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de medias, ropa interior entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Micaela Bastidas." The bank belongs to the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.

Member Micaela divides her time between her daily chores and her business of selling lingerie, swimming suits, stockings, and girdles, among other items. She feels grateful for the loan granted and promises to make her payments on the established schedule. She has been in this business for years, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it each day. She has a shop in the center of the city, and it is in this way that she is raising her family.

She is applying for the loan for the purchase of stockings and underwear, among other items.

loans.use: to buy stockings and underwear, among other items.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of six children, Enriqueta works hard to support her family. She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.

Enriqueta is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell for her fish-vending business.

Enriqueta has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 51 years old and married, with one child who is in school.

Juvy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Juvy has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Juvy aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nancy Carolina

texts.es:
Nancy, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, pero por falta de oportunidades laborales se ha dedicado a la agricultura y a la ganadería, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres; está acompañada y tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad.

Nancy, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura durante la mañana junto a su esposo, en una parcela que alquila y en el transcurso de la tarde, se dedican a ordeñar una vaca que poseen y utilizan la leche para el consumo familiar.

Nancy, necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca, que le ayudará a obtener más leche e iniciar con la producción de lácteos para vender.

Nancy, con los ingresos de las actividades que realiza, desea comprar más ganado y un terreno donde poder tenerlos.
texts.en:
Nancy is 25 years old and studied until high school. Because of the lack of work opportunities she has been working in agriculture and raising cattle. She learned this trade from her parents. She is in a relationship and she has a two-year-old son. 

Nancy, along with her husband, works in agriculture in the mornings on a plot that they rent and in the evenings they work milking a cow they own and use the milk for family consumption. 

Nancy needs a loan to buy a cow which will allow her to obtain more milk and start making dairy products to sell. With the income from the work that she does, Nancy wants to buy more cattle and land where she can keep them.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Vaelyn

texts.en:
Vaelyn is 36 years old and married with three children. She lives in a rural near Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She makes and sells ice block (Ice cake) and lemon drink in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year.

Vaelyn requested a loan to buy a cooler, a sealer machine and a deep freezer to assist her in running her business. She plan to use her profit to improve her business as well as cover her family's daily expenses.

She became an SPBD member in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, a sealer machine and a deep freezer for her food-and-drink business.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: La señora Nora es una persona mayor de edad, vive con su pareja en calidad de concubinos en el área rural en una casita rustica de adobe,  cuenta con servicios básicos pero con algunas restricciones.  Alcanzo a estudiar hasta el nivel primario, la actividad principal a la que se dedican es la agricultura, con la siembra, cosecha y venta de sus productos, de ahí generan sus mayores ingresos económicos para sustentar a familia y brindarles una mejor cálida de vida. Los productos que siembran y comercializan son: papa en mayor cantidad, cebada, trigo y quinua, además de otros en pequeñas cantidades. La señora Nora se ve en la necesidad de  solicitar un préstamo el cual le sirva para la compra de abono orgánico, de esta manera continuar con su actividad agrícola para obtener ingresos y  mejorando su calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Nora is an older person. She lives with her free union partner in a rustic house of adobe in a rural area. The house has basic services but with some restrictions. She was able to go to school through the primary level. The principal activity in which they work is agriculture. From the planting, harvesting, and sale of their products, they generate their greatest economic income to support their family and offer them a better quality of life. The products that they plant and sell are potatoes, in large quantities, barley, wheat, and quinoa, in addition to others in small quantities.

Señora Nora sees the need to apply for a loan that will serve for the purchase of organic compost. In this way she can continue with her agricultural business in order to obtain income and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy organic compost to improve her production and sales in order to obtain better income and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio is 46 years old and married. He has three children to support. For many long years, earning money in rice production has really sustained their living conditions.

Dionesio aims to increase his income because of the increasing price of rice nowadays. He decided to take a loan to purchase fertilizer for his farm so that he can produce a good quality of rice and can deliver more sacks of rice in the market to generate more income.

Dionesio’s plan for the future is to save money from his business income and to have as many crops as possible for his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags, blankets and a bain-marie

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle has been a business banker for several years, and she loves helping small businesses realize success. Last year, Michelle’s mother was diagnosed with cancer. Luckily, she is now in remission. However, the experience of having to deal with rigid corporate policies dictating how and when she could take care of her mother really pushed her to go out on her own. Working for herself has always been a goal, and this year she completed the necessary education and certifications to start her own bookkeeping business. To Michelle, it is fascinating how many different ways there are to make a living, and it’s a rewarding experience to be able to help other small businesses manage their books. 

With this Kiva loan, Michelle will be able to have a website built and optimized. Having a web presence will allow her to market her new company to a sector of business she might not otherwise be able to reach. In addition, she hopes to be able to grow the business to the point where she can employ a few people.

loans.use: to pay for the development of a website and marketing for her bookkeeping business

loans.name: Chadrec

texts.pt:
O senhor  Chadrec de 47 anos de idade é  pensionista militar, casado pai de 4 filhos todos a  frequentarem o ensino primário,  vive em casa própria.
Diz que com os empréstimos anteriores  começou a sua obra tipo 2, e adquiriu alguns bens. Com este  pretende comprar cimento, varões, chapas de zinco, arames ,pregos,  pedra, e areia  para dar continuidade da sua obra .
O seu sonho é terminar a obra, fazer um muro de vedação na sua casa, mobilar para oferecer um lar melhor  a família.
Tem como desafios  a insuficiência de fundos e que pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos
texts.en:
Chadrec is 47 years old and is on a military pension. He is a married father of four children who all go to primary school and he lives in his own home.

Chadrec tells us that with his previous loans he began building a two bedroom home and acquired some goods. With this loan he plans to buy cement, rods, tin sheeting, wire, nails, stones and sand to continue building. 

Chadrec's dream is to finish building, create a fence around his house and furnish it to provide a comfortable home for his family. His challenge is not having enough funds, which is why he plans to take out more loans to overcome his difficulties and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy cement, rods, tin sheeting, wire, nails, stones and sand

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a smallholder farmer from a rural home in Central, Kenya. To Justus, livestock farming is not only a source of income but also a livelihood. He has been doing dairy farming for years, and he is still committed to the growth of his farm.

Justus is seeking a loan to buy a beef cow. He plans to spend a small part of the loan on the cow’s insurance as a risk-mitigating measure to protect his family from slipping further into debt or poverty in the event the cow dies before it matures. He plans to sell the cow at a much higher price in the future when it is fully grown. 

The impact this loan will have on Justus and his family include financial inclusion, business growth, capital accumulation, and increase in income. His ultimate goal is to elevate the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a beef cow

loans.name: Fatou

texts.en:
Fatou was born and raised in The Gambia in West Africa and has lived in the United States for 23 years. She runs a traveling business from her home while also working a full-time job. She lives with her spouse and children and financially supports family members back home. Fatou became a business owner because she always had a desire to run her own business. Fatou enjoys offering traveling services because it is easy for her to manage while also working her full-time job. Her greatest success in running her business has been finding new clients and having a successful online presence. However, she struggles with raising the capital she needs to further invest in her business. 

Fatou is currently seeking a loan to raise a capital base for her business that would allow her to improve how she provides her services. Within the next five years, Fatou envisions having upgraded from a home-based business to a large-scale office space with added services like insurance. She would like to grow her business and someday hire a small team of employees to assist her in executing her business goals.

loans.use: to raise a capital base that will allow her to improve and grow her travel business

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en: Sothea is 22 years old and a single shop assistant who resides in the Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. She has been working as an employee since 2014, earning around $4 per day. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in management at the university in the province. Due to the fact that she is short of the finances to pay her tuition fees for the fourth year, she would like to request a loan. This is her second loan cycle with Kiva. With this loan, she will be able to cover her university fees and successfully earn a bachelor’s degree. After graduation, she dreams of saving money to run her own business and build her own proper house.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees for her fourth year.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 29-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in a rural community near Honiara, the capital city of the Solomon Islands.

She buys vegetables from the farmers and sells them at the market to earn a living, and has been doing this for three years.

Jacinta needs a loan to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, green peppers, cabbages, eggplants, and bananas so she can run her market business. She hopes to cover her family's weekly expenses with the profit she makes, and also provide a better education for her children.

She recently joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, green peppers, eggplants, onions, and bananas for her market stall.

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en:
Fifty-five-year-old Gliceria earns a living by engaging in a direct selling business. She sold Cospachem products like soap, toothpaste, lotion, and other beauty products. In addition to that, she also sells Barley products, mostly beauty soap and skin whitening lotion. 

She is married with seven children. Two of her children, aged 19 and 16, are still attending school. She has been engaged in this kind of business for ten years now. Her husband works as a carpenter.

She is asking for a loan to purchase Barley products such as beauty soap. These will help boost Gliceria's income and enable her to augment her daily income. With these, she could make some capital and start to settle her finances. She could continue to send her children to school and be able to expand her current business as well.

Gliceria dreams of handling her retail business successfully and opening up a sari-sari (variety) store for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase Barley beauty products.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita is 47 years old. She is known in the Tudela, Misamis Occidental area for her sari-sari store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, galvanized iron sheets and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters to her that she has been given priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all the financing needs of her retail business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, galvanized iron sheets and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yen, born in 1965, is a member of the Kinh ethnic majority. She currently lives with her husband, her son, her daughter-in-law and her son's child in Mai Son district, Son La province. 
	
Her family lives mainly on income from livestock cultivation and breeding. The income is just enough to cover their living expenses, and she has saved a small amount from that income. She wants to expand the breeding business by raising more chickens but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to take out a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to earn money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding with high productivity. Then, when selling the chickens, they will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for breeding.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina has dreamed of starting her own business as a life coach for many years. With the start of her new business, Paulina will help seniors work through issues facing the baby boomer generation, such as the loss of a spouse, retirement, problems with children and more. In sharing her wisdom with peers, Paulina's ultimate goal is to help seniors live life to the fullest. 

Originally from England, Paulina has been in the United States for over 40 years. She received a master’s degree in social work and then went on to assist disadvantaged children in the foster care system for many years. She currently works as a wellness coach and personal trainer, which has further improved her listening skills and ability to empathize with others.  

Paulina will be offering a variety of coaching options including one-on-one sessions, weekly calls and community presentations. She plans on attracting new clientele through her attendance at local meetup groups, baby boomer socials and AARP events. She will also use social media and baby boomer websites to reach a wider audience. 

Paulina will use her Kiva loan to receive a prestigious life coaching certification. This certification lends her greater credibility as a coach and gives her a unique advantage when marketing her business.

loans.use: to pay for a life coaching certification
